Title: Supply Chain Data Scientist (Executive)
Company: BASF Asia Pacific Service Centre Sdn Bhd
Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
Requirements: You will focus on designing and implementing (along with counterparts and solution architects) Supply Chain Nerve Center solutions for BASF GB Supply chain services. In addition, you will need to understand the customers' requirements and design solutions. As part of the digital transformation, you will play a key role in change management and communication to stakeholders. | Collaborating with cross-functional / cross-regional teams to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for leveraging data-driven solutions. | Job Requirements: |
Description:
Objectives of the Position:
Digitalization will be part of our DNA at GB. We will change processes that will simplify life within but also outside of GB, sometimes even without our BASF colleagues noticing it. Within GB, we will use digital tools to stop us spending too much time on tasks that hinder us from doing the things that are really needed, such as consulting our service recipients. Digital tools will free up our time to help our internal partners and we will be able to actively shape our division’s digital footprint.
GB Strategy is to transform Kuala Lumpur Hub into a digital Hub to support BASF. GB Supply chain team is looking for an exceptional Supply chain data scientist to support in development and implementation of new digital tools that will help operations.
You will focus on designing and implementing (along with counterparts and solution architects) Supply Chain Nerve Center solutions for BASF GB Supply chain services. In addition, you will need to understand the customers' requirements and design solutions. As part of the digital transformation, you will play a key role in change management and communication to stakeholders.  
Main Areas of Responsibilities and Key Activities:
Responsibilities:
Collaborating with cross-functional / cross-regional teams to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for leveraging data-driven solutions.
Work with data engineers to develop and implement robust data pipelines using Azure Data factory and Databricks, ensuring efficient and reliable data preparation.
Assisting in the development of machine learning models for various use cases such as lead time prediction, carrier recommendations, anomaly detection etc.
Deploying machine learning models into production environments and monitoring their performance to ensure optimal results.
Conducting in-depth analyses of complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that can drive improvements in supply chain operations.
Presenting findings and recommendations to stakeholders through clear visualizations and reports.
Continuously staying up to date with the latest advancements in data science techniques, tools, and best practices
Job Requirements:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related field
Working Experience:
1–2 years of experience in data analytics or data science (internships included)
Technical & Professional Knowledge:
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms, especially Azure Databricks, and Data Factory.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated individual with strong problem-solving abilities and a passion for continuous learning.

Title: Assistant Data Analysis Manager
Description:
Job Description:
As an Assistant Data Analyst Manager at CHAGEE Headquarters, you will lead a team responsible for extracting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various primary and secondary sources. Your role will involve overseeing the development and maintenance of databases, performing complex data analysis, and preparing reports to support decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities:
- Utilize automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources efficiently.
- Identify and rectify coding errors and corrupted data to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
- Develop and maintain databases and data systems, reorganizing data into a readable format for analysis.
- Perform in-depth analysis to assess the quality and significance of data, identifying patterns and trends.
- Filter data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems.
- Utilize statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets, facilitating diagnosis and prediction.
- Assign numerical value to essential business functions for assessing and comparing business performance over time.
- Analyze local, national, and global trends impacting the organization and the industry.
- Prepare comprehensive reports for management, stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
- Present final analysis reports to stakeholders, enabling them to make informed decisions based on various facts and trends.

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field.
- Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a managerial role.
- Proficiency in data extraction tools and database management systems.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
- Familiarity with statistical tools and techniques for data analysis and interpretation.
- Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information effectively.
- Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
- Attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting.

If you have a passion for data analysis and leadership, and you are eager to contribute to CHAGEE's data-driven decision-making processes, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join us in leveraging data insights to drive business success and innovation.

Join us as a part of AIA Group today!
Roles & Responsibilities:
Responsible for data pipeline management which including developing, maintaining, testing and optimizing the data pipelines.
Able to work with data reporting tools such as PowerBI and Alteryx if needed.
Analyze and troubleshooting issues related to staging, orchestration and transformation for data models under Group Application Data Platform.
Monitor the performance of data pipeline management (including staging. Orchestration and transformation) and optimize resources to ensure cost-effectiveness and high availability.
Support, maintain and monitor data pipeline management against SLAs.
Ensure data pipeline operates under appropriate parameters.
Resolve operational problems related to data availability/refresh for users reporting timeline.
Ability to troubleshoot and resolve any issues that arise as reported by users.

Ensure that existing guidelines, standards and best practices are followed and applied to development projects.
Take ownership for issues to reach resolutions to prevent recurrences.
Troubleshoot and resolve production issues under tight deadlines.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders to understand business challenges and opportunities, transforming raw data into valuable insights. You will be responsible for sourcing, cleaning, and analyzing data, uncovering patterns and trends that drive strategic decisions. By creating clear and effective data visualizations, you will present your findings in a way that simplifies complex information, supporting the development of data-driven products and initiatives.
The Data Analyst will report to Chief Product Officer directly.
 Job Responsibilities: 
Collaborating with stakeholders to define business challenges or opportunities.
Sourcing, cleaning, and preparing data for analysis.
Analyzing data to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
Creating data visualizations to simplify complex information.
Presenting findings in a compelling way that supports strategic decision-making and contributes to building data-driven products.
 Job Requirements: 
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proficient in SQL for querying databases and working with large datasets.
Knowledge on Statistical analysis and data analysis
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Familiarity with Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Experience with ETL processes and understanding of data warehousing concepts.
Strong ability to translate business questions into analytical tasks.
Expertise in data cleaning, preprocessing, and structuring.
Problem-solving abilities to find patterns and actionable insights from data.
Ability to work with large, complex datasets and perform exploratory and statistical analyses. 
Ability to present findings in a clear, concise manner through reports and visual presentations.
Experience collaborating cross-functionally with teams like product, marketing, and sales to identify data-driven solutions.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst, or related role.
Familiarity with relevant industry data, especially if applying for specialized sectors like e-commerce, fintech, online marketplace etc.
 About Xamble Group Limited
Xamble Group Limited is a thriving digital ecosystem that is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX:XGL). From our core business of influencer marketing to digital marketing, performance marketing, social commerce and membership platform – we cultivate communities and drive value for brands, creators and consumers with our end-to-end web3 and generative AI-enabled ecosystem.

Title: Research and Data Analyst
Description:
🔎 About the Role
We’re looking for an experienced Research & Data Analyst to join our dynamic team at PLATFORM ONE (MALAYSIA) SDN. BHD. In this full-time role based in Petaling Jaya, you will be a key contributor to data-driven decision-making, Your analysis and insights will support marketing, business strategy, and research initiatives.
📊 What You’ll Be Doing
Collect, clean, and manage large volumes of data from surveys, digital platforms, and client sources.
Ensure data integrity through thorough cleaning, validation, and transformation of raw datasets.
Develop, optimise, and run SPSS syntax for dataset generation, cleaning, and validation across multiple research projects.
Apply statistical methods, predictive modelling, and segmentation techniques to derive actionable insights.
Conduct detailed cross-tabulation analysis of survey and market datasets; summarise insights in client-facing PowerPoint reports.
Build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools to support internal teams and external clients.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams — including Insights, Product, and Client Success — to translate business needs into analytical outputs.
Manage timelines and deliverables to ensure high-quality insights are produced on schedule.
🎯 What We’re Looking For
Minimum 2 years of experience in a data analysis or research role, preferably within marketing or communications.
Proficient in SPSS, including syntax scripting and batch processing. Familiarity with R or Python is a plus.
Strong command of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentation creation.
Solid foundation in statistical concepts, such as weighting, significance testing, and segmentation.
Experience working with complex survey data and cross-tabulation tools (e.g., Askia, Q, Displayr or similar).
High attention to detail and a strong sense of accountability for data quality.
Ability to prioritise, work independently, and manage multiple projects under tight deadlines.
A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Science, or a related quantitative field.
🎁 What We Offer
Flexible working arrangements and a people-first company culture.
Healthcare benefits.
Opportunities for upskilling and professional certification.
A role that allows you to grow into deeper analytical or research specialisation.
🌍 About Us

PLATFORM ONE (MALAYSIA) SDN. BHD. is part of a global network of researchers, strategists, and technologists. We deliver insight-led marketing and data solutions that help brands make smarter decisions. We're innovative, curious, and committed to excellence — and we’re growing.
Apply now to join our growing team and be a part of our exciting journey!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
PRIZM Group is a global agency with specialisation in digital marketing, social media, big data, and eCommerce with over 200 staff in 5 offices including Hong Kong and Singapore. The group’s expertise lies beyond a mere digital solution but synchronizing MarTech and Creativity to empower the formation of seamless digital experience. In 2022, PRIZM Group was crowned the prestige overall Agency of the Year hosted by Marketing Interactive.
To cope with our rapid growth of HQ, we are setting up our team in Malaysia. We are seeking for English & Cantonese speaking candidates with high calibre to join our new team in Malaysia within an extremely innovative and exciting digital marketing company.

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated data engineer to join our data team. The ideal candidate should have strong knowledge in building data infrastructure and engineering solutions using modern data technologies.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with professional service teams to identify clients' business problems for data pipeline building.
Build scalable data pipelines and infrastructure using modern data technologies such as Databricks, dbt, etc.
Develop and implement ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into our data warehouse.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and availability.
Continuously evaluate and incorporate new technologies and tools to optimize data engineering processes.
Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Big Data, or related field.
Proficiency in Python.
Proficiency in SQL. Experience in No-SQL database is a plus.
Familiarity with building large-scale, distributed systems on cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Experience in data engineering, data warehousing, database design, and data integration.
Experience in big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
Experience in container technologies, such as Docker/Kubernetes.
Ability to work independently.
Excellent communication skills in English and Mandarin to effectively communicate with our diverse client base and stakeholders.. Cantonese is a plus.
At least 2 years of working experience in the related field is required
Candidates with more than 3 years of experience will be considered for the senior position
We offer attractive compensation package to suitable candidates. Interested parties, please click "Apply Now" to submit your application including your present & expected salary.
(Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.)

Title: Engineer, Data Management Engineering
Description:
Job Description
We are looking for a curious and motivated Junior Data Management Engineer with foundational experience in machine learning to join our growing data team. This role is perfect for someone early in their career who is eager to contribute to data engineering tasks while gaining hands-on exposure to machine learning workflows. You'll help ensure data pipelines are optimized for analytics and ML model development, supporting both operational and strategic decision-making.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with multiple stakeholders to identify, diagnose and resolve manufacturing process related problems such as quality excursions, manufacturing excellence and cost improvement.
Responsible to perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) from different data sources and perform correlation find out the best variables for Fault Detection (FD), Prediction and Run-to-Run modelling setup.
Responsible to setup ETL pipeline for data integration from different sources to databases.
Assist in implementing basic machine learning models (e.g., regression, classification) under guidance.
Monitor data quality and support model performance tracking in production.
Design and develop machine learning (ML) applications to implement in manufacturing process.
Build dashboards and reports to visualize process variables, ML outputs and business KPIs.
Document data flows, ML pipelines, and model metadata for transparency and reproducibility.
Qualifications
REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
0–2 years of experience in data analytics, data engineering, or machine learning.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Basic Python programming skills, particularly for data analysis (e.g., pandas, NumPy).
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals (e.g., supervised learning, model evaluation, overfitting).
PREFERRED:
Exposure to building or assisting in ML models using libraries like scikit-learn or TensorFlow.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with version control tools such as Git.
Experience working in cloud environments (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure), especially with ML tools like SageMaker or Vertex AI.
Exposure to ML lifecycle tools like MLflow, DVC, or Kubeflow.
Familiar with semiconductor manufacturing process, control system functions, manufacturing system (MES/RMS) and communication protocols such as SECS-GEM is an added advantage.
SKILLS:
Data preprocessing and feature engineering techniques.
Basic data pipeline development and ETL/ELT workflows.
Ability to interpret and visualize data insights.
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
Effective written and verbal communication.
Team collaboration and a proactive learning attitude.
Additional information
Sandisk thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
Sandisk is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@sandisk.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Sandisk has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Sandisk’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Sandisk and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Sandisk Ethics Helpline or email compliance@sandisk.com.

• Work with large and complex transaction datasets, solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems.

2. 2+ years of experience in data engineering or analytics
3. Proficient in SQL and Python，familiar with databases and tools like Airflow, Spark, or Flink
4. Fluent in both Chinese and English
It's an Outsourced role

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
-Analyze various company metrics across departments to support strategic decision-making.
-Generate regular reports and dashboards with insights and recommendations tailored to each department.
-Monitor departmental KPIs and identify issues or opportunities for improvement.
-Collaborate with departments to understand needs and deliver tailored insights.
-Assist in building standardized processes, analytical models, or automated reporting tools to improve efficiency.
Requirements:
-Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
-Proficient in Microsoft Excel and at least one data analysis tool (e.g., SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Python, or R).
-Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and critical thinking skills.
-Ability to communicate findings clearly and work collaboratively across departments.
-Experience in data visualization and business reporting is an advantage.

Title: Data Analysis Associate (Integrated Operations)
Description:
The Integrated Operations Team is responsible for the strategic planning, execution, and continuous improvement of our core seller programs. Additionally, the team holds ownership of the commercial team’s quarterly target setting and performance management processes, while also administering incentive computations for the commercial team. Furthermore, the team operates the Commercial Academy—a dedicated initiative that designs and deploys soft- and hard-skill training programs to enhance workforce capabilities.
Job Description:
• Analyze and enhance business strategies using data, optimizing resources across various teams, like sales operations, seller programmes.
• Lead our commercial target-setting process to guide business growth effectively, Create and maintain dashboards to keep track of key performance indicators.
• Work with Business Intelligence and Data Product teams to ensure our data is accurate and actionable for key stakeholders.
• Spot trends and opportunities in seller program design for improvements and maintain strong governance of financial viability.
• Monitor seller performance and provide insights to refine seller programs and optimise KAM incentive distributions according the efficient seller target setting process.
• Conduct targeted analyses to solve unique business challenges, offering data-driven solutions. Provide strategic insights to leadership on sales operations, including incentives and profitability models.
• Collaborate with Seller Engagement and Sales Operations teams to manage seller communications and inquiries.
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management or related field.
• At least 3-4 years of experience in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or commercial operations (e-commerce, consulting, or retail).
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills; you thrive in teamwork settings.
• Quick learner who adapts well to changing environments and priorities.
• Solid analytical abilities, especially with Excel; familiarity with data tools such as SQL is a plus but not mandatory.
• Organized, detail-oriented, and self-motivated. Project management experience is a bonus.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Requirements: ·       Understand the requirements and develop a robust data model that will support the current requirements and future business growth. | Requirements |
Description:
Job description
·        Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
·       Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality.
·       Filter and “clean” data by reviewing any kind of unstructured data into readable information, and proceed with analysis.
·       Understand the requirements and develop a robust data model that will support the current requirements and future business growth.
·       Work with management to prioritise business and information needs.

 Requirements

·       Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages tools, databases, programming , or ETL .
·       Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets .
·       Experience in BI development like Data Warehouse and Reporting environment will be an advantage.
·       Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.

Title: Warehouse - Data Analyst
Description:
*Normal Office Hour*
* 5 Working Days a Week*
 About us
About us Welcome to Mastering Group, a distinguished conglomerate committed to setting new benchmarks across various industries. Our firm foundation is built on a core philosophy that places excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction at the forefront of all our endeavors. MiX Store stands as a premier retail chain store in Malaysia, with over 100 outlets we elevating the culinary experience since our inception in 2005. Our unwavering commitment revolves around bringing the latest and most sought-after global snacks, renowned beverages, and captivating products to the Malaysian market. We take pride in our extensive import portfolio, showcasing an array of trendy items that have captivated the palates of our diverse customer base.
 Job Overview
We are looking for an entry-level Warehouse Data Analyst to support daily inventory tracking and reporting. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, comfortable working with data, and eager to grow in a fast-paced warehouse or supply chain environment.
 Job Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
Inventory Tracking & Reporting
Monitor and report daily, weekly, and monthly inventory data to ensure accuracy between physical stock and system records. This includes conducting regular stock reconciliations, promptly identifying and resolving discrepancies, and maintaining accurate documentation to support smooth warehouse operations.
Data Analysis & Insights
Analyze inventory trends to identify issues such as overstock, shortages, or slow-moving items. Deliver actionable recommendations based on data insights to optimize inventory management, reduce holding costs, and improve operational efficiency.
Supply Coordination
Collaborate closely with the procurement team to adjust upstream supply orders based on inventory levels and demand forecasts. Ensure timely communication with suppliers and internal teams to maintain optimal stock levels and avoid overstock or stockouts.
 Job Requirements
Diploma or Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Business, or related field.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (functions, PivotTables, charts).
Detail-oriented with strong numeric and analytical skills.
Able to work independently and communicate clearly.
Proficiency in English, Mandarin and Bahasa Malaysia is essential for effective communication within our multinational team. 
Own transportation is required.
FRESH GRADUATES ARE WELCOMED.

Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid Working)
Requirements: Qualifications | We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us. |
Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
SEEK operates market-leading online employment marketplaces, including Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia. SEEK has been helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helping organisations succeed for over 25 years.
Founded and headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, SEEK has grown into a multinational technology company with over 3,300 employees and is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange.
SEEK’s presence spans Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore and Thailand. Additionally, SEEK has minority investments in employment marketplaces in China, South Korea and Bangladesh.
SEEK develops and applies innovative data and technology tools to facilitate high-quality matching and improve reliability of marketplace information.
In 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, SEEK was recognised as one of Australia’s Top Ten Places to Work in Technology in the AFR BOSS Best Places to Work awards. SEEK was also named a 5-Star Employer of Choice by HRD Asia in 2024 and won four accolades at TalentCorp’s Life at Work Awards 2023 in Malaysia.
Job Description
Join SEEK Pass, the trusted digital passport revolutionizing how people manage and share their verified credentials across the job market. We're a fast-growing scale-up within SEEK, operating across Malaysia, Australia, and beyond.
What You'll Do
Be the Analytics Champion
Drive data-driven decision making across our entire product suite
Build dashboards and KPI monitoring that guide strategic decisions
Partner with engineering, product, and operations to uncover game-changing insights
Analyze user behavior, funnel performance, and business metrics that directly impact millions of users
Shape Product Strategy
Conduct A/B testing and statistical analysis to optimize user experience
Provide analytical support for multiple product squads simultaneously
Deliver strategic business analysis that influences our roadmap
Help evolve our analytics infrastructure and tooling
Qualifications
 What We're Looking For
SQL Expert: Advanced skills in managing complex, large-scale datasets
Storyteller: Ability to find meaning in data and communicate insights clearly
Analytics Pro: Experience with A/B testing, funnel analysis, and statistical significance
Tool Savvy: Familiarity with Tableau, Databricks, Python/R is highly valued
Collaborative: Strong communication skills across technical and business teams
Startup Mindset: Comfortable with ambiguity and willing to roll up your sleeves
Why This Role?
Work in a cross-functional scale-up environment with 80+ talented people across KL, Melbourne, and Sydney. You'll have direct impact on a product that's transforming how people showcase their credentials to employers, while being part of SEEK's larger data science community.
Desired Values
Believed in aiming high to deliver world-class results and yet, not forgetting to care for others
Additional Information
At SEEK we offer:
Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days  as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Communicate with stakeholders and understand the entire data extraction requirement. | Job Requirements: |
Description:
Key Duties & Responsibilities:
Communicate with stakeholders and understand the entire data extraction requirement. 
Clean input data, then perform bulk data extraction, and check the data integrity, and conduct analysis of the output data in a timely manner.
Conduct ad hoc analysis to support other departments i.e. sales, marketing, operations, and request from management.
Identify and rectify data integrity issues and liaise with members and respective data sources/owners.
Verify and investigate credit rating and score enquiry against the credit information, and provide useful advice to the enquirer for external and internal stakeholders.
Work closely with project and software team to improve end-to-end process.
Any other task assigned by management
 Job Requirements:
At least a Bachelor's Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Computer Science / Actuarial Studies / Economics or equivalent.
Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.
Proficient in Excel and programming languages like Python and SQL.
Capability to produce detailed and factually accurate and easily comprehensible reports.
Knowledge and experience in SQL and/or Statistic will be an added advantage.
Strong organizational skills and ability to work independently to meet deadlines
Good communication and interpersonal skills with attention to details and strong work ethic.
*Our recruitment team will reach out to shortlisted candidates only.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst, Executive
Company: Tokio Marine Life Insurance Malaysia Bhd
Requirements: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions. | Job Requirements: |
Description:
Job Function:
We are seeking for a skilled Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst to help us leverage the data to drive business insights and growth. The ideal candidate should possess a strong background in data and business analysis, along with analytical and communication skills. A sound business understanding and problem-solving abilities are also desired.
Key Responsibilities:
Collect, process and analyze datasets with different data structures to extract meaningful insights.
Support the design of data warehouse and/or data marts to ensure data analytics takes place in an efficient, scalable and accurate way.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders through data visualization and presentations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Support upgrades, configurations and troubleshooting of business intelligence and data tools.
Monitor and administer automated ETL or data processes to verify execution and measure performance
Prepare documentation as part of knowledge transfer.
Job Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
Proficiency in Python, R, and SQL.
Understanding of statistical techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, and clustering.
Hands-on experience with ETL tools and processes.
In-depth understanding of database management systems and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework and familiar with BI technologies
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Possess good verbal and written communication skills in English.
Full-Time position(s) available.

Title: Marketing Executive - Data Analyst
Description:
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Candidate must possess least Diploma or Degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, Economics, or related fields (e.g., eCommerce, fintech, SaaS)
At least 1–2 years of experience in marketing, CRM, or data analytics roles (Fresh graduates with strong internship exposure are welcome to apply)
Proficient in Excel/Google Sheets; basic knowledge of SQL is an advantage
Experience using tools like Google Analytics, Power BI, Tableau, or CRM/email marketing platforms
Good understanding of marketing metrics (e.g., CAC, LTV, revenue, conversion rate)
Strong analytical mindset and interest in customer behavior
Able to translate data into simple, practical insights
Detail-oriented, proactive, and eager to learn
Good communication and teamwork skills
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Collect and analyze customer data from various platforms (e.g., app/website, CRM, email/SMS, loyalty)
Segment users based on behavior and engagement to support campaigns
Track and analyze campaign performance (retention, churn, ROI)
Work closely with marketing and UI/UX teams to improve the customer journey
Monitor key user metrics like DAU/MAU, session time, conversion funnels
Provide insights to improve targeting, content, and marketing strategies
Assist in evaluating loyalty program effectiveness and user satisfaction

Title: Management Trainee (Business Analyst)
Description:
MANAGEMENT TRAINEE PROGRAMME – BUSINESS ANALYST 
 Why Join Us?
Attractive Remuneration: Up to RM4,000/month (performance-based)
Data-Driven Impact: Play a key role in shaping business decisions through accurate, timely data and insights
Career Development Pathway: Clear route into Business Strategy & Operations Improvement roles
Continuous Learning: Sharpen your analytical, reporting, and problem-solving skills in a dynamic industry
 Key Responsibilities
Track and follow up on departmental improvement items to support performance targets.
Collect, organize, and maintain business data to ensure accuracy and relevance for decision-making.
Prepare, update, and present reports, dashboards, and actionable recommendations to internal stakeholders.
Collaborate across departments (Finance, Marketing, Technical, Product) to support initiatives and resolve operational challenges.
Analyze customer and market data to drive insights that improve sales productivity and operational efficiency.
Provide timely data inputs for monthly and quarterly business reviews.
Support ad-hoc data analysis and reporting requests from management.
 Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Data Analytics, or any related discipline.
Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.
Detailed-oriented, strong organizational, analytical, and critical thinking skills.
Proficiency in Excel.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Self-driven, positive attitude, high ownership, resourceful, and eager to learn.
 For more information on our company, please visit us at:-
Website: https://www.tmkchemical.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/tmkchemical/

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Power BI / Python)
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Develop, maintain, and optimize interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI for various departments (e.g., Marketing, Sales, HR, Ops).
Perform data modeling, cleaning, and transformation from multiple sources (Google Sheets, Excel, SQL databases, etc.).
Use Python (Pandas, NumPy, etc.) to automate workflows, data analysis, and forecasting models.
Provide deep-dive data analysis and trends to support business decisions, campaigns, or operational improvements.
Collaborate closely with key stakeholders to define metrics, KPIs, and reporting standards across departments.
Ensure data quality, governance, and consistency across platforms.
Identify performance gaps, patterns, and optimization opportunities based on internal data.
Support the company’s transition into data-centric operations, including training or enabling other team members when needed.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum 3–5 years of experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Proficient in Power BI and/or Python for analysis and reporting.
Strong understanding of data querying (SQL) and relational databases.
Experience in building and managing KPI dashboards.
Excellent communication skills — able to explain insights to non-technical users.
Highly detail-oriented, analytical, and business-driven mindset.
Nice to Have:
Experience working in a fast-paced, multi-departmental business environment.
Familiarity with data connectors/APIs, Google Workspace, or automation tools (e.g., Power Automate).
Prior exposure to business operations, digital marketing, or HR analytics is a plus.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our team. The BI Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data to provide actionable insights, support strategic decision-making, and optimize business performance. The candidate will play a key role in delivering data-driven recommendations to enhance customer experience, maximize revenue, and improve operational efficiency.
 RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze large data sets from various sources, including customer behavior, product performance, and financial metrics, to identify trends and opportunities.
Develop, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reporting tools to visualize data and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work closely with stakeholders, including marketing, operations, and product teams, to provide data insights that support strategic business decisions.
Monitor and evaluate customer activity, including churn rates, customer segmentation, and lifetime value (LTV) to inform marketing and retention strategies.
Identify opportunities for optimization in product offerings, customer acquisition, and retention strategies.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to answer business questions, troubleshoot performance issues, and suggest improvements.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure accurate data collection, storage, and retrieval.
Present findings and recommendations to management in clear and concise reports or presentations.
Assist in forecasting models, predictive analytics, and other advanced data techniques to enhance decision-making.
 SKILLS
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data sets.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present data-driven insights to non-technical stakeholders.
 REQUIREMENTS
Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 - 4 years of professional experience in BI.
Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes is a plus.
Proven experience as a BI Analyst.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Metabase and Power BI.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with databases to extract and analyze data.
Familiarity with statistical tools and methods for data analysis and modeling is a plus.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver accurate results in a fast-paced environment.
 BENEFITS
5 Working days
Casual (e.g. T-shirts)
EPF & SOCSO
Team Buildings
Plenty of Coffee & Snacks
Annual and medical leave
Performance Bonus
Open, Friendly, and Positive Working Environment

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur (Hybrid)
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
Quantitative analysis is a vital component in the day-to-day operations within Soprano and our team in KL are excited to welcome an Inquisitive big data navigator to impact and shape the future of our business. As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be tasked with analysing, deriving insights, and execute strategies to grow GP in a competitive trading-like setting. The role involves navigating and strategizing in imperfect information scenarios and executing it in a detailed tactical level to directly improve monetary and service results.
Using a variety of quantitative and stochastic methods, you will have the opportunity to translate complex mathematical methods into business outcomes. You will also have the chance to communicate these ideas and analysis to senior leadership. By helping the organisation make informed decisions, take risks with high expected value while navigating and hedging against said risk and uncertainty, you have a direct and significant influence on the profitability of the business.
If you're a lover of stress-testing ideas, debating risk vs reward and wants to be part of a team that respects unique ideas and room to experiment, let us know by applying today!
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
This includes but is not limited to:
Develop, implement, validate, and continuously improve quantitative models to analyse and derive insight from data.
Understand the data at a deep hands-on level to control outcomes at a fine granular level.
Automate the analysis and models to run in real time and at scale.
Develop trading strategies to boost GP, hedge against risk and balance conflicting outcomes in imperfect game theory scenarios
Proactively look for ways to measure and obtain information, including competitor pricing analysis, behaviour analysis in a multi-competitor competition, and implementing indirect metrics to create emergent variables to handle and measure uncertain factors.
Present and communicate analysis, insights, and strategies to various internal stakeholders in a relevant and understandable manner.
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE TO SUCCEED
At least 2 years of experience in utilising quantitative techniques on business or financial data.
Experience in implementing mathematical and machine learning models in programming languages such as Python, R, Haskell etc.
Excellent and creative problem solving and critical thinking skills
Experience in developing and executing strategies to improve monetary outcomes, including managing exit strategies and hedging against risk.
Solid background in mathematics, statistics, game theory, and stochastic modelling.
Must be independent and self-directed.
Demonstrate high standards of performance and behaviour
ABOUT US
Headquartered in Sydney, Australia, and operating globally, Soprano Design is a leading global communications platform as a service (CPaaS) provider that brings nearly 30 years of experience with enterprise-level mobile messaging to each of our over 4,500 government and enterprise clients around the globe.
Soprano’s flagship product, Soprano Connect, is an innovative award-winning CPaaS platform that helps customers to strategically integrate, email, SMS, voice, conversational AI, IP messaging and social channels such as RCS, WhatsApp and Google Business Messages into a seamless secure omni-channel business mobile messaging experience.
WHY WORK FOR SOPRANO:
Work for a leader in the CPaaS industry: We are a leading enabler for enterprise communications, with a customer-centered approach that allows us to reach significant results with our clients and partners.
Our focus on Technology: We pride ourselves on building technology for the future of communication that creates richer meanings, deeper trust and better connections.
Global presence: Soprano is headquartered in Sydney, but we have a global presence in Europe, North America, South America, New Zealand and Southeast Asia
Collaborative and inclusive environment: We are committed to a workplace environment where every employee is respected and empowered to be their best selves at work.
Training and Development: We’re a small company with global presence that allows you to gain valuable insight and exposure to various markets worldwide
Competitive salaries: We are a pay for performance company that values your contributions through our competitive salaries, rewards and recognition programs
Flexible Working: We’re a lover of hybrid working, and this allows us to stay connected to our global teams while allocating time to do the things we love. Some roles are remote due to scope.
People are at the core of what we do and Soprano Design Pty Ltd is committed to a safe, diverse and inclusive workplace where we all thrive and succeed together. We encourage applications regardless of age, gender, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures. Please let us know if you require any adjustments to the recruitment process.
All successful applicants will need to providing two professional reference checks and is subject to satisfactory background checks

Description:
Job Description
Key Responsibilities:
 Accurately label and categorize large datasets, including text, audio, images, and video.
Review and correct data annotations to ensure quality and consistency.
Work closely with the AI and Machine Learning teams to understand project-specific guidelines.
Provide feedback to improve the data annotation process.
Meet daily/weekly annotation targets while maintaining high-quality standards.
 Requirements:
 Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Basic computer skills and familiarity with online tools.

Some English Language capabilities an advantage as some tooling may have an English UI. Additionally, some training may be only available in English (but may be translated).

Title: Data Analyst (Fresh Graduate Opportunity/Internship placement)
Description:
Fresh Graduate Program:
Fresh Graduate Program of Huawei Malaysia is ongoing. This program offers outstanding local talents fixed-term contracts for an accelerated career, to boost their career while participating in multiple countries' ICT development.
 Target Audience:
Fresh graduate who is going to graduate or has graduated in year 2024 and 2025.
Undergraduate student who is looking for internship placement in year 2025.
 Job Descriptions
Data Analysis: Review and analyze telecommunication data from various markets to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.
Data Mining: Extract and analyze large volumes of data to discover patterns and insights.
Data Modelling: Develop statistical models to understand and predict customer behavior or market trends.
Data Profiling: Assess the quality, structure, and integrity of data to ensure it is suitable for analysis or use in business decisions.
Reporting: Create comprehensive reports and visualizations to communicate data-driven insights to internal stakeholders across different regions.
Data Management: Collect, analyze, and store data in an organized manner for efficient retrieval and compliance with international data regulations.
 Requirements
Pursuing or completed a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Data Science / Mathematics / Statistics or a related field. Candidates from other fields may also be considered on a case-by-case basis.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis and visualization software (Python, SQL, Excel, Tableau) and basic knowledge of coding languages, machine learning, and software development.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive insights from data.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with international teams.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistics and mathematical concepts.
Adaptability: Able to adapt to challenges and pressure in a fast-paced environment.
 *Positions are offered by Huawei or Huawei's Service Provider.

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
1. Monitor and record daily transactions accurately.

2. Prepare and maintain spending summary reports.

3. Reconcile spending and incoming funds to ensure accuracy across systems.

4. Generate data reports and monitor internal system activities.

5. Ensure strong data integrity through validation and reconciliation between source systems.

Requirements:

- Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.

- Minimum of 1 year of working experience in a similar role.
- Mandarin/ Cantonese speaker

- Proficient in Microsoft Excel.

- Experience with report automation (e.g., script implementation, formula-based reporting, or dashboard creation).

- Strong organizational and time-management skills.

- High attention to detail and accuracy.

- Ability to handle confidential information with integrity.

- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

- Able to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

Title: IT Business Analyst
Requirements: Requirements | Requirement Gathering: Conduct comprehensive analysis of business processes, collect stakeholder requirements, and translate them into detailed technical specifications. | System Design and Modification: Collaborate with IT and development teams to design or modify systems that meet business requirements. Utilize tools like UML, flowcharts, and wireframes for system documentation. | Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of system requirements, technical specifications, test cases, and user manuals. | Risk Management: Identify risks associated with system deployments, ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, and propose mitigation strategies. |
Description:
Requirements
Educational Background
Bachelor's Degree: In Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
Advanced Degree (Optional): MBA or a Master's in Information Systems is preferred for senior roles.
Preferred Experience
3+ years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst or in a similar role.
Experience in API testing, data analysis, and enterprise system integration.
Proven track record in managing projects and delivering successful outcomes.
Skills and Expertise
Technical Skills
Proficiency with API testing tools like Postman, SoapUI, and other API integration platforms.
Strong understanding of operating systems, databases (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle), and networking principles.
Hands-on experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and advanced Microsoft Excel functionalities.
Familiarity with software development lifecycle (SDLC) practices and tools like Git, Jenkins, and JIRA.
Knowledge of programming languages such as SQL, Python, or Java is highly desirable.
Experience with enterprise software systems such as ERP (SAP, Oracle ERP) and CRM platforms like Salesforce.
Exposure to automated testing tools like Selenium and load testing tools such as JMeter is a plus.
 Business Skills
Strong understanding of business processes, workflows, and industry-specific standards.
Expertise in project management methodologies like Agile and Scrum. Certifications such as PMP or CSM are advantageous.
Problem-solving and decision-making skills for effective business solutions.
Soft Skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective stakeholder engagement.
Strong interpersonal skills to work collaboratively with diverse teams.
Adaptability and eagerness to stay updated with the latest technologies and methodologies.
Responsibility
Requirement Gathering: Conduct comprehensive analysis of business processes, collect stakeholder requirements, and translate them into detailed technical specifications.
System Design and Modification: Collaborate with IT and development teams to design or modify systems that meet business requirements. Utilize tools like UML, flowcharts, and wireframes for system documentation.
API Testing and Integration: Work with tools such as Postman and SoapUI to test APIs, validate integration points, and ensure seamless communication between systems.
Implementation and Support: Lead system implementation projects, oversee updates and upgrades, and troubleshoot technical issues to ensure systems run smoothly. Provide training and support to users as needed.
Monitoring and Evaluation: Continuously monitor system performance, evaluate effectiveness, and recommend improvements to meet evolving business needs.
Data Analysis: Use data analysis tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel to extract, analyze, and present actionable insights to stakeholders.
Communication: Act as the primary liaison between IT teams and business units, translating complex technical concepts into business-friendly language.
Testing and Quality Assurance: Conduct end-to-end testing of systems using tools like Selenium or JIRA to ensure functionality, performance, and reliability.
Project Management: Lead and participate in cross-functional projects using methodologies like Agile or Scrum. Ensure timely delivery of project milestones within budget and scope.
Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of system requirements, technical specifications, test cases, and user manuals.
Risk Management: Identify risks associated with system deployments, ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, and propose mitigation strategies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Overview:
This role requires a dynamic individual who can leverage data visualization, analysis, and trend identification to support business decision-making while also providing strategic insights to drive process improvements and efficiency. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Tableau and/or Power BI, with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to interpret complex datasets to uncover meaningful patterns that enhance business performance.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop interactive dashboards and data-driven reports using Tableau and/or Power BI, translating raw data into actionable insights.
Conduct in-depth data analysis and trend forecasting to identify opportunities for business improvement.
Utilize data visualization techniques to communicate findings in a clear and impactful way.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business objectives and provide data-backed recommendations.
Support decision-making, strategy planning, and process optimization using structured data analysis.
Implement and manage data warehousing solutions for efficient storage and retrieval.
Apply basic coding (Python) skills for automation and advanced data manipulation.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy, maintaining high standards in reporting and analysis.
Qualifications and Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics) or a professional certification in data analysis.
Strong proficiency in Tableau and/or Power BI (experience in both is a plus).
Expertise in data visualization, trend analysis, and business intelligence.
Experience in data warehousing, SQL, and structured reporting is highly desirable.
Basic programming knowledge in Python for automation and analysis.
Strong problem-solving abilities with a business-driven approach to analysis.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain complex data in a clear, business-relevant manner.
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of statistical modeling, predictive analytics, or AI-driven business solutions.
Familiarity with process optimization, forecasting, and strategic planning.
Experience in business performance metrics and financial analysis

Title: Finance Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
Summary
If you have strong Power BI skills (60%) combined with solid financial analysis experience (40%), and you're looking for a high-impact role with global exposure—this opportunity is for you. You'll be working closely with senior leaders on high-visibility projects that offer strong growth potential and strategic influence.
As Financial Data and Reporting Analyst, you will be part of the Corporate Controlling team
and responsible for the following
key aspects with a global scope:
- Automation, Modelling and Linking
- Project and Process Management
- Global Management Reporting
- Performance Monitoring
- Financial Analysis
Your Tasks
As part of the central Group Controlling team, you will manage the transformation of existing fragmented management information packages into our online platform in MS Power BI.
For important global projects, you will be responsible for the creation and development of management reports and the underlying processes in close collaboration with local, regional, and global finance teams
Create and maintain interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis with components from various data sources.
Drive continuous improvement of key controlling products/tools.
Support the day-to-day business of the central Group Controlling team in terms of ad hoc requests.
Your profile
Should have handson exposure on Handling P&L Data & Financial Analysis
Proven professional experience (>4 years) as a Financial analyst.
At least three years of strong experience with MS Power BI and MS Office applications in particular MS Excel.
Experience in the organization of projects and the associated process management.
Skillful querying, report writing and presentation of results.
Very good communication skills and assertiveness.
BS or MSc in Economics (focus Controlling and ideally IT-related), Information Management, Mathematics or Statistics.

Title: Senior Executive, Content Analytics (Data Collection & Analysis)
Requirements: Qualification & Work Experience | Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other related qualification from a recognized university. |
Description:
Job Summary
Supervise, formulate, develop, lead and manage large data sets to support policy development and regulatory compliance through data-driven insights, and work closely with cross-functional teams to drive high-impact business decisions, ensuring the organization's objectives of high awareness, responsiveness, and engagement are achieved.
Job Responsibilities:
Data Collection and Processing
Lead and manage large sets of structured and unstructured data from various sources such as internal databases, third-party APIs, and web scraping. Supervise data cleaning tasks to address missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies, ensuring the data is accurate and reliable. Preprocess data by normalizing, transforming, and encoding it to prepare for analysis and modelling, ensuring it meets the required quality standards.
Data Analysis
Formulate and apply statistical techniques to analyze data, identifying significant patterns, correlations, and trends to inform business decisions. Utilize machine learning algorithms to build models that predict outcomes, classify data, and uncover hidden patterns. Interpret the results of data analysis to generate actionable insights that drive business strategies and operational improvements.
Model Development
Develop and supervise predictive models to forecast future trends, customer behavior, and other key business metrics using historical data. Implement machine-learning algorithms tailored to specific business problems, optimizing them for accuracy and efficiency. Ensure models are understandable to stakeholders by translating complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights.
Visualization
Formulate and develop interactive dashboards to visualize key metrics, trends, and insights, making data accessible to stakeholders. Utilize visualization tools or custom-built solutions to present data in a compelling and easily digestible format. Create visual narratives that effectively communicate data insights, aiding stakeholders in making informed decisions.
Collaboration
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, operations, and product development, to understand their data needs and deliver tailored solutions. Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
Research
Keep up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Explore new data sources, analytical methods, and technologies to enhance the organization's data capabilities and maintain a competitive edge. Engage in continuous learning through courses, conferences, and professional networks to keep skills and knowledge current.
Automation
Develop, lead and maintain automated Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes to streamline data flow from source systems to analytical platforms. Implement automation to enhance data processing efficiency, reducing manual intervention and minimizing errors. Supervise and ensure data is readily available for analysis by creating robust data pipelines that support both real-time and batch processing needs.
Impact and Risk Assessment
Lead and assess associated and risks with critical cases/ action. Escalate and propose courses of actions for consideration and approval of Head department.
Standards and Reporting
Supervise, formulate and reinforce standards for scheduled reporting to articulate stakeholder expectations clearly, ensuring their understanding.
Single Source of Truth
Supervise and implement methodologies and processes to maintain single source of truth for reporting and analytics purposes.
Unit Management and Development
Supervise and manage a robust team with unit staff. Set clear objectives, collaborate with direct reports on effective execution strategies, monitor progress, communicate outcomes, and supervise the management and development of unit staff.
Qualification & Work Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other related qualification from a recognized university.
Minimum 3 - 5 years working experience, with strong knowledge in data mining, machine learning, big data frameworks, as well sound understandings of legal and regulatory frameworks.
Technical Competencies/Skills
Programming language skills (Phython, R, or Java)
Data visualization (Tableau, Power BI or D3.js) 4 SQL and database management systems
Big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure or Google Cloud)
Emerging technology synthesis
Governance
Partnership management
Risk assessment and management
Quality standards and assurance
Microsoft Office
 Behavioral Competencies/Skills
Resilience
Critical thinking
Analytical thinking
Communication skills
Interpersonal skills
Stakeholder management
Conflict management
Negotiation skills
Time management with sense of urgency
Collaboration skills
Confidence
Concern about order
Attention to detail
  Candidate must be willing to work in Cyberjaya.

Bridging the gap between customer and developer

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Communicating with client service to understand data content, business and analysis requirement | Qualifications: |
Description:
PURPOSE
Provide analytical modelling and solution to the Ipsos research/account team worldwide.
Guide, optimize study and questionnaire design for efficient analytics and cost management.
Drive the integration of new tools and innovative thinking in analytics to better meet client needs.
The role will require working closely with client service teams across all regions, The team members all are passionate, share a positive attitude, problem solving abilities and patience, enabling them to provide excellent customer service even during fast-paced shifts.
 ENVIRONMENT
Embark on an extraordinary career journey at Ipsos, where cutting-edge AI work seamlessly intertwines with our day-to-day operations. With a staggering global presence of 16,600 talented minds across 89 countries, we are one of the largest and best-known research companies. Join us on a quest for knowledge and innovation, where you'll have the privilege of collaborating with the most naturally curious researchers and making a profound impact on both local and global brands.
As a curious and intuitive individual, an enthusiastic professional fueled by a passion for knowledge creation, Ipsos beckons you to immerse yourself fully into finding the optimal solutions for our clients. Our environment is a fertile breeding ground for entrepreneurship and forward thinking, attracting like-minded professionals who possess drive, intelligence, and enthusiasm. Working at Ipsos is dynamic and challenging, never a dull moment!
 OUTPUTS/ACCOUNTABILITY 
Communicating with client service to understand data content, business and analysis requirement
Ability to break down and understand complex business problems, define a solution
Perform statistical modelling/analysis, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, interpret and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, and finally to prepare core deliverables or report (PowerPoint)
Ability to work independently, manage and monitor research projects from commissioning to delivery by utilizing well-developed project management skills, knowledge, deep insight and communicate skills.  Able to work under pressure and meet aggressive deadlines
Demonstrate strong supervisory skills, i.e. project delegation, time management, day-to-day feedback on performance and behavior, conduct performance reviews.
Keep abreast of current trends within market research, to develop personal skills / knowledge base and display specialist knowledge of a market and share this with others
Keenness to learn and proactive self-development and development of others
Assist with recruitment and couching of junior staffs
 COMPETENCIES 
Analytical/critical/forward thinking | Problem-solving | Decision-making | Communication Management | Project Management | Client Service/Focus | Achievement Oriented | Adaptability | Collaboration | Embracing Diversity | Nurturing Innovation | Proactive | Multi-tasking |Attention to detail | Curiosity
 RELATIONSHIPS
Effective interface with client service and project teams
Promote teamwork in the business area, Division and across Ipsos 
Lead by example and behavior (incorporating values) within the business area
Direct and manage the project team activities 
Behave in a manner that displays professionalism, integrity and corporate citizenship at all times
 DEVELOPMENT
Develop a good breadth of experience of different analysis techniques
Confidence and demonstrated capabilities & creativities in applying different tools, techniques and approaches
Demonstrate strong capabilities and leadership in one’s project, people and business management
Understanding of personal actions on business and client
 BACKGROUND
Experience:
At least 1 years of experiences in marketing data analytics/data science or similar fields
Understand and use statistical analysis 
Solid experience in project management
Bonus: Experienced in market research  
 Skills/Knowledge:
Statistical analysis and knowledge
Data manipulation
Analytical tools proficiency (eg. Microsoft Excel, SPSS, SAS are essential)
Programming languages - Python or R for data analysis and data visualization
Solid communication skills
Couching and mentoring skills
Bonus: Experienced in AI, machine learning and deep learning 
 Qualifications:
Degree in Data Science, Statistics/Mathematics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Psychology, Social Science or related studies

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders to understand business challenges and opportunities, transforming raw data into valuable insights. You will be responsible for sourcing, cleaning, and analyzing data, uncovering patterns and trends that drive strategic decisions. By creating clear and effective data visualizations, you will present your findings in a way that simplifies complex information, supporting the development of data-driven products and initiatives.
The Data Analyst will report to Chief Product Officer directly.
 Job Responsibilities: 
Collaborating with stakeholders to define business challenges or opportunities.
Sourcing, cleaning, and preparing data for analysis.
Analyzing data to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
Creating data visualizations to simplify complex information.
Presenting findings in a compelling way that supports strategic decision-making and contributes to building data-driven products.
 Job Requirements: 
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proficient in SQL for querying databases and working with large datasets.
Knowledge on Statistical analysis and data analysis
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Familiarity with Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Experience with ETL processes and understanding of data warehousing concepts.
Strong ability to translate business questions into analytical tasks.
Expertise in data cleaning, preprocessing, and structuring.
Problem-solving abilities to find patterns and actionable insights from data.
Ability to work with large, complex datasets and perform exploratory and statistical analyses. 
Ability to present findings in a clear, concise manner through reports and visual presentations.
Experience collaborating cross-functionally with teams like product, marketing, and sales to identify data-driven solutions.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst, or related role.
Familiarity with relevant industry data, especially if applying for specialized sectors like e-commerce, fintech, online marketplace etc.
 About Xamble Group Limited
Xamble Group Limited is a thriving digital ecosystem that is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX:XGL). From our core business of influencer marketing to digital marketing, performance marketing, social commerce and membership platform – we cultivate communities and drive value for brands, creators and consumers with our end-to-end web3 and generative AI-enabled ecosystem.

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:
Work closely with our international sales and marketing team in communication of day-to-day incoming pricing request from customers.
Work together with our internal operation team across our Asian and European office to ensure pricing decisions are towards our corporate business objectives.
Assist senior management in analyzing current pricing model in order to maintain our pricing competitiveness across our global market space.
Assist senior management in forecasting future profitability and growth target, and alert management on potential risk and opportunity in our incoming pricing request.
Opportunities to get involved with other business operations task to support the company growth target.
Skills and Experience:
Bachelor's degree holder.
1-2 years working experience. Experience in Direct Mail Manufacturing industry will be a plus.
Fresh graduates are encouraging to apply.
Competence in MS office (Word/Excel) is essential.
Languages fluent in English & Putonghua (Verbal and Writing).
Willing to face challenges and work under pressure.
Excellent team and communication skills.
An ability to take initiative and work with minimum supervision.
Positive attitude and work ethic in a multicultural team.
Immediate availability is highly preferred.

Title: BI Analyst - Procurement & Finance
Description:
rhi is recruiting for a BI Analyst - Procurement & Finance to support our global oil & gas client, based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

The ideal candidate will have a solid background in procurement or finance, combined with hands-on experience in data analytics and BI reporting.
You'll be responsible for building high-impact dashboards and reports, ensuring data accuracy, and supporting strategic decision-making by providing actionable insights. Stakeholder management across global time zones is key.


Contract Duration: 12 months
Working Arrangement: Hybrid (60/40 model) - 1 month completely onsite for knowledge transfer
Interview Process: Two rounds of virtual interviews
Responsibilities:

Design and deliver interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI and Excel to support procurement and finance functions globally
Translate complex datasets into clear insights and visualizations to enable cost savings and performance tracking
Collaborate with cross-functional global stakeholders to understand reporting needs and deliver accurate, timely analytics
Ensure data quality and integrity in procurement datasets to support evidence-based decision-making
Develop and maintain tools to track reporting schedules, modifications, and errors
Respond to ad-hoc data requests from leadership, providing concise insights for operational and strategic decisions
Support continuous improvement by implementing automated and self-service analytics solutions
About you
Minimum 5 years of experience in data analytics, with a mandatory background in procurement or finance
Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel (pivot tables, complex graphs, data queries)
Strong working knowledge of S2P (Source-to-Pay) processes and procurement/finance systems such as SAP, Ariba, Salesforce
Familiarity with SQL (required); Python is an advantage
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
Comfortable working across time zones with diverse stakeholders

If you believe this opportunity is right for you, please click the 'Apply' button to submit your application. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. At this time, we will only consider applications with valid working rights for the specified country.
About rhi
rhi is a professional services provider with global expertise. Tracing our history back to the 19th century, we have spent the last 50 years as a global leader to the energy industry.
We combine efficient systems and processes with a deep understanding of client challenges and market insight. We work with our clients to deliver information and resources that will support every stage of their operations. We deliver value to our employees, our clients and the countries that we work in.
rhi-group.com
Diversity Statement
We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.
