Title: Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligence)
Description:
Why Join Us? 
At DCAP, we’re dynamic, fast-growing tech startup backed by Khazanah Dana Impak, providing AI-powered Consumer Financing Platform to hire purchase businesses. We don’t just offer jobs – we build careers. Step into a vibrant environment where your skills and ambitions will be recognized, nurtured, and rewarded.
 Key Features
Digitalized customer journey for partners.
Specialized support for vehicle purchase financing.
Commitment to serving underbanked and underserved populations.
 Our Culture
At DCAP, we embrace a "fail-fast" culture that encourages rapid testing of business scenarios. We value:
Bold ideas and innovation.
Continuous learning and adaptation.
Viewing failure as a crucial part of growth and improvement.
 Position Overview: Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligence)
We are seeking a talented Data Scientist specializing in Artificial Intelligence to join our dynamic team. This role blends advanced data science expertise with AI application development to drive the evolution of our AI-driven products. The ideal candidate will play a key role in advancing our mission to deliver inclusive financial solutions.
 Key Responsibilities:
Credit Risk Modeling and Analysis (≈50%)
Develop and refine alternative credit scoring models using machine learning techniques and non-traditional data sources.
Analyze diverse datasets to uncover patterns and trends in credit risk, particularly for underserved populations.
Collaborate with risk management teams to implement effective credit assessment strategies.
Create clear data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Enhance model performance through rigorous testing and validation.
Address ad hoc data analysis requests, delivering timely and actionable insights.
AI Solution Development and Integration (≈50%)
Design and develop AI applications to streamline operational workflows and boost business efficiency.
Implement and optimize Large Language Models (LLM) and Optical Character Recognition (OCR) solutions.
Optimize LLM models for improved performance and scalability.
Partner with software engineering teams to seamlessly integrate AI solutions into existing platforms.
Deliver rapid prototypes or proof-of-concepts to address time-sensitive AI challenges.
 Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
1 to 4 years of experience in data science, with exposure to credit risk modeling and/or AI applications development.
Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL.
Expertise with machine learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, scikit-learn, or equivalent).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS) and containerization (e.g. Docker) is a plus.
Knowledge of LangChain and LangGraph is highly desirable.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with meticulous attention to detail.
Flexibility to manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
 Why You’ll Love This Role: 
VCs-Backed Startup: With the support of big and well-known investors, we’re positioned for long term success.
Work alongside experienced leaders and innovators: Who are passionate about cutting-edge technology.
Career Development: Be the pioneer key player in a collaborative environment.
Make a Real Impact: Your contribution will directly shape the future of our products and the financing industry.
Workplace: Accessible by public transport.
 Ready to jump-start your career and make an impact in finance? We invite you to apply now and be part of our exciting journey toward financial excellence!
Don’t worry if you don’t check every box – if you meet most of the criteria and are eager to learn, we’d still love to hear from you.

Requirements: • Work with business users and data platform team for requirement gathering and process collaboration | Requirements: |
Description:
Key Responsibility
• Work with large and complex transaction datasets, solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems.

• Develop APIs to retrieve data and participate in the development of backend system

2. 2+ years of experience in data engineering or analytics
3. Proficient in SQL and Python，familiar with databases and tools like Airflow, Spark, or Flink
4. Fluent in both Chinese and English
It's an Outsourced role

Title: Data Engineer/ Data Scientist
Description:
About OMI Group:
Since 2017, OMI Group has been redefining the lifestyle and hospitality scene in Australia. With a diverse suite of concepts, OMI continues to bring people together through innovative food and gastronomic experiences.
Notable brands under OMI Group include OMI, recognized as “Best Japanese Restaurant” by The Age in 2020, and Local Hero Singapore, first Michelin Award-Winning brand operating in Australia. OMI was honoured as the winner for Australian Emerging Franchisor of the Year 2022, awarded by Franchise Council Australia.
Over the past seven years, OMI Group has expanded to 21 outlets across four major cities—Sydney, Melbourne, Canberra, and Kuala Lumpur. Most recently, the group unveiled its flagship concept store, OMI 380, in the heart of Melbourne CBD. Spanning 6,500 square feet, the space brings together a curated experience featuring Wagyu dining, a Matcha Bar, Sake Bar, Bakery, and Gelato. The launch has been widely featured by major media outlets across Australia.
As part of its next growth phase, OMI Group is preparing for international expansion into the Japan and China markets, aiming to bring its innovative F&B concepts to a wider global audience.
www.omigroup.com.au
About the Role:
We’re seeking an experienced Data Engineer/ Data Scientist to strengthen our data capabilities across brands and regions. This role will lead the development of robust analytics infrastructure, predictive models, and insightful reporting to drive performance, improve efficiency, and support strategic growth.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Collection & Management
Collect, clean, and validate data from various sources including POS, ERP, CRM, Excel, and departmental trackers (Retail, Marketing, Central Kitchen, Procurement, etc.)
Data Processing & Automation
Translate raw data into clear, actionable insights for various teams
Build financial models and dashboards to support forecasting, budgeting, and planning
Identify and implement process improvements and automation opportunities
Manage API integrations to streamline data flows and enhance reporting accuracy
System Building
Structure data inputs and flows to support ERP system design and implementation
Develop in-house POS solutions with full integration into the company’s ERP platform.
Data-Driven Insights
Define, monitor, and report KPIs across business units
Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to uncover insights
Create dashboards and reports using advanced data visualization tools to communicate key insights and trends effectively. 
Continuously improve reporting mechanisms to provide real-time insights and support ongoing optimization efforts.
Strategic Collaboration
Collaborate with the Strategy Team to develop data-backed proposals on product development, marketing, procurement, and production strategies
Provide insights to support decision-making across new product launches, promotional planning, supplier negotiation, and production efficiency
Regularly assess and report on team performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions.
Preferred Experience & Attributes:
Number Savvy
Highly proficient with numbers and exceptionally detail-oriented
Growth Mentality
Passion for learning and staying current on analytics trends.
Non-violent Communication
Commitment to non-violent, clear communication and team collaboration
Startup Mindset
Strong ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities remotely. Comfortable with ambiguity and willing to roll up your sleeves.
Language
Fluency in both English and Mandarin (spoken and written) is mandatory to collaborate effectively with teams across Australia, China, and Malaysia
Qualifications:
·       Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
·       At least 5 years of relevant experience, ideally in the F&B or multi-brand retail space.
·       Professional certifications in Data Analytics, Machine Learning, or related fields are a plus.
·       Expert-level skills in Python, SQL, Excel, and Power BI — including dashboard development, DAX, M Query, and Row-Level Security (RLS).
·       Proficiency in Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques for predictive modelling and pattern recognition.
·       Experience in developing customised POS systems and ERP systems is a strong advantage.
·       Strong technical knowledge in data engineering, including ETL, API integration, and scalable analytics architecture.
·       Experience in financial modelling to support budgeting, forecasting, and scenario analysis.
·       Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Work Environment:
Work from Home: Must have a high-performance computer and a stable internet connection.
How to Apply:
Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter. Shortlisted applicants will be required to complete a technical assessment and a corporate culture fit evaluation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description
Bridge between big data and machine learning model
Analyse historical data, identify predictive pattern, engineer robust features to improve model accuracy
Translate business knowledge into quantifiable data points & statistical insights
Job Scope & Responsibilities
Data Collection & Management
Design, implement & maintain ETL process
Ensure data quality, integrity & consistency
Optimize data warehouse schemas, query performance to ensure efficient data access & analytical process
Advanced Feature Engineering
Collaborate with users to understand domain knowledge / mechanics
Translate the knowledge into quantifiable, predictive features
Develop complex SQL queries to create high impact features for machine learning models, including lagged features & rolling aggregates
Identify & prevent data leakage
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
Conduct in-depth statistical analysis & exploratory data visualization to identify hidden patterns, trends, correlations & anomalies within data.
Analyse the distribution of target variable to inform the selection & refinement of statistical modelling
Model Evaluation & Interpretation Support
Assist in the rigorous evaluation of model performance using relevant metrics. For e.g. RMSE, MAE, etc.
Perform detailed residual analysis to understand prediction errors and identify systemic biases or areas for model improvement
Collaborate with team to interpret model outputs & translate complex analytical finding into clear, actionable recommendations for refinement
Reporting & Automation
Develop & maintain automated reports & dashboards to monitor key performance indicators, track model accuracy & visualize critical data trends
Continuous Improvement & Research
Proactively identify opportunities for new data sources, analytical methods and model enhancement
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related quantitative field.
2+ years as a Data Analyst with strong hands-on experience in data extraction, cleaning, transformation and feature engineering
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and their application in data analysis
Proficiency in programming languages like SQL, R, and Python
Proficiency in data visualisation software e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio
Good written and spoken English language
A deep passion for and strong understanding in MOBA mechanics
Self-motivated, detail-oriented and able to work effectively both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Experience in BigQuery, Dataflow and BigQueryML is a bonus
Interested candidates, kindly submit detailed resumes via clicking "Apply Now" button. All profiles will be handled with strictest confidentiality. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Thank you.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About
D-SIMLAB Technologies is the leading provider of Digital Twin Solutions for Semiconductor Manufacturing. D-SIMLAB Technologies has offices in Singapore, Germany and China and is now expanding into Malaysia. Penang has been chosen as the location of the Malaysian operations due to the concentration of high-tech manufacturing.
Candidates will be required to support existing customers in Malaysia and also travel within the region for implementation projects.
D-SIMLAB provides a unique opportunity to enhance your tech and soft skills while working in a multi-national team with considerable international client exposure.
Job Description: Data Engineer
As a Data Engineer at D-SIMLAB Technologies, you will play a key role in deriving insights from large datasets to optimize semiconductor manufacturing processes. This role focuses on data extraction, analysis, and actionable insights, while collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy D-SIMLAB’s software products as well as provide professional consultation services to our clients. The ideal candidate is someone who excels in data-driven analysis and is eager to work on high-impact projects in the semiconductor industry.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Extraction and Analysis:
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from semiconductor manufacturing environments to ensure data consistency, completeness, and correctness.
Use statistical methods and data mining techniques to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that impact production performance.
Performance Evaluation:
Analyze the gap between planned and actual production outcomes. Identify root causes for performance deviations and recommend data-driven strategies for process improvement. Develop reports and visualizations to present findings to clients and internal stakeholders.
Data-Driven Insights:
Provide actionable insights based on data analysis to optimize semiconductor manufacturing processes. Work closely with clients to understand their specific needs and translate data findings into operational and strategic improvements.
ETL and Data Modeling:
Build and maintain ETL processes to integrate data from various sources into D-SIMLAB’s data models. Collaborate with simulation modeling teams to ensure accurate and reliable data is fed into models.
Consultation Services:
Act as a trusted advisor to clients by offering data-driven recommendations for enhancing their production efficiency. Present analyses and proposals to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clarity and actionable takeaways.
Data Visualization and Reporting:
Create dashboards and reports using advanced data visualization tools to communicate key insights and trends effectively. Continuously improve reporting mechanisms to provide real-time insights and support ongoing optimization efforts.
Collaboration with Teams:
Work with Software Engineers, Data Scientists, and other cross-functional teams to ensure that data insights align with product goals and customer needs. Contribute to product enhancement initiatives, focusing on the improvement of data-related components and analytics.
Candidate Requirements:
Education:
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
Experience:
Strong analytical skills with a minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in an industrial environment. Semiconductor experience is a plus.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is highly desirable.
Experience with ETL processes and database management.
Analytical Abilities:
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle large datasets and deliver actionable insights to improve operational performance.
Soft Skills:
Ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural, multidisciplinary team.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Willingness to Travel:
Willing to travel for international projects and collaborate closely with clients and internal teams.
Please ensure your profile on the portal is updated with your job experience and education as these fields are being used for the purpose of filtering and shortlisting.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Requirements: Solution Design: Architect and design AI-driven solutions that meet specific client needs, defining system requirements and end-to-end workflows. | Qualifications |
Description:
🚀 Join CTRL CV: Empowering Industries Through Collaborative Innovation!
 At CTRL CV, we are more than just a company; we are a collaborative force driving industry-specific digital transformation. By combining collective expertise with cutting-edge AI technology, we deliver tailored solutions that tackle unique challenges across various sectors. Join us to be part of a culture that prioritizes innovation, continuous improvement, and client success. Together, we redefine possibilities and set new benchmarks for excellence.
 Role Description
We are seeking a visionary Artificial Intelligence Solution Architect who will serve as an Artificial Intelligence Engineer at CTRL CV. This role combines technical excellence with strategic thinking to design and implement AI-driven solutions from concept to deployment. You will lead efforts in understanding client needs, architecting innovative solutions, and ensuring their seamless integration into real-world applications. If you are passionate about bridging the gap between AI technology and practical business challenges, this is the role for you.
 Key Responsibilities
Solution Design: Architect and design AI-driven solutions that meet specific client needs, defining system requirements and end-to-end workflows.
AI Model Development: Build and refine advanced algorithms and models, focusing on areas such as pattern recognition, neural networks, natural language processing, and image processing.
End-to-End Implementation: Lead the deployment and integration of AI systems into existing infrastructures, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with developers, data scientists, and stakeholders to align technical efforts with business goals.
Client Engagement: Present complex AI concepts in a clear and actionable manner to clients and non-technical stakeholders.
Innovation and R&D: Stay updated with the latest AI advancements and integrate cutting-edge technologies into solution design.
System Integration: Oversee API design, cloud deployment, and infrastructure setup to ensure seamless implementation.
Project Oversight: Manage and prioritize multiple projects, ensuring timely delivery and client satisfaction.
 Qualifications
Solution-Oriented Expertise: Proven ability to design and implement AI systems with a focus on solution architecture and system integration.
AI Proficiency: Expertise in pattern recognition, neural networks, natural language processing, and image processing concepts and methodologies.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in frameworks like PyTorch and TensorFlow, and experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, or a related field.
Programming Expertise: Strong programming skills, particularly in Python, with a solid understanding of software development principles.
Data Insight: Experience in analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to inform model design.
Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to diverse audiences.
Project Management: Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously with a keen attention to detail.
Team Collaboration: Ability to thrive in both independent and hybrid team environments.
Passion for Innovation: A strong drive to explore and implement cutting-edge advancements in AI and solution design.
 Why Join CTRL CV?
 At CTRL CV, you’ll have the opportunity to shape groundbreaking projects that empower industries through collaborative innovation. As an Artificial Intelligence Engineer, you will take on the visionary responsibilities of a Solution Architect, designing and delivering impactful AI systems that redefine industry standards. Be part of a team that values creativity, knowledge-sharing, and excellence, and help us set new benchmarks for success.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Job Description
An AI Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and deploying artificial intelligence systems that solve complex problems. They work with machine learning models, deep learning algorithms, and AI frameworks to build intelligent solutions across various industries, including healthcare, finance, robotics, and cybersecurity.
Responsibilities
Design, train, and fine-tune AI and ML models.
Improve the efficiency and accuracy of AI models.
Collect, clean, and pre-process large datasets for AI training.
Integrate AI models into applications, cloud platforms, or edge devices.
Ensure AI models perform well over time and retrain them when needed.
Ensure AI solutions are fair, unbiased, and comply with ethical guidelines.
Documenting machine learning/deep learning processes.
Keeping abreast of developments in machine learning.
Turning unstructured data into useful information by auto-tagging images and text-to-speech conversions.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree (minimum) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Master’s Degree or Ph.D. (preferred for research or advanced roles).
Technical Skills
Programming Languages: Python, Java, C++, R
Machine Learning & Deep Learning: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn
Data Science & Analytics: Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib
Big Data & Cloud Computing: Hadoop, Spark, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure
Algorithms & Mathematics: Linear algebra, probability, statistics, calculus
Software Development: API integration, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We are seeking passionate AI Engineers to join our team in building high-performance AI systems that drive productivity, automation, and personalization. You will work on the full lifecycle of AI solutions — from prototyping and training to deployment and optimization — while collaborating closely with our backend team.
We welcome applications from both experienced professionals and new graduates who have completed relevant AI projects and are eager to contribute.
Responsibilities
As an AI Engineer, you will assist us in the following:
Integrate AI models into web, mobile, or backend applications using APIs or edge runtimes.
Research and experiment with state-of-the-art models (e.g., LLMs, Transformers, RAG) and build scalable pipelines for production use cases.
Optimize performance of locally hosted open-source models for real-time or batch inference (focus on latency, memory, and accuracy).
Monitor and debug model behavior in production — including drift, hallucinations, and performance degradation — and maintain model-serving architecture in a Linux environment.
Develop and implement AI projects across domains including:
Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Machine Learning (ML)
Computer Vision using OpenCV
Speech Recognition & Synthesis
Business Process Automation
Enterprise Document AI Assistants
Conversational AI / Chatbots
Key Qualifications
Proficient in Python and core AI/ML libraries: TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Transformers, etc.
Hands-on experience with NLP, computer vision, or generative AI (e.g., ChatGPT, LLaMA, DALL·E, open source models).
Familiarity with RAG pipelines and vector databases (e.g., Qdrant,  FAISS).
Comfortable working in Linux environments and optimizing GPU-based inference.

Title: Software Engineer – Remote | Work with Australia’s Leading AI Company
Description:
Location:
Remote (Malaysia)
Full-time | Approx. AUD $2,000/month (inclusive)
Includes 4 weeks paid leave + public holidays in your country
About Us
https://www.realtimetraffic.com.au
Real Time Traffic (RTT) is Australia’s leading AI and computer vision company for road safety. Our technology is deployed at hundreds of road sites across the country, working with government agencies to detect near-misses and reduce crash risks through real-time video and AI analytics.
We’re a fast-growing company backed by real-world impact and a mission to scale internationally within 2–3 years.
Why This Role Is Exciting
You’ll join a growing engineering team delivering AI/ML systems into production. This isn’t a lab experiment — we’re working with government partners across Australia on real, high-stakes projects.
You'll support our DevOps & ISO Lead, contributing to deployments that involve:
Camera-based machine learning applications
LLMs for automated analytics
High-volume video + traffic data processing
Secure cloud-based deployments (AWS)
Key Responsibilities
Package and deploy software and camera systems
Write automation scripts and tools
Assist with CI/CD pipelines and QA
Process large datasets for AI/ML pipelines
Troubleshoot technical issues for internal teams
Write maintainable, high-quality code (following SOLID principles)
Tech Stack
Python (pandas, numpy), JavaScript
MongoDB, AWS (Lambda, S3, Kinesis, EMR)
Git, Jupyter, Docker, Linux
OpenCV, LLM-based automation, ISO 27001 frameworks
What We’re Looking For
Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
1–3 years of hands-on development or support experience
Proficient in English (written and spoken)
Familiar with scripting, Linux, and cloud tools
Understanding of SOLID principles
Eager to learn, grow, and solve real-world challenges
What We Offer
Work remotely from anywhere in Malaysia
~AUD $2,000/month (inclusive of taxes/benefits)
4 weeks paid leave + local public holidays
Hands-on learning with modern tech (LLMs, AWS, computer vision)
Be part of a small global team making a real difference

Title: Data Engineer (RMI)
Requirements: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and address data requirements. | Job Qualification |
Description:
About the Role
We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Engineer to join our team! This role involves working with large volumes of data, building and maintaining data pipelines, and supporting the transition to automated processes that improve efficiency and data accuracy.
Job Definition
 Perform data cleaning, processing, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) from various sources into data storage systems.
Ensure data quality through proper planning and implementation.
Maintain and document data pipelines, processes, and infrastructure.
Monitor and troubleshoot data issues to ensure timely resolution.
Extract data from online sources to support analytical needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and address data requirements.
Support automation of data-related processes and systems.
Provide training and guidance on the use of automated workflows.
Job Qualification
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Strong experience with SQL, MongoDB, and a solid understanding of Relational and Non-Relational databases.
Proficient in Python and comfortable with other scripting languages.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Power BI / Power Automate.
Basic understanding of HTML & CSS.
Experience in web scraping using tools like BeautifulSoup, Selenium, or Scrapy.
Knowledge of AWS or Azure is an added advantage.
Interest or experience in the automotive industry is a plus.
Excellent communication skills in English.
Strong teamwork, coordination, and learning abilities.
Self-motivated, disciplined, and able to work well under pressure.
Logical thinker with attention to detail.
Additional Information 
We're looking for 5 Data Engineer in Chennai and 5 in Kuala Lumpur to join our growing team.

Title: AI Research Intern
Description:
About the role

We’re looking for a sharp, analytical, and tech-savvy AI Research Intern to help us explore the rapidly evolving landscape of AI tools and platforms. This is not just about playing with cool tech — it’s about asking the right questions, identifying real-world needs, and turning abstract technologies into clear, impactful use cases.
If you’re an expert at research, curious about emerging tools, and driven by a desire to understand how things work (and how they can work better), you’ll thrive here.
What you'll be doing
Conduct in-depth research and analysis to identify new AI applications and methodologies
Develop and test AI Agents and AI automation to solve complex problems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate Agentic AI and LLMs into existing products and services
Communicate research findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in the field of AI
What we're looking for
Currently enrolled in a relevant university program, such as Computer Science, Mathematics, or Artificial Intelligence
Strong knowledge of machine learning, deep learning, and other AI techniques
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Experience with data analysis, visualization, and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
Ability to work independently and think critically
What we offer

At Ventamin, we are committed to fostering a dynamic and supportive work environment. As an AI Research Intern, you'll have the opportunity to:
Gain hands-on experience in cutting-edge AI research and development
Receive mentorship and guidance to further develop your skills
Contribute to the company's mission of driving innovation through AI

We offer a competitive compensation package and the chance to grow your career in a rapidly evolving field.
About us

Ventamin is an international e-commerce wellness brand launched in May 2024 that focuses on scientifically formulated, expert-backed supplements aimed at enhancing health and well-being. Ventamin has presence in more than 45 countries through Ventamin.com and also present in Amazon USA.
If you're ready to join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact, apply now.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About
D-SIMLAB Technologies is the leading provider of Digital Twin Solutions for Semiconductor Manufacturing. D-SIMLAB Technologies has offices in Singapore, Germany and China and is now expanding into Malaysia. Penang has been chosen as the location of the Malaysian operations due to the concentration of high-tech manufacturing.
Candidates will be required to support existing customers in Malaysia and also travel within the region for implementation projects.
D-SIMLAB provides a unique opportunity to enhance your tech and soft skills while working in a multi-national team with considerable international client exposure.
Job Description: Data Engineer
As a Data Engineer at D-SIMLAB Technologies, you will play a key role in deriving insights from large datasets to optimize semiconductor manufacturing processes. This role focuses on data extraction, analysis, and actionable insights, while collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy D-SIMLAB’s software products as well as provide professional consultation services to our clients. The ideal candidate is someone who excels in data-driven analysis and is eager to work on high-impact projects in the semiconductor industry.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Extraction and Analysis:
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from semiconductor manufacturing environments to ensure data consistency, completeness, and correctness.
Use statistical methods and data mining techniques to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that impact production performance.
Performance Evaluation:
Analyze the gap between planned and actual production outcomes. Identify root causes for performance deviations and recommend data-driven strategies for process improvement. Develop reports and visualizations to present findings to clients and internal stakeholders.
Data-Driven Insights:
Provide actionable insights based on data analysis to optimize semiconductor manufacturing processes. Work closely with clients to understand their specific needs and translate data findings into operational and strategic improvements.
ETL and Data Modeling:
Build and maintain ETL processes to integrate data from various sources into D-SIMLAB’s data models. Collaborate with simulation modeling teams to ensure accurate and reliable data is fed into models.
Consultation Services:
Act as a trusted advisor to clients by offering data-driven recommendations for enhancing their production efficiency. Present analyses and proposals to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clarity and actionable takeaways.
Data Visualization and Reporting:
Create dashboards and reports using advanced data visualization tools to communicate key insights and trends effectively. Continuously improve reporting mechanisms to provide real-time insights and support ongoing optimization efforts.
Collaboration with Teams:
Work with Software Engineers, Data Scientists, and other cross-functional teams to ensure that data insights align with product goals and customer needs. Contribute to product enhancement initiatives, focusing on the improvement of data-related components and analytics.
Candidate Requirements:
Education:
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
Experience:
Strong analytical skills with a minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in an industrial environment. Semiconductor experience is a plus.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is highly desirable.
Experience with ETL processes and database management.
Analytical Abilities:
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle large datasets and deliver actionable insights to improve operational performance.
Soft Skills:
Ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural, multidisciplinary team.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Willingness to Travel:
Willing to travel for international projects and collaborate closely with clients and internal teams.
Please ensure your profile on the portal is updated with your job experience and education as these fields are being used for the purpose of filtering and shortlisting.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
PRIZM Group is a global agency with specialisation in digital marketing, social media, big data, and eCommerce with over 200 staff in 5 offices including Hong Kong and Singapore. The group’s expertise lies beyond a mere digital solution but synchronizing MarTech and Creativity to empower the formation of seamless digital experience. In 2022, PRIZM Group was crowned the prestige overall Agency of the Year hosted by Marketing Interactive.
To cope with our rapid growth of HQ, we are setting up our team in Malaysia. We are seeking for English & Cantonese speaking candidates with high calibre to join our new team in Malaysia within an extremely innovative and exciting digital marketing company.

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated data engineer to join our data team. The ideal candidate should have strong knowledge in building data infrastructure and engineering solutions using modern data technologies.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with professional service teams to identify clients' business problems for data pipeline building.
Build scalable data pipelines and infrastructure using modern data technologies such as Databricks, dbt, etc.
Develop and implement ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into our data warehouse.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and availability.
Continuously evaluate and incorporate new technologies and tools to optimize data engineering processes.
Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Big Data, or related field.
Proficiency in Python.
Proficiency in SQL. Experience in No-SQL database is a plus.
Familiarity with building large-scale, distributed systems on cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Experience in data engineering, data warehousing, database design, and data integration.
Experience in big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
Experience in container technologies, such as Docker/Kubernetes.
Ability to work independently.
Excellent communication skills in English and Mandarin to effectively communicate with our diverse client base and stakeholders.. Cantonese is a plus.
At least 2 years of working experience in the related field is required
Candidates with more than 3 years of experience will be considered for the senior position
We offer attractive compensation package to suitable candidates. Interested parties, please click "Apply Now" to submit your application including your present & expected salary.
(Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.)

Title: Data Engineer
Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
Requirements: Requirements Gathering: Lead the requirements gathering process for data-related projects, working closely with stakeholders to understand and document their needs.  Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines that enable efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using Oracle and MS SQL.  Batch Processing: Implement and manage batch processing jobs to support daily banking operations, ensuring timely and accurate data processing. |  Data Integration: Work with Kafka to manage real-time data streaming and integration with other core banking systems.  Project Collaboration: Collaborate with the development team, business analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure data requirements are met and projects are delivered on time.  Risk Management: Identify potential risks in data projects and escalate issues or suggest contingency plans as necessary. |
Description:
Requirements Gathering: Lead the requirements gathering process for data-related projects, working closely with stakeholders to understand and document their needs.  Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines that enable efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using Oracle and MS SQL.  Batch Processing: Implement and manage batch processing jobs to support daily banking operations, ensuring timely and accurate data processing.
 Data Integration: Work with Kafka to manage real-time data streaming and integration with other core banking systems.  Project Collaboration: Collaborate with the development team, business analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure data requirements are met and projects are delivered on time.  Risk Management: Identify potential risks in data projects and escalate issues or suggest contingency plans as necessary.
 Progress Reporting: Provide regular updates on data project progress and track key deliverables to ensure alignment with project goals.  Task Execution: Complete assigned tasks within established timelines, adhering to the team's development and quality standards. Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experienceData Architecture Design: Contribute to the design of data architectures that support scalable, reliable, and efficient data processing systems.
 ETL Development: Develop ETL processes to load and transform data from various sources into structured formats for analysis and reporting.  Data Streaming: Utilize Kafka for real-time data streaming, ensuring reliable and low-latency data flow between systems.  Performance Tuning: Optimize data pipelines and batch processing jobs to improve system performance and reduce processing times.
 Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality checks to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data across systems.  Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, architectures, and system configurations to support ongoing maintenance and development.  Continuous Learning: Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering, continuously improving technical skills.
 BAU Support: Provide support for Business as Usual (BAU) operations, troubleshooting and resolving data-related issues as they arise.

Title: Data Science Engineer
Description:
Roles and Responsibility
Data Analysis: Perform thorough data analysis to discover trends, patterns, and insights that can inform decision-making processes.
Model Development: Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to solve complex problems and improve business operations.
Data Collection: Gather and preprocess large datasets from various sources to ensure data quality and accuracy.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and business analysts, to integrate data solutions into business applications.
Reporting: Create comprehensive reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders clearly and effectively.
Algorithm Optimization: Continuously refine and optimize algorithms to enhance performance and reliability.
Research: Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning to apply innovative approaches in projects.
Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of data processes, models, and findings for future reference and reproducibility.
Educational Qualifications
· Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
· Ph.D. Degree in a relevant discipline is preferred but not mandatory.
Technical Skills
· Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and Java. Knowledge of other languages like Scala or C++ is advantageous.
· Data Manipulation: Experience with data manipulation libraries such as Pandas, NumPy and etc.
· Machine Learning: Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and XGBoost.
· Database Management: Skills in database management systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, and NoSQL databases like MongoDB.
· Big Data Technologies: Proficiency in Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, and other big data technologies.
· Data Visualization: Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, and Seaborn.
Analytical Skills
· Statistical Analysis: Knowledge of statistical methods and their application in data analysis.
· Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.
· Data Interpretation: Ability to interpret complex data and generate actionable insights.
Experience
· Industry Experience: Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data science, data engineering, or related roles.
· Project Management: Proven experience in managing and executing data science projects.
· Team Collaboration: Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with stakeholders.
· Research: Ability to stay updated with the latest research and advancements in the field of data science.
Soft Skills
· Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex ideas effectively.
· Teamwork: Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.
· Adaptability: Flexibility and adaptability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
· Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
· Time Management: Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines.
Additional Requirements
· Certifications: Professional certifications in data science, machine learning, or related areas are a plus (e.g., Certified Data Scientist, AWS Certified Machine Learning).
· Portfolio: A strong portfolio showcasing previous data science projects and achievements.
· Continuous Learning: Commitment to continuous learning and professional development.

Title: Data Engineer (RMI)
Requirements: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and address data requirements. | Job Qualification |
Description:
About the Role
We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Engineer to join our team! This role involves working with large volumes of data, building and maintaining data pipelines, and supporting the transition to automated processes that improve efficiency and data accuracy.
Job Definition
 Perform data cleaning, processing, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) from various sources into data storage systems.
Ensure data quality through proper planning and implementation.
Maintain and document data pipelines, processes, and infrastructure.
Monitor and troubleshoot data issues to ensure timely resolution.
Extract data from online sources to support analytical needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and address data requirements.
Support automation of data-related processes and systems.
Provide training and guidance on the use of automated workflows.
Job Qualification
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Strong experience with SQL, MongoDB, and a solid understanding of Relational and Non-Relational databases.
Proficient in Python and comfortable with other scripting languages.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Power BI / Power Automate.
Basic understanding of HTML & CSS.
Experience in web scraping using tools like BeautifulSoup, Selenium, or Scrapy.
Knowledge of AWS or Azure is an added advantage.
Interest or experience in the automotive industry is a plus.
Excellent communication skills in English.
Strong teamwork, coordination, and learning abilities.
Self-motivated, disciplined, and able to work well under pressure.
Logical thinker with attention to detail.
Additional Information 
We're looking for 5 Data Engineer in Chennai and 5 in Kuala Lumpur to join our growing team.

Title: Engineer, Data Management Engineering
Description:
Job Description
We are looking for a curious and motivated Junior Data Management Engineer with foundational experience in machine learning to join our growing data team. This role is perfect for someone early in their career who is eager to contribute to data engineering tasks while gaining hands-on exposure to machine learning workflows. You'll help ensure data pipelines are optimized for analytics and ML model development, supporting both operational and strategic decision-making.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with multiple stakeholders to identify, diagnose and resolve manufacturing process related problems such as quality excursions, manufacturing excellence and cost improvement.
Responsible to perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) from different data sources and perform correlation find out the best variables for Fault Detection (FD), Prediction and Run-to-Run modelling setup.
Responsible to setup ETL pipeline for data integration from different sources to databases.
Assist in implementing basic machine learning models (e.g., regression, classification) under guidance.
Monitor data quality and support model performance tracking in production.
Design and develop machine learning (ML) applications to implement in manufacturing process.
Build dashboards and reports to visualize process variables, ML outputs and business KPIs.
Document data flows, ML pipelines, and model metadata for transparency and reproducibility.
Qualifications
REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
0–2 years of experience in data analytics, data engineering, or machine learning.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Basic Python programming skills, particularly for data analysis (e.g., pandas, NumPy).
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals (e.g., supervised learning, model evaluation, overfitting).
PREFERRED:
Exposure to building or assisting in ML models using libraries like scikit-learn or TensorFlow.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with version control tools such as Git.
Experience working in cloud environments (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure), especially with ML tools like SageMaker or Vertex AI.
Exposure to ML lifecycle tools like MLflow, DVC, or Kubeflow.
Familiar with semiconductor manufacturing process, control system functions, manufacturing system (MES/RMS) and communication protocols such as SECS-GEM is an added advantage.
SKILLS:
Data preprocessing and feature engineering techniques.
Basic data pipeline development and ETL/ELT workflows.
Ability to interpret and visualize data insights.
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
Effective written and verbal communication.
Team collaboration and a proactive learning attitude.
Additional information
Sandisk thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
Sandisk is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@sandisk.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Sandisk has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Sandisk’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Sandisk and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Sandisk Ethics Helpline or email compliance@sandisk.com.

Title: Senior Executive, Content Analytics (Data Collection & Analysis)
Requirements: Qualification & Work Experience | Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other related qualification from a recognized university. |
Description:
Job Summary
Supervise, formulate, develop, lead and manage large data sets to support policy development and regulatory compliance through data-driven insights, and work closely with cross-functional teams to drive high-impact business decisions, ensuring the organization's objectives of high awareness, responsiveness, and engagement are achieved.
Job Responsibilities:
Data Collection and Processing
Lead and manage large sets of structured and unstructured data from various sources such as internal databases, third-party APIs, and web scraping. Supervise data cleaning tasks to address missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies, ensuring the data is accurate and reliable. Preprocess data by normalizing, transforming, and encoding it to prepare for analysis and modelling, ensuring it meets the required quality standards.
Data Analysis
Formulate and apply statistical techniques to analyze data, identifying significant patterns, correlations, and trends to inform business decisions. Utilize machine learning algorithms to build models that predict outcomes, classify data, and uncover hidden patterns. Interpret the results of data analysis to generate actionable insights that drive business strategies and operational improvements.
Model Development
Develop and supervise predictive models to forecast future trends, customer behavior, and other key business metrics using historical data. Implement machine-learning algorithms tailored to specific business problems, optimizing them for accuracy and efficiency. Ensure models are understandable to stakeholders by translating complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights.
Visualization
Formulate and develop interactive dashboards to visualize key metrics, trends, and insights, making data accessible to stakeholders. Utilize visualization tools or custom-built solutions to present data in a compelling and easily digestible format. Create visual narratives that effectively communicate data insights, aiding stakeholders in making informed decisions.
Collaboration
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, operations, and product development, to understand their data needs and deliver tailored solutions. Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
Research
Keep up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Explore new data sources, analytical methods, and technologies to enhance the organization's data capabilities and maintain a competitive edge. Engage in continuous learning through courses, conferences, and professional networks to keep skills and knowledge current.
Automation
Develop, lead and maintain automated Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes to streamline data flow from source systems to analytical platforms. Implement automation to enhance data processing efficiency, reducing manual intervention and minimizing errors. Supervise and ensure data is readily available for analysis by creating robust data pipelines that support both real-time and batch processing needs.
Impact and Risk Assessment
Lead and assess associated and risks with critical cases/ action. Escalate and propose courses of actions for consideration and approval of Head department.
Standards and Reporting
Supervise, formulate and reinforce standards for scheduled reporting to articulate stakeholder expectations clearly, ensuring their understanding.
Single Source of Truth
Supervise and implement methodologies and processes to maintain single source of truth for reporting and analytics purposes.
Unit Management and Development
Supervise and manage a robust team with unit staff. Set clear objectives, collaborate with direct reports on effective execution strategies, monitor progress, communicate outcomes, and supervise the management and development of unit staff.
Qualification & Work Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other related qualification from a recognized university.
Minimum 3 - 5 years working experience, with strong knowledge in data mining, machine learning, big data frameworks, as well sound understandings of legal and regulatory frameworks.
Technical Competencies/Skills
Programming language skills (Phython, R, or Java)
Data visualization (Tableau, Power BI or D3.js) 4 SQL and database management systems
Big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure or Google Cloud)
Emerging technology synthesis
Governance
Partnership management
Risk assessment and management
Quality standards and assurance
Microsoft Office
 Behavioral Competencies/Skills
Resilience
Critical thinking
Analytical thinking
Communication skills
Interpersonal skills
Stakeholder management
Conflict management
Negotiation skills
Time management with sense of urgency
Collaboration skills
Confidence
Concern about order
Attention to detail
  Candidate must be willing to work in Cyberjaya.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Engineer, Executive
Company: Tokio Marine Life Insurance Malaysia Bhd
Description:
Job Function:
The role will be responsible for designing databases and ensuring their stability, reliability, and performance. You will also work other developers optimizing in-application SQL statements as necessary, and establishing best practices. You will help solve all database usage issues and come up with ideas and advice that can help avoid such problems in the future.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop and implement optimal ETL solutions
Develop automation of data acquisition, transformation and movement
Develop ETL processes to maintain data warehouse and/or data marts
Monitor and administer automated ETL processes to verify execution and measure performance
Help write and optimize in-application SQL statements
Document ETL/SQL processes and solutions
Ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines with minimal supervision
Analyse root cause, assess impact, and provide solution and recovery including program fixes and data correction.
Job Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent.
At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
Experience with SQL queries is required
Knowledge in ETL skills like informatica, Syncsort or SSIS will beneficial and added advantage with those with knowledge in AWS and SAS
In-depth understanding of database management systems and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework and familiar with BI technologies, dashboarding and reporting tools like Power BI, Tableau and Qilksense
Capable of troubleshooting common database issues
Strong analytical and problem solving skills and capable of troubleshooting common database issues
Full-Time position(s) available.
Knowledge of SQL queries (Priority)

Title: Assistant Manager, Data Engineer
Requirements: Requirements: | Bachelor’s degree in IT or other relevant discipline. Tertiary qualification in ANY of the following: Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science or Maths/Statistical. | Basis Azure Cloud experience is a mandatory requirement. |
Description:
Why Us?
In AIA Digital+, we serve as AIA’s Group-led Technology, Digital & Analytics hub by evolving innovative technology to shape the future. We aim to design & develop a detailed, human centered experiences to positively impact the lives of millions of people.
Join us as a part of AIA Group today!
Roles & Responsibilities:
Responsible for data pipeline management which including developing, maintaining, testing and optimizing the data pipelines.
Able to work with data reporting tools such as PowerBI and Alteryx if needed.
Analyze and troubleshooting issues related to staging, orchestration and transformation for data models under Group Application Data Platform.
Monitor the performance of data pipeline management (including staging. Orchestration and transformation) and optimize resources to ensure cost-effectiveness and high availability.
Support, maintain and monitor data pipeline management against SLAs.
Ensure data pipeline operates under appropriate parameters.
Resolve operational problems related to data availability/refresh for users reporting timeline.
Ability to troubleshoot and resolve any issues that arise as reported by users.
May require standby and work during weekend to meet the critical business reporting timeline and/or data needs Support / Standardize.
Ensure that existing guidelines, standards and best practices are followed and applied to development projects.
Take ownership for issues to reach resolutions to prevent recurrences.
Troubleshoot and resolve production issues under tight deadlines.
Proactively identify the impact of potential process changes, integrate new initiatives with existing processes, and ensure that all processes are consistent and fit together.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managements, business users, expertise from other technical areas, and peers.
Able to work independently and strong problem-solving skill.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in IT or other relevant discipline. Tertiary qualification in ANY of the following: Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science or Maths/Statistical.
5+ years IT work experience in a relevant role e.g. Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Architect and/or Data Engineer.
Basis Azure Cloud experience is a mandatory requirement.
Solid understanding and some practical experience in:
Object-oriented programming languages, like Python, Java, and Scala.
Advanced SQL skills and relational database management.
Big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).
Data modelling, ETL and Data Warehousing.
Data Analytics tools such as PowerBI and Alteryx.
Basic cloud computing certifications/licenses – Azure certification could be an advantage.
Excellent language and visual skills for producing well-structured technical documentation and operational procedures in English.
Knowledge on ITIL processes.
Strong customer focus with excellent client engagement, verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to innovate under pressure, analyze complex problems and find solutions.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Translate business requirements into effective data visualization and reporting solutions. | Core Competencies & Requirements: |
Description:
Role Summary:
The RCS Data Engineer will support the Group’s second-line Credit Risk function by enhancing reporting capabilities and developing robust data systems. This role focuses on delivering high-quality, accurate, and timely data to support exposure analytics and credit risk assessments across the organization. It offers a unique opportunity to work closely with Credit Risk subject matter experts in a collaborative, data-driven environment, while contributing to the broader Data Analytics function.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, build, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports, focusing on automation and user experience.
Translate business requirements into effective data visualization and reporting solutions.
Integrate data from platforms like Aladdin and Refinitiv, ensuring high data quality and accessibility.
Develop and optimize data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and related Azure services.
Leverage SQL, Python, and PySpark for data processing, transformation, and debugging of large-scale datasets.
Support the ingestion and processing of data into Azure Analysis Services and the organization’s Data Lake.
Implement and maintain data quality standards, best practices, and technical documentation.
Stay current with the latest trends in Power BI, Azure, and data engineering to drive continuous improvement.
Collaborate daily with the Credit Risk team, providing ongoing support and handling ad hoc development requests.
Core Competencies & Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field.
Proficiency in Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Azure SQL, and Unity Catalog.
Strong skills in SQL, Python, PySpark, and data transformation.
Solid experience with Power BI (DAX, data modeling, custom visuals).
Familiarity with Azure Analysis Services and performance optimization techniques.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to data accuracy and reliability.
Experience or exposure to the asset management domain is an advantage.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Proactive, self-driven, and capable of managing multiple priorities.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - GenAI (Hybrid Working)
Requirements: Qualifications | Essential Qualifications, Skills, and Experience | A MSc or PhD qualification in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent experience. | We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us. |
Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more productive and fulfilling working lives and to help organisations succeed.
By joining us, you’ll be part of a multinational technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it’s where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.
Why join us?
Be part of a multinational tech company with strong core values to help us solve complex challenges while building a flexible, exciting career – one that could take you anywhere. We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment.
As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multilingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region. Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.
Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences & courses while you work alongside seasoned experts.
Job Description
The Role
As a Senior Data Scientist at SEEK, you'll be part of a fast-paced, supportive environment where you can make a real difference. You'll work on complex challenges that have a direct impact on people's lives, helping us evolve our business and reach new heights.
You will report a Data Science Lead and work alongside other highly motivated Data Scientists in the Generative AI team. You will collaborate with product managers, designers, engineers, and others across multiple teams to design and develop Generative AI solutions for both internal and external (customer-facing) use cases.
Key Responsibilities
In this role, you will be expected to:
Research, propose, and implement new AI solutions (and evolve existing ones) to improve a product or business outcome.
Compile and develop datasets as appropriate to train or evaluate AI systems.
Perform offline evaluation of AI systems and contribute to the design of online experiments.
Evangelise appropriate AI methods and explain their benefits and limitations to various audiences, acting as a technical reference within the business on topics related to AI.
Break down problems and projects, estimate and prioritise activities, and propose alternatives to overcome obstacles.
Work together with Product Managers, Engineers, and other stakeholders to build relationships within the organisation based on trust.
Mentor junior Data Scientists and share technical expertise with the DS team.
The Team
Situated within the larger Artificial Intelligence & Analytics team at SEEK, the Generative AI team is a practice team focusing on GenAI. The GenAI team has two streams of work. The Applications stream partners with SEEK product owners and may embed Data Scientists into the team to develop and test opportunities to build GenAI-based services. The Capabilities stream builds early-stage prototypes to test the latest GenAI technology, and also develops core functionality into platform capabilities to enable sustainable scaling of GenAI services.
We work on a quarterly planning cycle to develop our roadmap, which consists of internal R&D projects as well as partnerships with internal product teams, where we act as specialist consultants. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work autonomously to deliver one or more initiatives for the team. The team runs various team rituals such as weekly stand-ups and knowledge sharing sessions, monthly team retrospectives, and others as needed. You will also attend project-related meetings as necessary.
Qualifications
Essential Qualifications, Skills, and Experience
A MSc or PhD qualification in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent experience. 
Professional experience developing and delivering AI/ML solutions.
Deep understanding of the theory and practice of how to build, train, evaluate, and optimise AI/ML models.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple language.
Ability to adapt quickly and thrive in an environment of rapid change.
The following are preferred but not essential:
Demonstrated experience leading AI/ML projects and managing multiple stakeholders.
Deep technical knowledge of the foundations of Generative AI: deep learning; transformers; encoder/decoder models; pre-training and post-training; RLFH; LORA.
Hands-on experience training or adapting large language models.
Hands-on experience building solutions with pre-trained LLMs, using techniques such as prompt engineering, RAG, agentic workflows, etc.
Experience with conversational design and developing conversational AI systems.
Additional Information
Perks and benefits
Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days  as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
Casual dress – every day
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Design and build data warehouses to support complex data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.(from DA or user’s requirement) | Qualifications: |
Description:
Benefits of this role:
13th Months Salary (upon Company Declaration)
Project Incentive (upon Company Declaration based on project performance)
Transport, Meal, Birthday Allowances (upon Confirmation)
Sports Activities (Badminton & Basketball), Company Outing
Training and certification sponsored by company (Selected employees).
Rewards and recognition: Long Service Award / Best Performer Award / Role Model Awards etc
Medical Insurance (upon Confirmation)
Optical, Dental, Body Check Up Claim (upon Confirmation)
 Job Description:
We are in search of a highly motivated and exceptionally talented Data Engineer to become a valuable member of our team. As a Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring the reliability and scalability of our data pipelines. If you are an enthusiastic data engineer with a strong background in data architecture and a passion for gaming, we encourage you to apply and be part of our dynamic team.
Key Responsibilities:
Data pipeline construction:
Design, build and maintain data pipelines for data collection, storage, processing and analysis.
Ensure data pipelines are efficient, scalable, and secure.
Data warehouse and database management:
Design and build data warehouses to support complex data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.(from DA or user’s requirement)
Manage and optimize SQL and NoSQL database systems.
Data integration:
Integrate data from different data sources to ensure data consistency and quality.
Work with data scientists and analysts to provide data support and optimize data query performance.
Automation and monitoring:
Automate data processing tasks.
Monitor the performance of data pipelines and promptly address issues in the data flow.
 Qualifications:
Fresh Graduates are Welcome:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field. Fresh graduates are strongly encouraged to apply.
Basic understanding of data pipeline development, ETL processes, and data architecture. Previous experience is a plus but not required.
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Familiarity with SQL database management (e.g., PostgreSQL) is a bonus.
Strong problem-solving skills and a willingness to learn.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and adapt to new challenges.
A passion for learning and improving in the field of data engineering.
A strong desire to develop your skills in data engineering.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Artificial Intelligence)
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated individual, the best of the bests talent to join our team as a Machine Learning Engineer (Artificial Intelligence). We welcome new graduates as well as experienced professionals who have the passion, curiosity, ability, and determination to be the best ML or AI engineer.
  Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms for complex and unique datasets, using various techniques such as mathematical modeling, scikit-learn, NLP, CNN, RNN, DL, RL, Video Transformers, GAN, LLM, RAG, prompt engineering, GPT, AI Agent, Foundation Models, GPT, MCP, VLM, and VLA
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to extract insights, identify business opportunities and provide data-driven recommendations
Stay up-to-date with the latest machine learning and AI techniques and tools
Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders in an easy-to-understand manner
 Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Informatics, Information Science or related fields
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Participation in Kaggle, Mathematics Olympiad or similar competitions is a plus
Excellent programming skills in Python, R, Java, or C++
Familiar with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, MLFlow, AutoML, TensorRT, CUDA, HuggingFace, LangChain, LlamaIndex
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Experience with designing, training, and deploying machine learning models
Customer centric and committed to deliver the best AI results to customers
 As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will receive guidance from experienced senior AI specialists and have opportunities for professional growth and advancement within the company. We also encourage vibe coding.
 Possible future career paths after 2 years include Senior Machine Learning Engineer, AI Architect, AI Team Lead, Data Scientist, Data Architect, Data Lead, Research Engineer, Senior Research Engineer.
 Please note that this position is only for the best of the bests, and we expect candidates to have a strong mathematical background and the grit to solve complex problems. If you believe you have what it takes to excel in this challenging position, apply now.
 Fresh Graduates are also encouraged to apply!

Title: Data Steward & Digital Project Engineer
Company: Safran Landing Systems Malaysia Sdn Bhd
Description:
Responsibilities
1.    Data stewarding:
a.    Ensuring proper documentation of data
b.    Monitoring data quality actions and raising alerts in case of deviations
c.     Acting as the local point of contact for governance matters
d.    Reporting needs or issues related to Braincube usage.
2.    Industrialisation performance:
a.    Monitor the performance indicator in the production and improve the reliability of the different database in place for Safran Landing System (SLS) Malaysia.
b.    Treat and analyze the data related to the manufacturing of the carbon disks.
c.     Issue quarterly report on the qualified program performance in statistical method.
d.    Represent the Engineering department for all the meeting related to program performance, issue and technical meeting. To perform corrective and preventive action to avoid any drift for the qualified program.
e.    Follow up on the RTO performance for all the qualified program for Sendayan Landing system Malaysia.
f.      Follow on the investigation (8D, Why why analysis, Fishbone,… RCA etc) on the issue related to the qualified program for Safran Landing System…
3.    Digitalisation:
a.    Deploy the Digital Roadmap for Sendayan plant in accordance with the global strategy.
b.    Deploy WinCC Connected equipment project (MCS).
c.     Structure, acquire and display data for analysis.
d.    Meet internal customers, understand and analyze their digitalization needs, propose solutions according to best practices in terms of automation, data acquisition and network infrastructure.
e.    Manage external vendors and service providers in relation with the tasks.
4.    Others:
a.    Adhere and actively participate in occupational Safety, Health and Environmental policies, Energy policies procedures and activities such as I-See I-Act, GPI, low carbon initiatives etc.
b.    Adhere and comply with Business Ethics, Anti-Corruption, Flight Safety Management System, and others relevant policies, procedures and activities.
c.     Perform other related duties as required by Management.
 Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering Related technical field preferred. Masters degree would be a plus.
Minimum 3 years working experience.
Excellent oral and written communication skills of English language.
“Hands on” approach to problem solving and troubleshooting.
Good computer skills especially with Microsoft Office i.e. Word, Excel, Power Point, Experience with DCS, Data Mining, Statistical Analysis, Minitab, Power BI, Win CC…etc
Knowledge of SCADA/Historian such as WinCC/Siemens and Wonderware
Knowledge of industrial IT (infrastructure, networks, servers, etc.)
Databases knowledge’s (MS-SQL)
Network configuration (communication protocols, switch, VLAN, etc.)
Experience in data crunching.
Good oral and written communication skills.
