Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities:
Data Management: Develop, monitor, and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently loaded into data warehouses or data mart
Work with Data Architects and BI Architect to design logical and physical analytical data models.
Provide day-to-day support for Data Management solutions for customers
Create and maintain data dictionaries and data lineage. Resolve data quality issues and establish data integrity checks.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
At least 1 years of relevant experience in Data Management and Engineering related solutions.
Knowledge with ETL/ELT processes and data layering concepts.
Knowledge and experience with Apache Airflow, AWS Glue is preferred.
Knowledge and experience with at least one database platform like Snowflake, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, or Microsoft SQL.
Knowledge and experience with SQL and Python is preferred
Knowledge and experience with other programming languages such as Spark SQL, Java, or Scala is a plus.
Knowledge and experience with AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, Microsoft Synapse, and Hadoop is a plus.
Knowledge and experience with AWS Athena, AWS Step Function or Spark is a plus.
Knowledge with data processing and analysis tools like NumPy, Pandas, Python data visualization is a plus.
Knowledge and experience with one of BI products such as Tableau,  Microsoft Power BI, AWS QuickSight or other BI platforms is a plus.
Knowledge and experience with AWS S3, AWS CloudFormation, Redis, ElasticSearch is a plus.
Strong logical thinking skills, a quick learner, and highly interested in data.
Good in using data to explore and clarify business processes.
Proficient in English in both written and verbal.
Good in Japanese or Mandarin is a plus.
"We are looking for Mandarin-speaking candidates who will be serving Mandarin-speaking customers."

Title: Data Scientist
Company: Western Digital Tech and Regional Center (M) Sdn Bhd
Requirements: Meeting users, gathering user requirements and communicating requirements to a technical team member for technical solution design, feasibility study & planning. | Qualification |
Description:
Job Description
Responsibilities
Work with data scientists, data engineers, software engineers, process & product engineers, design engineers, etc collaboratively to develop new data science solutions that improve productivity and operations metrics.
Researching and developing scalable Generative-AI solutions using AWS Bedrock platform, Large Language Models (LLM) and prompt engineering for factory/engineering usage
Deploy models and solutions using DevOps/MLOps tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow, AWS & Edge to ensure scalability and reproducibility.
Collaborate in cross-functional teams to integrate AI/ML algorithms, image analytics and software into the Analytics systems (including chatbot/AR/Computer Vision) as well as develop prototypes.
Design, develop, deploy and maintain Analytics Systems/solutions (Data engineering, Data Science, Chatbot, AI, Generative-AI, AR, Computer vision and Visualization/Web App) independently and delivered on time.
Meeting users, gathering user requirements and communicating requirements to a technical team member for technical solution design, feasibility study & planning.
Translate User Request into Analytics Solution from a system perspective. Prepare and deliver presentations with data visualizations and business conclusions.
Constantly learn new front tier technology and creatively apply/deliver solutions to manufacturing operations to meet KPIs.
Qualification
Masters or Bachelor Degree in Computer science, data science, computer engineering, information technology, or relevant work experience and education background.
We will also consider applicants with the equivalent combination of education, technical expertise, training, or work experience.
Preferably minimum 1-2 years of working experience in related field (Generative-AI & Chatbot).
Skills
Required: Python, LLM, Prompt Engineering, Chatbot, Generative -AI, Augmented Reality, Computer Vision
Added Advantage: Agentic AI and Multi-Agent architecture.  
Practical experience in application of ML and Deep Learning algorithms.
SQL, Relational databases, Big Data platforms, AWS Redshift, PRESTO, ETL, SSIS etc.
Some experience with web front end development: .NET, VB.NET, C#, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, NodeJS, JQuery & Angular
Ability to learn quickly and become productive on new technologies, APIs, development languages and frameworks.
Experience in data mining, data wrangling, and handling JSON, CSV files.
Hands on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Edge computing and AWS.. etc
Experience with data visualization methods (Spotfire, PowerBI, Grafana)
The ability to problem solves and provide complex solutions with minimal supervision
Knowledge of Agile development, SCRUM and Application Lifecycle Management
Excellent communications and presentation skills, with the ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audience, including executives. A great team player.
Self-motivated, strong ownership and ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Additional Information
Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Western Digital has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Western Digital’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Western Digital and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Western Digitals Ethics Helpline or email compliance@wdc.com

Title: Data Engineer/ Data Scientist
Description:
About OMI Group:
Since 2017, OMI Group has been redefining the lifestyle and hospitality scene in Australia. With a diverse suite of concepts, OMI continues to bring people together through innovative food and gastronomic experiences.
Notable brands under OMI Group include OMI, recognized as “Best Japanese Restaurant” by The Age in 2020, and Local Hero Singapore, first Michelin Award-Winning brand operating in Australia. OMI was honoured as the winner for Australian Emerging Franchisor of the Year 2022, awarded by Franchise Council Australia.
Over the past seven years, OMI Group has expanded to 21 outlets across four major cities—Sydney, Melbourne, Canberra, and Kuala Lumpur. Most recently, the group unveiled its flagship concept store, OMI 380, in the heart of Melbourne CBD. Spanning 6,500 square feet, the space brings together a curated experience featuring Wagyu dining, a Matcha Bar, Sake Bar, Bakery, and Gelato. The launch has been widely featured by major media outlets across Australia.
As part of its next growth phase, OMI Group is preparing for international expansion into the Japan and China markets, aiming to bring its innovative F&B concepts to a wider global audience.
www.omigroup.com.au
About the Role:
We’re seeking an experienced Data Engineer/ Data Scientist to strengthen our data capabilities across brands and regions. This role will lead the development of robust analytics infrastructure, predictive models, and insightful reporting to drive performance, improve efficiency, and support strategic growth.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Collection & Management
Collect, clean, and validate data from various sources including POS, ERP, CRM, Excel, and departmental trackers (Retail, Marketing, Central Kitchen, Procurement, etc.)
Data Processing & Automation
Translate raw data into clear, actionable insights for various teams
Build financial models and dashboards to support forecasting, budgeting, and planning
Identify and implement process improvements and automation opportunities
Manage API integrations to streamline data flows and enhance reporting accuracy
System Building
Structure data inputs and flows to support ERP system design and implementation
Develop in-house POS solutions with full integration into the company’s ERP platform.
Data-Driven Insights
Define, monitor, and report KPIs across business units
Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to uncover insights
Create dashboards and reports using advanced data visualization tools to communicate key insights and trends effectively. 
Continuously improve reporting mechanisms to provide real-time insights and support ongoing optimization efforts.
Strategic Collaboration
Collaborate with the Strategy Team to develop data-backed proposals on product development, marketing, procurement, and production strategies
Provide insights to support decision-making across new product launches, promotional planning, supplier negotiation, and production efficiency
Regularly assess and report on team performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions.
Preferred Experience & Attributes:
Number Savvy
Highly proficient with numbers and exceptionally detail-oriented
Growth Mentality
Passion for learning and staying current on analytics trends.
Non-violent Communication
Commitment to non-violent, clear communication and team collaboration
Startup Mindset
Strong ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities remotely. Comfortable with ambiguity and willing to roll up your sleeves.
Language
Fluency in both English and Mandarin (spoken and written) is mandatory to collaborate effectively with teams across Australia, China, and Malaysia
Qualifications:
·       Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
·       At least 5 years of relevant experience, ideally in the F&B or multi-brand retail space.
·       Professional certifications in Data Analytics, Machine Learning, or related fields are a plus.
·       Expert-level skills in Python, SQL, Excel, and Power BI — including dashboard development, DAX, M Query, and Row-Level Security (RLS).
·       Proficiency in Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques for predictive modelling and pattern recognition.
·       Experience in developing customised POS systems and ERP systems is a strong advantage.
·       Strong technical knowledge in data engineering, including ETL, API integration, and scalable analytics architecture.
·       Experience in financial modelling to support budgeting, forecasting, and scenario analysis.
·       Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Work Environment:
Work from Home: Must have a high-performance computer and a stable internet connection.
How to Apply:
Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter. Shortlisted applicants will be required to complete a technical assessment and a corporate culture fit evaluation.

Title: Data Center Facility Technical Engineer (Based in Johor) - MRO
Description:
General Responsibilities:
Provide technical management and quality management for data center project delivery. Have delivery experience in data center turnkey projects, including civil work, power supply and distribution system, HVAC system, fire extinguishing system, and DCIM or Monitoring system etc. Be able to coordinate with each subsystem to resolve technical issues quickly to match project delivery plan.
Provide technical support for project maintenance, focus on pain points that affect customer satisfaction, resolve related issues in time according to the contract SLA, and maintain high customer satisfaction.
Be customer-centric, identify key product gaps from the project perspective, drive product improvement, and enhance product competitiveness.
Provide technical support includes rectification task, change management, any corrective maintenance and planning and carrying out scheduled maintenance.
Provide on-call out-of-hours coverage in accordance with schedule in case of breakdown.
 Candidate Requirements:
Bachelor degree or above, major in Electrical/Mechanical etc.
Have at least 3 to 5 years of experience in the data center industry and be familiar with industrial organizations and certification standards, such as TIA-942, Uptime. Fresh Graduate are also welcome to apply.
Have technical background in data center solutions and related products, such as civil work, power supply and distribution, UPS, HVAC, fire extinguishing, DCIM/BMS. Better have preliminary design capabilities for at least one of these systems.
Have certain project management experience.
Good communication and collaboration skills, ability to travel internationally and adapt to diverse working environments.
Contract position(s) available.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions. |
Description:
About the role
We’re looking for a skilled Data Engineer with a strong product builder mindset to join our Product Development Team. In this role, you’ll be instrumental in building and maintaining the data infrastructure that powers our data products. You’ll work closely with product owners, engineers, developers, and data scientists to ensure the quality, consistency, and scalability of our solutions. This is a hands-on role where you’ll help shape the future of our data products—translating business needs into robust, scalable data solutions that empower our clients to make smarter decisions.
What you'll do
Design and build robust, scalable data pipelines to ingest and process large volumes of data.
Develop complex data models to support client-facing teams and product features.
Lead and support the migration of data infrastructure from on-premise to cloud environments.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Implement and maintain optimal cloud-based architectures to support our data products.
Own the full lifecycle of data processes—from ideation to deployment and maintenance.
What we are looking for
Hands-on experience with AWS and Azure cloud platforms.
Strong Python skills and advanced SQL proficiency.
Experience with Dagster, DBT, Snowflake, and SQL Server.
Deep understanding of conceptual, logical, and physical data modeling for both OLTP and OLAP systems.
Familiarity with AWS EC2, Terraform, CI/CD pipelines, Git, Docker, ECR, and EKS.
Excellent collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Requirements: Qualifications | We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us. |
Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more productive and fulfilling working lives and to help organisations succeed.
By joining us, you’ll be part of a multinational technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it’s where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.
Why join us?
Be part of a multinational tech company with strong core values to help us solve complex challenges while building a flexible, exciting career – one that could take you anywhere. We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment.
As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multilingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region. Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.
Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences & courses while you work alongside seasoned experts.
Job Description
Join SEEK's Artificial Intelligence Platform Services team in Malaysia and help millions of job seekers find their perfect roles! As part of our Recommendations Squad, you'll blend data science, research, and ML engineering to build AI solutions that connect the right candidates with the right opportunities at internet scale.
What You'll Do
Transform business challenges into data-driven solutions, research and deploy cutting-edge recommendation systems, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to revolutionize how people find jobs. You'll work with massive datasets, explore emerging ML techniques, and directly impact job placements across SEEK's global platforms.
Translate business challenges into clear, data-driven problem statements
Gather and validate relevant data for analysis
Build and deploy AI recommendation systems that connect candidates with recruiters
Optimize job matching algorithms to improve placement success rates
Partner with cross-functional teams on complex business problems
Lead end-to-end solution development from concept to deployment
Research emerging ML technologies and methodologies
Qualifications
What We're Looking For
• Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in Data Science, ML, Computer Science, or related field
• 3-5 years of applied data science and ML experience in business environments
• Strong skills in SQL, Spark, Python/Scala/Go
• Deep expertise in classification, ranking, and recommendation systems
• Excellent communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences
Bonus Points For
Deep learning experience (Transformers, NLP), large language models, and thriving in fast-paced, agile environments.
Ready to use AI to change how the world works? Join our collaborative team where your innovations directly help people build better careers.
Additional Information
The Team
The Artificial Intelligence Platform Services (AIPS) is structured into cross-disciplinary squad with members from Data Science, Strategy and Engineering who work together to research, design, build and support end-to-end machine learning based products delivering direct value to hirers and job seekers.

At SEEK we offer:
Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
SEEK is committed to operating sustainably, certified carbon neutral for its business operations (through Climate Active), purchasing renewable energy for our office and working-from-home emissions and a target for net zero by 2030. 
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
SEEKer Support, a confidential service that offers employees up to six sessions with a mental health professional of your choice
Tailored career development planning (including Education Assistance Program)
Professional development sessions with industry leading guest speakers
 At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Title: Data Center QA/QC Engineer (Based JB/KL)
Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for the execution and verification of testing and acceptance activities for overseas data centers. Assist in documentation collection, progress tracking, and quality control of testing projects.
Collaborate closely with internal teams such as Sales and Project Management, as well as external parties including data center providers, general contractors, consultants, and equipment vendors, to ensure testing projects are carried out smoothly and in an organized manner.
Conduct thorough inspection and follow-up on technical issues encountered during testing. Coordinate with vendors to collect, consolidate, and archive test reports and relevant data.
Work Location & Travel:
Based on project needs, travel is expected to range between 30% and 70%, primarily within the Asia-Pacific region.
Maintain strong awareness and application of EHS (Environment, Health & Safety) protocols. Promptly report and escalate any EHS issues observed on-site to avoid major incidents.
Scope of Work:
Mainly focused on third-party or leased data center projects, including pre-test inspections, testing schedules, quality assurance, safety compliance, and issue closure management.
Job Requirements:
Diploma or higher in Electrical Engineering (LV/HV), Mechanical (HVAC), or other MEP-related fields.
At least 2 years of relevant industry experience, preferably in data center projects. Candidates with prior experience in testing and commissioning are highly preferred.
Familiar with verification processes and data center systems (electrical, HVAC, BMS, fire protection), and capable of reviewing test plans, procedures, and reports.
Good understanding of project management aspects such as testing progress, quality, and safety.
Strong awareness and hands-on experience with EHS standards. Prior experience in managing or coordinating testing projects is preferred.
Capable of working under pressure and accepting extended travel periods.
Strong communication and coordination skills, a high level of responsibility, and good judgment.
A proactive learner with a strong sense of team collaboration and ownership.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including data analysts, BI analysts, reporting analysts and business stakeholders, to understand data requirements and drive data-driven solutions. | Requirements: | Strong communication, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Ability to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements. |
Description:
To cater to our business expansions, we are now hiring high caliber talents to join our growing team, together with our current talent forces to support the business strategies, goals and initiatives. 
 Job Responsibilities:
Designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes to efficiently extract, transform, and load data from various sources into our data warehouse.
Define best practices for ETL processes and maintain the related SOPs.
Implementing data models and database designs to support data storage and retrieval needs.
Developing and maintaining data integration and transformation solutions that enable seamless data flow across different systems and platforms.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including data analysts, BI analysts, reporting analysts and business stakeholders, to understand data requirements and drive data-driven solutions.
Monitoring and troubleshooting data quality and performance issues, proactively identifying and resolving bottlenecks or data anomalies.
Ensuring data security and privacy standards are maintained, implementing appropriate measures to protect sensitive information.
 Requirements:
Background:
Possess a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science or equivalent.
At least 1-2 years of relevant working experience.
Must have:
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL framework Additional Information.
Knowledge of Python and databases (e.g. SQL, MongoDB, OceanBase, Elastic Search etc.)
Proficiency in data profiling, cleansing, and quality checks. Hands-on experience with data auditing and governance.
Familiarity with data management concepts like master data management, metadata management, data warehousing, and big data architectures.
Strong communication, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Ability to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Familiar in using Github or Gitlab for work management.
Agility and a willingness to learn. 
Attention to detail and analytical mindset. 
Experience in an agile work environment. 
Proficient in writing and speaking English.
Nice to have:
Proficient in writing and speaking Mandarin. 
Ability to understand technology-driven business intelligence tools.
Knowledge of AI / Machine Learning methodologies.
 What we offer:
Seeking to expand your regional work experience? Work alongside industry-leading professionals from around the globe in an environment filled with opportunities for continuous learning and growth.
We value your wellbeing - You'll find it here along with our comprehensive medical, dental, optical, and wellness benefits.
We appreciate your contributions with a 13th-month salary and performance bonus.
We reward our best employees with quarterly employee recognition awards in USD.
Feeling drowsy after lunch? Take advantage of our smart pantry access and monthly tea break/lucky draw.

Title: Data Science/Software Engineer (Fresh Graduates)
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and tech-savvy Software & Data Science fresh graduates to join our Engineering Services team. You will gain hands-on experience working on real-world projects involving software development, data processing, and intelligent systems.
Software & Data Engineering Intern
Job Description
Assist in the design, development, and testing of software applications and tools
Support data collection, cleaning, and analysis for AI and machine learning projects
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code in languages such as Python, Java, or C++
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy data-driven solutions
Participate in code reviews, debugging, and performance optimization
Contribute to the development of dashboards, APIs, or automation scripts
Document technical processes, project progress, and user guides
Requirements
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical, or a related field
Minimum GPA of 3.0 or above
Proficient in programming language (e.g., Python, Java, C++, JavaScript)
Familiarity with data analysis tools, databases, or machine learning libraries is a plus
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description
Bridge between big data and machine learning model
Analyse historical data, identify predictive pattern, engineer robust features to improve model accuracy
Translate business knowledge into quantifiable data points & statistical insights
Job Scope & Responsibilities
Data Collection & Management
Design, implement & maintain ETL process
Ensure data quality, integrity & consistency
Optimize data warehouse schemas, query performance to ensure efficient data access & analytical process
Advanced Feature Engineering
Collaborate with users to understand domain knowledge / mechanics
Translate the knowledge into quantifiable, predictive features
Develop complex SQL queries to create high impact features for machine learning models, including lagged features & rolling aggregates
Identify & prevent data leakage
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
Conduct in-depth statistical analysis & exploratory data visualization to identify hidden patterns, trends, correlations & anomalies within data.
Analyse the distribution of target variable to inform the selection & refinement of statistical modelling
Model Evaluation & Interpretation Support
Assist in the rigorous evaluation of model performance using relevant metrics. For e.g. RMSE, MAE, etc.
Perform detailed residual analysis to understand prediction errors and identify systemic biases or areas for model improvement
Collaborate with team to interpret model outputs & translate complex analytical finding into clear, actionable recommendations for refinement
Reporting & Automation
Develop & maintain automated reports & dashboards to monitor key performance indicators, track model accuracy & visualize critical data trends
Continuous Improvement & Research
Proactively identify opportunities for new data sources, analytical methods and model enhancement
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related quantitative field.
2+ years as a Data Analyst with strong hands-on experience in data extraction, cleaning, transformation and feature engineering
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and their application in data analysis
Proficiency in programming languages like SQL, R, and Python
Proficiency in data visualisation software e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio
Good written and spoken English language
A deep passion for and strong understanding in MOBA mechanics
Self-motivated, detail-oriented and able to work effectively both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Experience in BigQuery, Dataflow and BigQueryML is a bonus
Interested candidates, kindly submit detailed resumes via clicking "Apply Now" button. All profiles will be handled with strictest confidentiality. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Thank you.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Highlights:
Beauty Industry, located at Puchong Bandar Puteri
Company incentive trip & teambuilding activities
Job duties and responsibilities:
To collect and interpret data and turns it into information that can offer ways to improve a business.
To prepare an analysis and dashboard for business key stakeholders.
To gather information from various data sources and identify patterns and trends.
To share comprehensive study to the wider business/relevant colleagues.
To work with various sales functions to support data needs
To synchronize across disparate data sources, a strong IT infrastructure is the key.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in data engineering, data analytics or related field
Strong experience with SQL, MongoDB, and a solid understanding of Relational & Non-Relational databases.
Proficiency in at least one programming languages (preferably python, php)
Familiarity with basic data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and services, such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is an added advantage
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git)
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex data issues.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Logical thinker with attention to detail.
Experience with ETL tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark, Apache NiFi, Talend, etc.) is a plus
Experience with data orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow) is a plus.
Certifications in relevant technologies (e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics - Specialty) is an added advantage.
Why join us?
We offer an opportunity to unleash your potential and be part of a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
We priorities developing young talent to become successful communications professionals.
We care and appreciate every staff because everyone is a valued member of the team.
Passionate, innovative work culture and positive environment

Title: Data Engineering- Manager
Company: McDonald's Malaysia- Gerbang Alaf Restaurants Sdn Bhd
Description:
About the role

As the Data Engineering Manager at McDonald's Malaysia, you will play a crucial role in driving the company's data strategy and leveraging data to support business decision-making.
🔧 What You'll Do
Design and maintain high-performing databases, data warehouses & pipelines.
Develop RESTful APIs to enable seamless data exchange across systems.
Optimize ETL processes for fast, reliable data flow.
Integrate data from multiple sources ensuring quality and consistency.
Ensure data privacy & governance (MDM strategies, compliance standards).
🧠 What You Bring
3+ years in data engineering or a related role.
Strong in SQL Server, Oracle, and ETL tools (e.g., SSIS).
Proficient in Python, Java, C#, or Scala.
Experience with RESTful APIs, data modelling, and warehousing concepts.
Bonus: Familiarity with big data tools (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
💡 Why Join Us?

At McDonald's Malaysia, we are committed to providing our employees with a fulfilling and rewarding work experience. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a range of benefits, including:
Comprehensive health and wellness programs
Opportunities for career development and growth
Flexible work arrangements and work-life balance initiatives
Discounts on McDonald's products and services
A positive and inclusive company culture that values teamwork and innovation
If you are passionate about data engineering and driven to make a difference, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity with McDonald's Malaysia.
Apply now to join our dynamic team and be a part of our continued success.

Title: Data Scientist
Requirements: Responsibilities & Requirements: | Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and define the scope of ML solutions. |
Description:
Responsibilities & Requirements:
Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Python programming.
Experience with ML libraries and frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
In-depth knowledge of vector databases for efficient data storage and retrieval.
Familiarity with embedding techniques and prompt engineering.
Hands-on experience with OpenAI technologies is a strong plus.
Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs) and LangChain framework preferred.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, classification, and clustering algorithms.
Experience deploying machine learning models as APIs in production environments.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills for effective collaboration with diverse stakeholders.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure.
Develop and deploy machine learning models covering supervised and unsupervised learning, NLP, and computer vision applications.
Collect, preprocess, and ensure the quality of large datasets; identify recursive features to improve model training.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and define the scope of ML solutions.
Evaluate, optimize, and maintain ML models for performance, scalability, and efficiency.
Implement and maintain APIs to integrate ML solutions into web and mobile platforms.
Explore new AI research areas, propose innovative ideas, and contribute to advancing AI technology.
Support the development of data pipelines and infrastructure to streamline machine learning workflows.
Participate in code reviews and promote best practices and team standards.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
You will support the mission of the team by maintaining and extending the platform capabilities through implementation of new features and continuous improvements. You will also explore new developments in the space and continuously bring them to our platform there by helping the data community.
Responsibilities:
You will maintain and extend the Python/Go/Scala backend; Airflow, Spark, Trino and Starrocks platform
You will modify and extend Python/Scala Spark applications and Airflow pipelines for better performance, reliability, and cost.
You will design and implement architectural improvements for new use cases or efficiency.
You will build platforms that can scale to the 3 Vs of Big Data (Volume, Velocity, Variety)
You will follow various testing best practices and SRE best practices to ensure system stability and reliability.
Qualifications:
Must Have:
Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related undergraduate degree.
Proficient in at least one of the following: Python, Go, or Scala and strong appetite to learn other programming languages.
You have 3-5 years of relevant professional experience
Good working knowledge in 3 or more of the following: Airflow, Spark, relational databases (ideally MySQL), Kubernetes, Starrocks, Trino, and backend API implementation and being passionate about learning the others.
Good to have:
Experience with AWS services (S3, EKS, IAM) and infrastructure as code tools like Terraform.
Proficiency in CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab, etc.)
You are highly motivated to work smart and intelligently using available AI resources. Skills that are Good to have
Proficient in Kubernetes with hands of experience with building custom resources using frameworks like kubebuilder.
Proficient in Apache Spark, with good knowledge of resource managers like Yarn, Kubernetes and how spark interacts and work with them
Advanced understanding of Apache Airflow and its working with Celery and/or Kubernetes executor backend with exposure to Python SQL Alchemy framework.
Advanced knowledge of other query engines like Trino, Starrocks and others
Advanced knowledge of AWS Cloud
Good understanding of lakehouse table formats like Iceberg and Delta lake, how query engines work with it.

Title: DRSC A&A - IT, Data & Analytics Associate/Consultant
Description:
Title: DRSC Audit & Assurance - IT, Data & Analytics (Based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia) – Associate/Consultant
Are you ready to unleash your potential?
At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve. We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices. Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals. We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions.

Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!

Work you’ll do
Leadership
Be a valued member of a team of data & analytics specialists
Displaying initiative and innovative thinking to achieve business objectives and streamlined processes
Responsible for own performance management (with coaching and mentoring), living a performance culture, and contributing towards achieving team goals
Maintain a growth mindset
Client delivery
Perform wide range of activities related to analytics, from problem setting, data acquisition, data preparation, data analysis, data visualization and reporting.
Effectively prioritize and manage multiple complex analytics projects, ensuring timely delivery across competing deadlines and business needs.
Your role as a leader
At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We connect our purpose and shared values to identify issues as well as to make an impact that matters to our clients, people and the communities. Additionally, Associates / Analysts / Consultants across our Firm are expected to:
Demonstrate a strong commitment to personal learning and development.
Understand how our daily work contributes to the priorities of the team and business.
Understand the set expectations and demonstrate accountability in keeping personal performance on track.
Actively focus on developing effective communications and relationship-building skills with stakeholders, clients and team.
Demonstrate an appreciation for working with others.
Understand what is fundamental to Deloitte’s success as a business.
Demonstrate integrity and an awareness of strengths, differences, and personal impact.
Develop their understanding of Deloitte and offer a fresh perspective.
Requirements
Education
Bachelor of Science in Information Technology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business Analytics or similar fields.
Work Experience
For Consultant role, at least 2-3 years in the analysis of data from complex data sets and systems
Competencies
Clear verbal and written communication skills
Good attitude, commitment to work, and good team player
A self-starter who identifies issues
Data integration (particularly ETL) for analytics purposes
Programming knowledge in Microsoft SQL, Python
Data visualization tools desirable (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)

Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Candidates will only be contacted by authorized Deloitte Recruiters via firm’s business contact number or business email address.

Title: Data Scientist
Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
Requirements: Education/Qualifications: | Tertiary qualification in relevant field (e.g. Data Science, Computer Science) |
Description:
As a Data Scientist, you will play a critical role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions to support various functions across the company. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze complex datasets, build predictive models, and provide actionable insights that drive business strategy and operations.
 Duties and responsibilities:
·         Analyze large and complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns and insights
·         Develop and implement predictive models to enhance claim management, customer experience, quality assurance and other aspects of the business
·         Collaborate with leaders and other stakeholders to understand business needs and deliver data-driven solutions
·         Liaise with the leadership team on translating general enquires into experimental designs to test hypotheses and improve decision-making processes
·         Communicate findings and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise reports and presentations
·         Stay current with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning and general tech trends that would be applicable in Insurance
·         Ensure adherence to good practices and maintain thorough documentation throughout the projects lifecycle
·         Assist the team in raising awareness to Data Science and Advanced Analytics throughout the business, showcasing they might benefit from it
Support the reporting function of the team by building and maintaining reports in PBI and SSRS, and responding to requests for data
Experience:
·         Proven experience in data analysis, statistical modelling and machine learning
·         Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R and SQL
·         Experience with machine learning frameworks (scikit-learn, tensorflow, keras, etc)
·        Experience with visualization tools (ggplot, plotly, matplotlib, seaborn, etc)
·         Familiarity with cloud platforms (Snowflake, Azure, AWS, GPC, Dataiku, etc)
·         Experience with PowerBI
Education/Qualifications:
Tertiary qualification in relevant field (e.g. Data Science, Computer Science)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Overview:
This role requires a dynamic individual who can leverage data visualization, analysis, and trend identification to support business decision-making while also providing strategic insights to drive process improvements and efficiency. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Tableau and/or Power BI, with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to interpret complex datasets to uncover meaningful patterns that enhance business performance.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop interactive dashboards and data-driven reports using Tableau and/or Power BI, translating raw data into actionable insights.
Conduct in-depth data analysis and trend forecasting to identify opportunities for business improvement.
Utilize data visualization techniques to communicate findings in a clear and impactful way.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business objectives and provide data-backed recommendations.
Support decision-making, strategy planning, and process optimization using structured data analysis.
Implement and manage data warehousing solutions for efficient storage and retrieval.
Apply basic coding (Python) skills for automation and advanced data manipulation.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy, maintaining high standards in reporting and analysis.
Qualifications and Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics) or a professional certification in data analysis.
Strong proficiency in Tableau and/or Power BI (experience in both is a plus).
Expertise in data visualization, trend analysis, and business intelligence.
Experience in data warehousing, SQL, and structured reporting is highly desirable.
Basic programming knowledge in Python for automation and analysis.
Strong problem-solving abilities with a business-driven approach to analysis.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain complex data in a clear, business-relevant manner.
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of statistical modeling, predictive analytics, or AI-driven business solutions.
Familiarity with process optimization, forecasting, and strategic planning.
Experience in business performance metrics and financial analysis

Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid Working)
Requirements: Qualifications | We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us. |
Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
SEEK operates market-leading online employment marketplaces, including Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia. SEEK has been helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helping organisations succeed for over 25 years.
Founded and headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, SEEK has grown into a multinational technology company with over 3,300 employees and is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange.
SEEK’s presence spans Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore and Thailand. Additionally, SEEK has minority investments in employment marketplaces in China, South Korea and Bangladesh.
SEEK develops and applies innovative data and technology tools to facilitate high-quality matching and improve reliability of marketplace information.
In 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, SEEK was recognised as one of Australia’s Top Ten Places to Work in Technology in the AFR BOSS Best Places to Work awards. SEEK was also named a 5-Star Employer of Choice by HRD Asia in 2024 and won four accolades at TalentCorp’s Life at Work Awards 2023 in Malaysia.
Job Description
Join SEEK Pass, the trusted digital passport revolutionizing how people manage and share their verified credentials across the job market. We're a fast-growing scale-up within SEEK, operating across Malaysia, Australia, and beyond.
What You'll Do
Be the Analytics Champion
Drive data-driven decision making across our entire product suite
Build dashboards and KPI monitoring that guide strategic decisions
Partner with engineering, product, and operations to uncover game-changing insights
Analyze user behavior, funnel performance, and business metrics that directly impact millions of users
Shape Product Strategy
Conduct A/B testing and statistical analysis to optimize user experience
Provide analytical support for multiple product squads simultaneously
Deliver strategic business analysis that influences our roadmap
Help evolve our analytics infrastructure and tooling
Qualifications
 What We're Looking For
SQL Expert: Advanced skills in managing complex, large-scale datasets
Storyteller: Ability to find meaning in data and communicate insights clearly
Analytics Pro: Experience with A/B testing, funnel analysis, and statistical significance
Tool Savvy: Familiarity with Tableau, Databricks, Python/R is highly valued
Collaborative: Strong communication skills across technical and business teams
Startup Mindset: Comfortable with ambiguity and willing to roll up your sleeves
Why This Role?
Work in a cross-functional scale-up environment with 80+ talented people across KL, Melbourne, and Sydney. You'll have direct impact on a product that's transforming how people showcase their credentials to employers, while being part of SEEK's larger data science community.
Desired Values
Believed in aiming high to deliver world-class results and yet, not forgetting to care for others
Additional Information
At SEEK we offer:
Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days  as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Title: Data Science Engineer
Description:
Roles and Responsibility
Data Analysis: Perform thorough data analysis to discover trends, patterns, and insights that can inform decision-making processes.
Model Development: Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to solve complex problems and improve business operations.
Data Collection: Gather and preprocess large datasets from various sources to ensure data quality and accuracy.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and business analysts, to integrate data solutions into business applications.
Reporting: Create comprehensive reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders clearly and effectively.
Algorithm Optimization: Continuously refine and optimize algorithms to enhance performance and reliability.
Research: Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning to apply innovative approaches in projects.
Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of data processes, models, and findings for future reference and reproducibility.
Educational Qualifications
· Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
· Ph.D. Degree in a relevant discipline is preferred but not mandatory.
Technical Skills
· Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and Java. Knowledge of other languages like Scala or C++ is advantageous.
· Data Manipulation: Experience with data manipulation libraries such as Pandas, NumPy and etc.
· Machine Learning: Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and XGBoost.
· Database Management: Skills in database management systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, and NoSQL databases like MongoDB.
· Big Data Technologies: Proficiency in Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, and other big data technologies.
· Data Visualization: Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, and Seaborn.
Analytical Skills
· Statistical Analysis: Knowledge of statistical methods and their application in data analysis.
· Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.
· Data Interpretation: Ability to interpret complex data and generate actionable insights.
Experience
· Industry Experience: Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data science, data engineering, or related roles.
· Project Management: Proven experience in managing and executing data science projects.
· Team Collaboration: Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with stakeholders.
· Research: Ability to stay updated with the latest research and advancements in the field of data science.
Soft Skills
· Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex ideas effectively.
· Teamwork: Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.
· Adaptability: Flexibility and adaptability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
· Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
· Time Management: Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines.
Additional Requirements
· Certifications: Professional certifications in data science, machine learning, or related areas are a plus (e.g., Certified Data Scientist, AWS Certified Machine Learning).
· Portfolio: A strong portfolio showcasing previous data science projects and achievements.
· Continuous Learning: Commitment to continuous learning and professional development.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
-Analyze various company metrics across departments to support strategic decision-making.
-Generate regular reports and dashboards with insights and recommendations tailored to each department.
-Monitor departmental KPIs and identify issues or opportunities for improvement.
-Collaborate with departments to understand needs and deliver tailored insights.
-Assist in building standardized processes, analytical models, or automated reporting tools to improve efficiency.
Requirements:
-Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
-Proficient in Microsoft Excel and at least one data analysis tool (e.g., SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Python, or R).
-Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and critical thinking skills.
-Ability to communicate findings clearly and work collaboratively across departments.
-Experience in data visualization and business reporting is an advantage.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - GenAI (Hybrid Working)
Requirements: Qualifications | Essential Qualifications, Skills, and Experience | A MSc or PhD qualification in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent experience. | We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us. |
Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more productive and fulfilling working lives and to help organisations succeed.
By joining us, you’ll be part of a multinational technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it’s where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.
Why join us?
Be part of a multinational tech company with strong core values to help us solve complex challenges while building a flexible, exciting career – one that could take you anywhere. We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment.
As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multilingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region. Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.
Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences & courses while you work alongside seasoned experts.
Job Description
The Role
As a Senior Data Scientist at SEEK, you'll be part of a fast-paced, supportive environment where you can make a real difference. You'll work on complex challenges that have a direct impact on people's lives, helping us evolve our business and reach new heights.
You will report a Data Science Lead and work alongside other highly motivated Data Scientists in the Generative AI team. You will collaborate with product managers, designers, engineers, and others across multiple teams to design and develop Generative AI solutions for both internal and external (customer-facing) use cases.
Key Responsibilities
In this role, you will be expected to:
Research, propose, and implement new AI solutions (and evolve existing ones) to improve a product or business outcome.
Compile and develop datasets as appropriate to train or evaluate AI systems.
Perform offline evaluation of AI systems and contribute to the design of online experiments.
Evangelise appropriate AI methods and explain their benefits and limitations to various audiences, acting as a technical reference within the business on topics related to AI.
Break down problems and projects, estimate and prioritise activities, and propose alternatives to overcome obstacles.
Work together with Product Managers, Engineers, and other stakeholders to build relationships within the organisation based on trust.
Mentor junior Data Scientists and share technical expertise with the DS team.
The Team
Situated within the larger Artificial Intelligence & Analytics team at SEEK, the Generative AI team is a practice team focusing on GenAI. The GenAI team has two streams of work. The Applications stream partners with SEEK product owners and may embed Data Scientists into the team to develop and test opportunities to build GenAI-based services. The Capabilities stream builds early-stage prototypes to test the latest GenAI technology, and also develops core functionality into platform capabilities to enable sustainable scaling of GenAI services.
We work on a quarterly planning cycle to develop our roadmap, which consists of internal R&D projects as well as partnerships with internal product teams, where we act as specialist consultants. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work autonomously to deliver one or more initiatives for the team. The team runs various team rituals such as weekly stand-ups and knowledge sharing sessions, monthly team retrospectives, and others as needed. You will also attend project-related meetings as necessary.
Qualifications
Essential Qualifications, Skills, and Experience
A MSc or PhD qualification in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent experience. 
Professional experience developing and delivering AI/ML solutions.
Deep understanding of the theory and practice of how to build, train, evaluate, and optimise AI/ML models.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple language.
Ability to adapt quickly and thrive in an environment of rapid change.
The following are preferred but not essential:
Demonstrated experience leading AI/ML projects and managing multiple stakeholders.
Deep technical knowledge of the foundations of Generative AI: deep learning; transformers; encoder/decoder models; pre-training and post-training; RLFH; LORA.
Hands-on experience training or adapting large language models.
Hands-on experience building solutions with pre-trained LLMs, using techniques such as prompt engineering, RAG, agentic workflows, etc.
Experience with conversational design and developing conversational AI systems.
Additional Information
Perks and benefits
Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days  as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
Casual dress – every day
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Describe a clear requirement for data engineers to build data pipeline | Qualifications: |
Description:
Benefits of this role:
13th Months Salary (upon Company Declaration)
Project Incentive (upon Company Declaration based on project performance)
Transport, Meal, Birthday Allowances (upon Confirmation)
Sports Activities (Badminton & Basketball), Company Outing
Training and certification sponsored by company (Selected employees).
Rewards and recognition: Long Service Award / Best Performer Award / Role Model Awards etc
Medical Insurance (upon Confirmation)
Optical, Dental, Body Check Up Claim (upon Confirmation)
 Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Analyst to join our Data and Analytics team. As a Data Analyst at SNSOFT， you will play a critical role in helping us understand player behaviour, optimize game performance, and drive informed decision-making across the organization. If you are passionate about gaming and have a strong analytical mindset, we invite you to apply and be a part of our exciting journey.
 Key Responsibilities:
Data collection and processing: 
Collect data from multiple sources, including internal databases, public datasets, APIs, and more.
Clean and preprocess data for analysis. This includes handling missing values, outliers, and formatting data.
Describe a clear requirement for data engineers to build data pipeline
Data analysis:
Analyze data using statistical methods and models to extract useful information or insights.
Conduct descriptive statistical analysis, exploratory data analysis (EDA), hypothesis testing, etc.
Data Visualization: 
Use charts, graphs, and dashboards to present data analysis results so that non-technical people can understand the insights behind the data.
Create interactive reports and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, Google Data Studio, and more.
Report preparation and presentation:
Write analytical reports and present analytical results to support business decisions.
Work with the team and management to interpret the results of data analysis and provide recommendations based on the data.
Cross-department collaboration:
Work with different departments to understand business needs and customize data analytics projects based on those needs.
Support the data needs of marketing, sales, finance and other teams.
Data Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data validation processes and quality checks.
 Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related discipline). Advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the gaming industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
Strong data visualization skills using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and A/B testing methodologies.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
Passion for gaming and a deep understanding of gaming mechanics and player behaviour is a plus.

Title: Data Annotator
Description:
Job Description
Key Responsibilities:
 Accurately label and categorize large datasets, including text, audio, images, and video.
Review and correct data annotations to ensure quality and consistency.
Work closely with the AI and Machine Learning teams to understand project-specific guidelines.
Provide feedback to improve the data annotation process.
Meet daily/weekly annotation targets while maintaining high-quality standards.
 Requirements:
 Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Basic computer skills and familiarity with online tools.
Ability to follow detailed instructions and adapt to changing project needs.
Prior experience in data annotation or related fields is a plus but not required.
Some English Language capabilities an advantage as some tooling may have an English UI. Additionally, some training may be only available in English (but may be translated).

Title: Data Scientist
Company: Western Digital Tech and Regional Center (M) Sdn Bhd
Requirements: Meeting users, gathering user requirements and communicating requirements to a technical team member for technical solution design, feasibility study & planning. | Qualification |
Description:
Job Description
Responsibilities
Work with data scientists, data engineers, software engineers, process & product engineers, design engineers, etc collaboratively to develop new data science solutions that improve productivity and operations metrics.
Researching and developing scalable Generative-AI solutions using AWS Bedrock platform, Large Language Models (LLM) and prompt engineering for factory/engineering usage
Deploy models and solutions using DevOps/MLOps tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow, AWS & Edge to ensure scalability and reproducibility.
Collaborate in cross-functional teams to integrate AI/ML algorithms, image analytics and software into the Analytics systems (including chatbot/AR/Computer Vision) as well as develop prototypes.
Design, develop, deploy and maintain Analytics Systems/solutions (Data engineering, Data Science, Chatbot, AI, Generative-AI, AR, Computer vision and Visualization/Web App) independently and delivered on time.
Meeting users, gathering user requirements and communicating requirements to a technical team member for technical solution design, feasibility study & planning.
Translate User Request into Analytics Solution from a system perspective. Prepare and deliver presentations with data visualizations and business conclusions.
Constantly learn new front tier technology and creatively apply/deliver solutions to manufacturing operations to meet KPIs.
Qualification
Masters or Bachelor Degree in Computer science, data science, computer engineering, information technology, or relevant work experience and education background.
We will also consider applicants with the equivalent combination of education, technical expertise, training, or work experience.
Preferably minimum 1-2 years of working experience in related field (Generative-AI & Chatbot).
Skills
Required: Python, LLM, Prompt Engineering, Chatbot, Generative -AI, Augmented Reality, Computer Vision
Added Advantage: Agentic AI and Multi-Agent architecture.  
Practical experience in application of ML and Deep Learning algorithms.
SQL, Relational databases, Big Data platforms, AWS Redshift, PRESTO, ETL, SSIS etc.
Some experience with web front end development: .NET, VB.NET, C#, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, NodeJS, JQuery & Angular
Ability to learn quickly and become productive on new technologies, APIs, development languages and frameworks.
Experience in data mining, data wrangling, and handling JSON, CSV files.
Hands on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Edge computing and AWS.. etc
Experience with data visualization methods (Spotfire, PowerBI, Grafana)
The ability to problem solves and provide complex solutions with minimal supervision
Knowledge of Agile development, SCRUM and Application Lifecycle Management
Excellent communications and presentation skills, with the ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audience, including executives. A great team player.
Self-motivated, strong ownership and ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Additional Information
Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Western Digital has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Western Digital’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Western Digital and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Western Digitals Ethics Helpline or email compliance@wdc.com

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Communicate with stakeholders and understand the entire data extraction requirement. | Job Requirements: |
Description:
Key Duties & Responsibilities:
Communicate with stakeholders and understand the entire data extraction requirement. 
Clean input data, then perform bulk data extraction, and check the data integrity, and conduct analysis of the output data in a timely manner.
Conduct ad hoc analysis to support other departments i.e. sales, marketing, operations, and request from management.
Identify and rectify data integrity issues and liaise with members and respective data sources/owners.
Verify and investigate credit rating and score enquiry against the credit information, and provide useful advice to the enquirer for external and internal stakeholders.
Work closely with project and software team to improve end-to-end process.
Any other task assigned by management
 Job Requirements:
At least a Bachelor's Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Computer Science / Actuarial Studies / Economics or equivalent.
Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.
Proficient in Excel and programming languages like Python and SQL.
Capability to produce detailed and factually accurate and easily comprehensible reports.
Knowledge and experience in SQL and/or Statistic will be an added advantage.
Strong organizational skills and ability to work independently to meet deadlines
Good communication and interpersonal skills with attention to details and strong work ethic.
*Our recruitment team will reach out to shortlisted candidates only.

Title: Senior Executive, Content Analytics (Data Collection & Analysis)
Requirements: Qualification & Work Experience | Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other related qualification from a recognized university. |
Description:
Job Summary
Supervise, formulate, develop, lead and manage large data sets to support policy development and regulatory compliance through data-driven insights, and work closely with cross-functional teams to drive high-impact business decisions, ensuring the organization's objectives of high awareness, responsiveness, and engagement are achieved.
Job Responsibilities:
Data Collection and Processing
Lead and manage large sets of structured and unstructured data from various sources such as internal databases, third-party APIs, and web scraping. Supervise data cleaning tasks to address missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies, ensuring the data is accurate and reliable. Preprocess data by normalizing, transforming, and encoding it to prepare for analysis and modelling, ensuring it meets the required quality standards.
Data Analysis
Formulate and apply statistical techniques to analyze data, identifying significant patterns, correlations, and trends to inform business decisions. Utilize machine learning algorithms to build models that predict outcomes, classify data, and uncover hidden patterns. Interpret the results of data analysis to generate actionable insights that drive business strategies and operational improvements.
Model Development
Develop and supervise predictive models to forecast future trends, customer behavior, and other key business metrics using historical data. Implement machine-learning algorithms tailored to specific business problems, optimizing them for accuracy and efficiency. Ensure models are understandable to stakeholders by translating complex technical concepts into clear, actionable insights.
Visualization
Formulate and develop interactive dashboards to visualize key metrics, trends, and insights, making data accessible to stakeholders. Utilize visualization tools or custom-built solutions to present data in a compelling and easily digestible format. Create visual narratives that effectively communicate data insights, aiding stakeholders in making informed decisions.
Collaboration
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, operations, and product development, to understand their data needs and deliver tailored solutions. Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
Research
Keep up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Explore new data sources, analytical methods, and technologies to enhance the organization's data capabilities and maintain a competitive edge. Engage in continuous learning through courses, conferences, and professional networks to keep skills and knowledge current.
Automation
Develop, lead and maintain automated Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes to streamline data flow from source systems to analytical platforms. Implement automation to enhance data processing efficiency, reducing manual intervention and minimizing errors. Supervise and ensure data is readily available for analysis by creating robust data pipelines that support both real-time and batch processing needs.
Impact and Risk Assessment
Lead and assess associated and risks with critical cases/ action. Escalate and propose courses of actions for consideration and approval of Head department.
Standards and Reporting
Supervise, formulate and reinforce standards for scheduled reporting to articulate stakeholder expectations clearly, ensuring their understanding.
Single Source of Truth
Supervise and implement methodologies and processes to maintain single source of truth for reporting and analytics purposes.
Unit Management and Development
Supervise and manage a robust team with unit staff. Set clear objectives, collaborate with direct reports on effective execution strategies, monitor progress, communicate outcomes, and supervise the management and development of unit staff.
Qualification & Work Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other related qualification from a recognized university.
Minimum 3 - 5 years working experience, with strong knowledge in data mining, machine learning, big data frameworks, as well sound understandings of legal and regulatory frameworks.
Technical Competencies/Skills
Programming language skills (Phython, R, or Java)
Data visualization (Tableau, Power BI or D3.js) 4 SQL and database management systems
Big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure or Google Cloud)
Emerging technology synthesis
Governance
Partnership management
Risk assessment and management
Quality standards and assurance
Microsoft Office
 Behavioral Competencies/Skills
Resilience
Critical thinking
Analytical thinking
Communication skills
Interpersonal skills
Stakeholder management
Conflict management
Negotiation skills
Time management with sense of urgency
Collaboration skills
Confidence
Concern about order
Attention to detail
  Candidate must be willing to work in Cyberjaya.
