Title: Senior Data Analyst (Power BI / Python)
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Develop, maintain, and optimize interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI for various departments (e.g., Marketing, Sales, HR, Ops).
Perform data modeling, cleaning, and transformation from multiple sources (Google Sheets, Excel, SQL databases, etc.).
Use Python (Pandas, NumPy, etc.) to automate workflows, data analysis, and forecasting models.
Provide deep-dive data analysis and trends to support business decisions, campaigns, or operational improvements.
Collaborate closely with key stakeholders to define metrics, KPIs, and reporting standards across departments.
Ensure data quality, governance, and consistency across platforms.
Identify performance gaps, patterns, and optimization opportunities based on internal data.
Support the company’s transition into data-centric operations, including training or enabling other team members when needed.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum 3–5 years of experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Proficient in Power BI and/or Python for analysis and reporting.
Strong understanding of data querying (SQL) and relational databases.
Experience in building and managing KPI dashboards.
Excellent communication skills — able to explain insights to non-technical users.
Highly detail-oriented, analytical, and business-driven mindset.
Nice to Have:
Experience working in a fast-paced, multi-departmental business environment.
Familiarity with data connectors/APIs, Google Workspace, or automation tools (e.g., Power Automate).
Prior exposure to business operations, digital marketing, or HR analytics is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders to understand business challenges and opportunities, transforming raw data into valuable insights. You will be responsible for sourcing, cleaning, and analyzing data, uncovering patterns and trends that drive strategic decisions. By creating clear and effective data visualizations, you will present your findings in a way that simplifies complex information, supporting the development of data-driven products and initiatives.
The Data Analyst will report to Chief Product Officer directly.
 Job Responsibilities: 
Collaborating with stakeholders to define business challenges or opportunities.
Sourcing, cleaning, and preparing data for analysis.
Analyzing data to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
Creating data visualizations to simplify complex information.
Presenting findings in a compelling way that supports strategic decision-making and contributes to building data-driven products.
 Job Requirements: 
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proficient in SQL for querying databases and working with large datasets.
Knowledge on Statistical analysis and data analysis
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Familiarity with Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Experience with ETL processes and understanding of data warehousing concepts.
Strong ability to translate business questions into analytical tasks.
Expertise in data cleaning, preprocessing, and structuring.
Problem-solving abilities to find patterns and actionable insights from data.
Ability to work with large, complex datasets and perform exploratory and statistical analyses. 
Ability to present findings in a clear, concise manner through reports and visual presentations.
Experience collaborating cross-functionally with teams like product, marketing, and sales to identify data-driven solutions.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst, or related role.
Familiarity with relevant industry data, especially if applying for specialized sectors like e-commerce, fintech, online marketplace etc.
 About Xamble Group Limited
Xamble Group Limited is a thriving digital ecosystem that is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX:XGL). From our core business of influencer marketing to digital marketing, performance marketing, social commerce and membership platform – we cultivate communities and drive value for brands, creators and consumers with our end-to-end web3 and generative AI-enabled ecosystem.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description
Bridge between big data and machine learning model
Analyse historical data, identify predictive pattern, engineer robust features to improve model accuracy
Translate business knowledge into quantifiable data points & statistical insights
Job Scope & Responsibilities
Data Collection & Management
Design, implement & maintain ETL process
Ensure data quality, integrity & consistency
Optimize data warehouse schemas, query performance to ensure efficient data access & analytical process
Advanced Feature Engineering
Collaborate with users to understand domain knowledge / mechanics
Translate the knowledge into quantifiable, predictive features
Develop complex SQL queries to create high impact features for machine learning models, including lagged features & rolling aggregates
Identify & prevent data leakage
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
Conduct in-depth statistical analysis & exploratory data visualization to identify hidden patterns, trends, correlations & anomalies within data.
Analyse the distribution of target variable to inform the selection & refinement of statistical modelling
Model Evaluation & Interpretation Support
Assist in the rigorous evaluation of model performance using relevant metrics. For e.g. RMSE, MAE, etc.
Perform detailed residual analysis to understand prediction errors and identify systemic biases or areas for model improvement
Collaborate with team to interpret model outputs & translate complex analytical finding into clear, actionable recommendations for refinement
Reporting & Automation
Develop & maintain automated reports & dashboards to monitor key performance indicators, track model accuracy & visualize critical data trends
Continuous Improvement & Research
Proactively identify opportunities for new data sources, analytical methods and model enhancement
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related quantitative field.
2+ years as a Data Analyst with strong hands-on experience in data extraction, cleaning, transformation and feature engineering
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and their application in data analysis
Proficiency in programming languages like SQL, R, and Python
Proficiency in data visualisation software e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio
Good written and spoken English language
A deep passion for and strong understanding in MOBA mechanics
Self-motivated, detail-oriented and able to work effectively both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Experience in BigQuery, Dataflow and BigQueryML is a bonus
Interested candidates, kindly submit detailed resumes via clicking "Apply Now" button. All profiles will be handled with strictest confidentiality. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Thank you.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur (Hybrid)
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
Quantitative analysis is a vital component in the day-to-day operations within Soprano and our team in KL are excited to welcome an Inquisitive big data navigator to impact and shape the future of our business. As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be tasked with analysing, deriving insights, and execute strategies to grow GP in a competitive trading-like setting. The role involves navigating and strategizing in imperfect information scenarios and executing it in a detailed tactical level to directly improve monetary and service results.
Using a variety of quantitative and stochastic methods, you will have the opportunity to translate complex mathematical methods into business outcomes. You will also have the chance to communicate these ideas and analysis to senior leadership. By helping the organisation make informed decisions, take risks with high expected value while navigating and hedging against said risk and uncertainty, you have a direct and significant influence on the profitability of the business.
If you're a lover of stress-testing ideas, debating risk vs reward and wants to be part of a team that respects unique ideas and room to experiment, let us know by applying today!
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
This includes but is not limited to:
Develop, implement, validate, and continuously improve quantitative models to analyse and derive insight from data.
Understand the data at a deep hands-on level to control outcomes at a fine granular level.
Automate the analysis and models to run in real time and at scale.
Develop trading strategies to boost GP, hedge against risk and balance conflicting outcomes in imperfect game theory scenarios
Proactively look for ways to measure and obtain information, including competitor pricing analysis, behaviour analysis in a multi-competitor competition, and implementing indirect metrics to create emergent variables to handle and measure uncertain factors.
Present and communicate analysis, insights, and strategies to various internal stakeholders in a relevant and understandable manner.
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE TO SUCCEED
At least 2 years of experience in utilising quantitative techniques on business or financial data.
Experience in implementing mathematical and machine learning models in programming languages such as Python, R, Haskell etc.
Excellent and creative problem solving and critical thinking skills
Experience in developing and executing strategies to improve monetary outcomes, including managing exit strategies and hedging against risk.
Solid background in mathematics, statistics, game theory, and stochastic modelling.
Must be independent and self-directed.
Demonstrate high standards of performance and behaviour
ABOUT US
Headquartered in Sydney, Australia, and operating globally, Soprano Design is a leading global communications platform as a service (CPaaS) provider that brings nearly 30 years of experience with enterprise-level mobile messaging to each of our over 4,500 government and enterprise clients around the globe.
Soprano’s flagship product, Soprano Connect, is an innovative award-winning CPaaS platform that helps customers to strategically integrate, email, SMS, voice, conversational AI, IP messaging and social channels such as RCS, WhatsApp and Google Business Messages into a seamless secure omni-channel business mobile messaging experience.
WHY WORK FOR SOPRANO:
Work for a leader in the CPaaS industry: We are a leading enabler for enterprise communications, with a customer-centered approach that allows us to reach significant results with our clients and partners.
Our focus on Technology: We pride ourselves on building technology for the future of communication that creates richer meanings, deeper trust and better connections.
Global presence: Soprano is headquartered in Sydney, but we have a global presence in Europe, North America, South America, New Zealand and Southeast Asia
Collaborative and inclusive environment: We are committed to a workplace environment where every employee is respected and empowered to be their best selves at work.
Training and Development: We’re a small company with global presence that allows you to gain valuable insight and exposure to various markets worldwide
Competitive salaries: We are a pay for performance company that values your contributions through our competitive salaries, rewards and recognition programs
Flexible Working: We’re a lover of hybrid working, and this allows us to stay connected to our global teams while allocating time to do the things we love. Some roles are remote due to scope.
People are at the core of what we do and Soprano Design Pty Ltd is committed to a safe, diverse and inclusive workplace where we all thrive and succeed together. We encourage applications regardless of age, gender, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures. Please let us know if you require any adjustments to the recruitment process.
All successful applicants will need to providing two professional reference checks and is subject to satisfactory background checks

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst, Executive
Company: Tokio Marine Life Insurance Malaysia Bhd
Requirements: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions. | Job Requirements: |
Description:
Job Function:
We are seeking for a skilled Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst to help us leverage the data to drive business insights and growth. The ideal candidate should possess a strong background in data and business analysis, along with analytical and communication skills. A sound business understanding and problem-solving abilities are also desired.
Key Responsibilities:
Collect, process and analyze datasets with different data structures to extract meaningful insights.
Support the design of data warehouse and/or data marts to ensure data analytics takes place in an efficient, scalable and accurate way.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders through data visualization and presentations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Support upgrades, configurations and troubleshooting of business intelligence and data tools.
Monitor and administer automated ETL or data processes to verify execution and measure performance
Prepare documentation as part of knowledge transfer.
Job Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
Proficiency in Python, R, and SQL.
Understanding of statistical techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, and clustering.
Hands-on experience with ETL tools and processes.
In-depth understanding of database management systems and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework and familiar with BI technologies
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Possess good verbal and written communication skills in English.
Full-Time position(s) available.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our team. The BI Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data to provide actionable insights, support strategic decision-making, and optimize business performance. The candidate will play a key role in delivering data-driven recommendations to enhance customer experience, maximize revenue, and improve operational efficiency.
 RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze large data sets from various sources, including customer behavior, product performance, and financial metrics, to identify trends and opportunities.
Develop, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reporting tools to visualize data and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work closely with stakeholders, including marketing, operations, and product teams, to provide data insights that support strategic business decisions.
Monitor and evaluate customer activity, including churn rates, customer segmentation, and lifetime value (LTV) to inform marketing and retention strategies.
Identify opportunities for optimization in product offerings, customer acquisition, and retention strategies.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to answer business questions, troubleshoot performance issues, and suggest improvements.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure accurate data collection, storage, and retrieval.
Present findings and recommendations to management in clear and concise reports or presentations.
Assist in forecasting models, predictive analytics, and other advanced data techniques to enhance decision-making.
 SKILLS
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data sets.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present data-driven insights to non-technical stakeholders.
 REQUIREMENTS
Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 - 4 years of professional experience in BI.
Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes is a plus.
Proven experience as a BI Analyst.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Metabase and Power BI.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with databases to extract and analyze data.
Familiarity with statistical tools and methods for data analysis and modeling is a plus.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver accurate results in a fast-paced environment.
 BENEFITS
5 Working days
Casual (e.g. T-shirts)
EPF & SOCSO
Team Buildings
Plenty of Coffee & Snacks
Annual and medical leave
Performance Bonus
Open, Friendly, and Positive Working Environment

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Communicating with client service to understand data content, business and analysis requirement | Qualifications: |
Description:
PURPOSE
Provide analytical modelling and solution to the Ipsos research/account team worldwide.
Guide, optimize study and questionnaire design for efficient analytics and cost management.
Drive the integration of new tools and innovative thinking in analytics to better meet client needs.
The role will require working closely with client service teams across all regions, The team members all are passionate, share a positive attitude, problem solving abilities and patience, enabling them to provide excellent customer service even during fast-paced shifts.
 ENVIRONMENT
Embark on an extraordinary career journey at Ipsos, where cutting-edge AI work seamlessly intertwines with our day-to-day operations. With a staggering global presence of 16,600 talented minds across 89 countries, we are one of the largest and best-known research companies. Join us on a quest for knowledge and innovation, where you'll have the privilege of collaborating with the most naturally curious researchers and making a profound impact on both local and global brands.
As a curious and intuitive individual, an enthusiastic professional fueled by a passion for knowledge creation, Ipsos beckons you to immerse yourself fully into finding the optimal solutions for our clients. Our environment is a fertile breeding ground for entrepreneurship and forward thinking, attracting like-minded professionals who possess drive, intelligence, and enthusiasm. Working at Ipsos is dynamic and challenging, never a dull moment!
 OUTPUTS/ACCOUNTABILITY 
Communicating with client service to understand data content, business and analysis requirement
Ability to break down and understand complex business problems, define a solution
Perform statistical modelling/analysis, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, interpret and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, and finally to prepare core deliverables or report (PowerPoint)
Ability to work independently, manage and monitor research projects from commissioning to delivery by utilizing well-developed project management skills, knowledge, deep insight and communicate skills.  Able to work under pressure and meet aggressive deadlines
Demonstrate strong supervisory skills, i.e. project delegation, time management, day-to-day feedback on performance and behavior, conduct performance reviews.
Keep abreast of current trends within market research, to develop personal skills / knowledge base and display specialist knowledge of a market and share this with others
Keenness to learn and proactive self-development and development of others
Assist with recruitment and couching of junior staffs
 COMPETENCIES 
Analytical/critical/forward thinking | Problem-solving | Decision-making | Communication Management | Project Management | Client Service/Focus | Achievement Oriented | Adaptability | Collaboration | Embracing Diversity | Nurturing Innovation | Proactive | Multi-tasking |Attention to detail | Curiosity
 RELATIONSHIPS
Effective interface with client service and project teams
Promote teamwork in the business area, Division and across Ipsos 
Lead by example and behavior (incorporating values) within the business area
Direct and manage the project team activities 
Behave in a manner that displays professionalism, integrity and corporate citizenship at all times
 DEVELOPMENT
Develop a good breadth of experience of different analysis techniques
Confidence and demonstrated capabilities & creativities in applying different tools, techniques and approaches
Demonstrate strong capabilities and leadership in one’s project, people and business management
Understanding of personal actions on business and client
 BACKGROUND
Experience:
At least 1 years of experiences in marketing data analytics/data science or similar fields
Understand and use statistical analysis 
Solid experience in project management
Bonus: Experienced in market research  
 Skills/Knowledge:
Statistical analysis and knowledge
Data manipulation
Analytical tools proficiency (eg. Microsoft Excel, SPSS, SAS are essential)
Programming languages - Python or R for data analysis and data visualization
Solid communication skills
Couching and mentoring skills
Bonus: Experienced in AI, machine learning and deep learning 
 Qualifications:
Degree in Data Science, Statistics/Mathematics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Psychology, Social Science or related studies

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
The Senior Data Scientist will play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making within the financial services industry. This position focuses on developing and implementing advanced analytics solutions to solve complex business problems
Client Details
The organization is a well-established, large financial services provider that focuses on delivering innovative solutions to its clients.
Description
Responsible for developing a robust machine learning model for credit scoring that is highly scalable and compliant with BASEL II guidelines.
Re-evaluate credit risk model performance on a periodic basis for retraining using statistics
Develop innovative data science methodologies to manage credit risk of the lending portfolio
Contribute to core advanced analytics and machine learning platforms and tools by research, discover new methodologies and new data feeds to support credit decisioning and other key business processes.
Profile
A successful Senior Data Scientist should have:
A strong educational background in data science, computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Minimum 7-8 years' experience in propensity modelling.
Cloud experience is a plus.
Job Offer
Competitive annual salary ranging from MYR 216000 to MYR 300000, plus bonuses.
Comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare and other perks.
Opportunities for professional development and career progression.
Engaging company culture that values innovation and collaboration.
This is an excellent opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist to advance their career in the financial services industry. If you are passionate about analytics and data-driven solutions, apply now!
To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact J-Shan Loke on +603 2302 4127.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Requirements: Qualifications | We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us. |
Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more productive and fulfilling working lives and to help organisations succeed.
By joining us, you’ll be part of a multinational technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it’s where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.
Why join us?
Be part of a multinational tech company with strong core values to help us solve complex challenges while building a flexible, exciting career – one that could take you anywhere. We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment.
As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multilingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region. Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.
Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences & courses while you work alongside seasoned experts.
Job Description
Join SEEK's Artificial Intelligence Platform Services team in Malaysia and help millions of job seekers find their perfect roles! As part of our Recommendations Squad, you'll blend data science, research, and ML engineering to build AI solutions that connect the right candidates with the right opportunities at internet scale.
What You'll Do
Transform business challenges into data-driven solutions, research and deploy cutting-edge recommendation systems, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to revolutionize how people find jobs. You'll work with massive datasets, explore emerging ML techniques, and directly impact job placements across SEEK's global platforms.
Translate business challenges into clear, data-driven problem statements
Gather and validate relevant data for analysis
Build and deploy AI recommendation systems that connect candidates with recruiters
Optimize job matching algorithms to improve placement success rates
Partner with cross-functional teams on complex business problems
Lead end-to-end solution development from concept to deployment
Research emerging ML technologies and methodologies
Qualifications
What We're Looking For
• Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in Data Science, ML, Computer Science, or related field
• 3-5 years of applied data science and ML experience in business environments
• Strong skills in SQL, Spark, Python/Scala/Go
• Deep expertise in classification, ranking, and recommendation systems
• Excellent communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences
Bonus Points For
Deep learning experience (Transformers, NLP), large language models, and thriving in fast-paced, agile environments.
Ready to use AI to change how the world works? Join our collaborative team where your innovations directly help people build better careers.
Additional Information
The Team
The Artificial Intelligence Platform Services (AIPS) is structured into cross-disciplinary squad with members from Data Science, Strategy and Engineering who work together to research, design, build and support end-to-end machine learning based products delivering direct value to hirers and job seekers.

At SEEK we offer:
Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
SEEK is committed to operating sustainably, certified carbon neutral for its business operations (through Climate Active), purchasing renewable energy for our office and working-from-home emissions and a target for net zero by 2030. 
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
SEEKer Support, a confidential service that offers employees up to six sessions with a mental health professional of your choice
Tailored career development planning (including Education Assistance Program)
Professional development sessions with industry leading guest speakers
 At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Title: Data Scientist
Requirements: Responsibilities & Requirements: | Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and define the scope of ML solutions. |
Description:
Responsibilities & Requirements:
Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Python programming.
Experience with ML libraries and frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
In-depth knowledge of vector databases for efficient data storage and retrieval.
Familiarity with embedding techniques and prompt engineering.
Hands-on experience with OpenAI technologies is a strong plus.
Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs) and LangChain framework preferred.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, classification, and clustering algorithms.
Experience deploying machine learning models as APIs in production environments.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills for effective collaboration with diverse stakeholders.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure.
Develop and deploy machine learning models covering supervised and unsupervised learning, NLP, and computer vision applications.
Collect, preprocess, and ensure the quality of large datasets; identify recursive features to improve model training.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and define the scope of ML solutions.
Evaluate, optimize, and maintain ML models for performance, scalability, and efficiency.
Implement and maintain APIs to integrate ML solutions into web and mobile platforms.
Explore new AI research areas, propose innovative ideas, and contribute to advancing AI technology.
Support the development of data pipelines and infrastructure to streamline machine learning workflows.
Participate in code reviews and promote best practices and team standards.

Title: Assistant Data Analysis Manager
Description:
Job Description:
As an Assistant Data Analyst Manager at CHAGEE Headquarters, you will lead a team responsible for extracting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various primary and secondary sources. Your role will involve overseeing the development and maintenance of databases, performing complex data analysis, and preparing reports to support decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities:
- Utilize automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources efficiently.
- Identify and rectify coding errors and corrupted data to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
- Develop and maintain databases and data systems, reorganizing data into a readable format for analysis.
- Perform in-depth analysis to assess the quality and significance of data, identifying patterns and trends.
- Filter data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems.
- Utilize statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets, facilitating diagnosis and prediction.
- Assign numerical value to essential business functions for assessing and comparing business performance over time.
- Analyze local, national, and global trends impacting the organization and the industry.
- Prepare comprehensive reports for management, stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
- Present final analysis reports to stakeholders, enabling them to make informed decisions based on various facts and trends.

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field.
- Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a managerial role.
- Proficiency in data extraction tools and database management systems.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
- Familiarity with statistical tools and techniques for data analysis and interpretation.
- Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information effectively.
- Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
- Attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting.

If you have a passion for data analysis and leadership, and you are eager to contribute to CHAGEE's data-driven decision-making processes, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join us in leveraging data insights to drive business success and innovation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Artificial Intelligence)
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated individual, the best of the bests talent to join our team as a Machine Learning Engineer (Artificial Intelligence). We welcome new graduates as well as experienced professionals who have the passion, curiosity, ability, and determination to be the best ML or AI engineer.
  Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms for complex and unique datasets, using various techniques such as mathematical modeling, scikit-learn, NLP, CNN, RNN, DL, RL, Video Transformers, GAN, LLM, RAG, prompt engineering, GPT, AI Agent, Foundation Models, GPT, MCP, VLM, and VLA
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to extract insights, identify business opportunities and provide data-driven recommendations
Stay up-to-date with the latest machine learning and AI techniques and tools
Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders in an easy-to-understand manner
 Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Informatics, Information Science or related fields
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Participation in Kaggle, Mathematics Olympiad or similar competitions is a plus
Excellent programming skills in Python, R, Java, or C++
Familiar with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, MLFlow, AutoML, TensorRT, CUDA, HuggingFace, LangChain, LlamaIndex
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Experience with designing, training, and deploying machine learning models
Customer centric and committed to deliver the best AI results to customers
 As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will receive guidance from experienced senior AI specialists and have opportunities for professional growth and advancement within the company. We also encourage vibe coding.
 Possible future career paths after 2 years include Senior Machine Learning Engineer, AI Architect, AI Team Lead, Data Scientist, Data Architect, Data Lead, Research Engineer, Senior Research Engineer.
 Please note that this position is only for the best of the bests, and we expect candidates to have a strong mathematical background and the grit to solve complex problems. If you believe you have what it takes to excel in this challenging position, apply now.
 Fresh Graduates are also encouraged to apply!

Title: Research and Data Analyst
Description:
🔎 About the Role
We’re looking for an experienced Research & Data Analyst to join our dynamic team at PLATFORM ONE (MALAYSIA) SDN. BHD. In this full-time role based in Petaling Jaya, you will be a key contributor to data-driven decision-making, Your analysis and insights will support marketing, business strategy, and research initiatives.
📊 What You’ll Be Doing
Collect, clean, and manage large volumes of data from surveys, digital platforms, and client sources.
Ensure data integrity through thorough cleaning, validation, and transformation of raw datasets.
Develop, optimise, and run SPSS syntax for dataset generation, cleaning, and validation across multiple research projects.
Apply statistical methods, predictive modelling, and segmentation techniques to derive actionable insights.
Conduct detailed cross-tabulation analysis of survey and market datasets; summarise insights in client-facing PowerPoint reports.
Build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools to support internal teams and external clients.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams — including Insights, Product, and Client Success — to translate business needs into analytical outputs.
Manage timelines and deliverables to ensure high-quality insights are produced on schedule.
🎯 What We’re Looking For
Minimum 2 years of experience in a data analysis or research role, preferably within marketing or communications.
Proficient in SPSS, including syntax scripting and batch processing. Familiarity with R or Python is a plus.
Strong command of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentation creation.
Solid foundation in statistical concepts, such as weighting, significance testing, and segmentation.
Experience working with complex survey data and cross-tabulation tools (e.g., Askia, Q, Displayr or similar).
High attention to detail and a strong sense of accountability for data quality.
Ability to prioritise, work independently, and manage multiple projects under tight deadlines.
A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Science, or a related quantitative field.
🎁 What We Offer
Flexible working arrangements and a people-first company culture.
Healthcare benefits.
Opportunities for upskilling and professional certification.
A role that allows you to grow into deeper analytical or research specialisation.
🌍 About Us

PLATFORM ONE (MALAYSIA) SDN. BHD. is part of a global network of researchers, strategists, and technologists. We deliver insight-led marketing and data solutions that help brands make smarter decisions. We're innovative, curious, and committed to excellence — and we’re growing.
Apply now to join our growing team and be a part of our exciting journey!

Title: Data Engineer/ Data Scientist
Description:
About OMI Group:
Since 2017, OMI Group has been redefining the lifestyle and hospitality scene in Australia. With a diverse suite of concepts, OMI continues to bring people together through innovative food and gastronomic experiences.
Notable brands under OMI Group include OMI, recognized as “Best Japanese Restaurant” by The Age in 2020, and Local Hero Singapore, first Michelin Award-Winning brand operating in Australia. OMI was honoured as the winner for Australian Emerging Franchisor of the Year 2022, awarded by Franchise Council Australia.
Over the past seven years, OMI Group has expanded to 21 outlets across four major cities—Sydney, Melbourne, Canberra, and Kuala Lumpur. Most recently, the group unveiled its flagship concept store, OMI 380, in the heart of Melbourne CBD. Spanning 6,500 square feet, the space brings together a curated experience featuring Wagyu dining, a Matcha Bar, Sake Bar, Bakery, and Gelato. The launch has been widely featured by major media outlets across Australia.
As part of its next growth phase, OMI Group is preparing for international expansion into the Japan and China markets, aiming to bring its innovative F&B concepts to a wider global audience.
www.omigroup.com.au
About the Role:
We’re seeking an experienced Data Engineer/ Data Scientist to strengthen our data capabilities across brands and regions. This role will lead the development of robust analytics infrastructure, predictive models, and insightful reporting to drive performance, improve efficiency, and support strategic growth.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Collection & Management
Collect, clean, and validate data from various sources including POS, ERP, CRM, Excel, and departmental trackers (Retail, Marketing, Central Kitchen, Procurement, etc.)
Data Processing & Automation
Translate raw data into clear, actionable insights for various teams
Build financial models and dashboards to support forecasting, budgeting, and planning
Identify and implement process improvements and automation opportunities
Manage API integrations to streamline data flows and enhance reporting accuracy
System Building
Structure data inputs and flows to support ERP system design and implementation
Develop in-house POS solutions with full integration into the company’s ERP platform.
Data-Driven Insights
Define, monitor, and report KPIs across business units
Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to uncover insights
Create dashboards and reports using advanced data visualization tools to communicate key insights and trends effectively. 
Continuously improve reporting mechanisms to provide real-time insights and support ongoing optimization efforts.
Strategic Collaboration
Collaborate with the Strategy Team to develop data-backed proposals on product development, marketing, procurement, and production strategies
Provide insights to support decision-making across new product launches, promotional planning, supplier negotiation, and production efficiency
Regularly assess and report on team performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions.
Preferred Experience & Attributes:
Number Savvy
Highly proficient with numbers and exceptionally detail-oriented
Growth Mentality
Passion for learning and staying current on analytics trends.
Non-violent Communication
Commitment to non-violent, clear communication and team collaboration
Startup Mindset
Strong ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities remotely. Comfortable with ambiguity and willing to roll up your sleeves.
Language
Fluency in both English and Mandarin (spoken and written) is mandatory to collaborate effectively with teams across Australia, China, and Malaysia
Qualifications:
·       Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
·       At least 5 years of relevant experience, ideally in the F&B or multi-brand retail space.
·       Professional certifications in Data Analytics, Machine Learning, or related fields are a plus.
·       Expert-level skills in Python, SQL, Excel, and Power BI — including dashboard development, DAX, M Query, and Row-Level Security (RLS).
·       Proficiency in Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques for predictive modelling and pattern recognition.
·       Experience in developing customised POS systems and ERP systems is a strong advantage.
·       Strong technical knowledge in data engineering, including ETL, API integration, and scalable analytics architecture.
·       Experience in financial modelling to support budgeting, forecasting, and scenario analysis.
·       Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Work Environment:
Work from Home: Must have a high-performance computer and a stable internet connection.
How to Apply:
Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter. Shortlisted applicants will be required to complete a technical assessment and a corporate culture fit evaluation.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Summary of the role
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play a critical role in supporting the Head of Channel Management  and leadership team with data-driven insights, market intelligence, and performance analytics to sharpen competitive sales strategies and drive market dominance. Your analytical acumen and commercial mindset will help turn data into actionable business decisions.
Key Responsibilities
1. Sales & Market Intelligence:
•       Analyze channel performance (MM , retail, online, telco, dealer ) to identify growth opportunities and gaps.
•       Conduct competitor benchmarking (price, promotion, market share, product positioning).
•       Provide insights on consumer trends, market segmentation, and emerging demands in mobile device and consumer electronics categories.
2. Business Strategy Support:
•       Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Finance teams to identify strategic levers and measure performance KPIs.
•       Prepare dashboards and intelligence reports to track promotions, sell-in/sell-out trends, ROI on channel investments, and campaign effectiveness.
3. Forecasting & Modelling:
•       Support monthly and quarterly forecast processes with data modelling, sell-in/sell-out projections, and scenario analysis.
•       Create predictive models to identify high-value segments, churn risk, and cross-sell/up-sell opportunities.
4. Reporting & Visualisation:
•       Develop automated reports and real-time dashboards using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
•       Present insights in a clear, concise, and compelling manner to senior stakeholders.
5. Competitive Intelligence & Field Analysis:
•       Monitor market activities and gather field intelligence through trade feedback, secondary data (e.g., GfK, Canalys), and digital trends.
•       Generate monthly “Competitive Playbooks” to help the salesforce stay ahead.
Key Requirements:
1.   Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, or related fields.
2.   3–6 years in a Business Intelligence, Strategy, or Commercial Analytics role.
3.   Prior experience in mobile/consumer electronics, FMCG, telco, or ecommerce industries is highly preferred.
4.   Advanced Excel and SQL skills.
5.   Experience with data visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
6.   Proficiency in statistical tools (Python, R) is a plus.
7.   Strategic thinking with high business acumen.
8.   Strong communication and storytelling with data.
9.   Self-driven with high attention to detail and accuracy and able to work in fast-paced, agile, and cross-functional environments.

Title: Data Analyst / Risk Analyst
Requirements: Lead and support data-driven projects from requirement gathering to execution. | Job Requirements: |
Description:
Job Summary:
Lead data analysis, risk assessment, and fraud prevention strategies to drive smarter decisions and safeguard business integrity. You'll analyze trends, build predictive models, monitor real-time risk indicators, and collaborate across teams to implement effective, data-driven solutions.
If you're skilled in Excel, BI tools, SQL, and Python—and passionate about uncovering insights and managing risks—apply now to make a meaningful impact with advanced analytics and risk intelligence.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Insights
Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and risks using tools like Excel, SQL, and Python.
Deliver actionable insights and visualizations to support strategic and risk-related decisions.
Risk Management & Modeling
Develop and maintain risk assessment models to evaluate business exposures and enhance decision-making.
Monitor key risk indicators and help implement fraud detection and prevention strategies.
Data Collection & Process Optimization
Collect and organize data from multiple sources, ensuring data quality, consistency, and completeness.
Improve workflows through process automation and optimization initiatives.
Project Management & Implementation
Lead and support data-driven projects from requirement gathering to execution.
Coordinate implementation of risk mitigation measures across departments.
Cross-Functional Collaboration
Collaborate with teams such as Marketing, Operations, IT, and Finance to align data strategies with risk controls and business goals.
Continuous Improvement & Innovation
Stay current with analytics and risk management tools, including machine learning applications for predictive modeling and fraud detection.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or Diploma in Data Science, Risk Management, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or a related field.
Minimum 1 year of experience in data analysis, risk management, fraud detection, or a related field (internships considered).
Proficiency in Excel (including VBA and Power Query), SQL, and Python.
Strong statistical and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex datasets and spot anomalies or risk exposures.
Good communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Required language(s): English & Mandarin to effectively communicate with Mandarin-speaking clients.
Why Join Us?
Accessible Location: Office is within walking distance from the MRT.
Monthly Performance Bonus: Up to 4 digits monetary reward, get paid for your hard work.
Professional Development: Sponsorship for professional training and workshops.
Annual Leave Encashment: Get paid for unused leave.
Team Bonding: Monthly team bonding activities based on your preference.
Work Assets Provided: All necessary work tools and equipment are supplied.

Title: Software Developer (IoT Solutions)
Description:
We are an enterprise IoT, software & electronics design, and AI systems development company in Cyberjaya. We help innovative enterprises (PETRONAS, Alam Flora, Bateriku.com) to develop IoT solutions with AI/Machine Learning technologies from inception to production. We are a growing company with a fast-paced startup culture and requires management of multiple programs.
 Responsibilities
Design, develop, test & deploy web and mobile application using best practice.
Work in Agile/Scrum environment to deliver high quality output.
Prepare comprehensive documentation or manual to record details of development works
Participate and contribute to knowledge sharing and seek to improve continuously
Own the delivery of an entire piece of an application
Collaborate to investigate design approaches, prototype and evaluate technical feasibility
Apply proper UI/UX standard, design principle & interface guideline
Design, build, test & deploy database & data integration
Maintain data availability & consistency in processing pipeline
 Requirements
Minimum 1-2 years of the relevant working experience
Experience in building & delivering web apps (Flutter knowledge will be advantageous)
Experience in HTML, JavaScript, SCSS/Bootstrap, Vue JS, Node Framework
Experience in Golang, PHP, Laravel, C/C++, Python, Bash
Experience in development & deployment in cloud environment (Google, AWS, Azure)
Experience with microservices technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes
Experience in source control (GIT) and (CI/CD), i.e. Jenkins, Gitlab, GitHub
Strong understanding of integrating data from & to other systems using common API (MQTT, CoAP, REST, OPC UA, SOAP)
Must be self-motivated, able to work independently or as part of team, able to learn quickly, meet deadlines and demonstrate problem-solving skill.
Experience in writing unit tests & automated testing
Comfortable with HTML5 and CSS3 design patterns
Strong in Database both in SQL and NOSQL skills (DDL & DML)
Ability to write code for data processing algorithm
Knowledge in Unix/Linux command line, System administration and configuration for optimizing web-app deployment

Title: Software Engineer / Software Developer
Requirements: Client Consultation: Analyze and consult with clients and team members on project requirements, contributing to successful implementations. |
Description:
Our client is seeking a Software Engineer / Software Developer to join their team!
Are you passionate about shaping the future of logistics through innovative technology? Join our client's team and be part of a dynamic environment where you'll develop cutting-edge ERP logistics and accounting software solutions. This role offers exciting opportunities to work on web and mobile applications, implement AI solutions, and create revolutionary UI/UX designs.
What you'll be doing?
Application Development: Develop and support clients on industry-leading ERP logistics and accounting software, including web apps, mobile apps, and AI solutions.
UI/UX Innovation: Create and curate revolutionary user interfaces and experiences, taking DSM ELMS apps to the next level.
Client Consultation: Analyze and consult with clients and team members on project requirements, contributing to successful implementations.
Software Development Cycle: Actively participate in and contribute to the company's software development processes.
Who are they looking for?
Educational Background: Candidates with a Bachelor's or Diploma in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Technology. Those with backgrounds in Logistics & Supply Chain or Accounting who are passionate about technology are also encouraged to apply.
Technical Proficiency: Experience with one or more of the following: Visual Studio, SQL DB, JavaScript, C#, MVC, HTML, CSS, JSON, REST APIs, Vue.JS.
Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical abilities and a passion for overcoming challenges in innovative ways.
Communication Skills: Excellent spoken and written English to effectively collaborate with team members and handle client inquiries.
Team Player: Ability to work independently while also collaborating effectively within a team environment.
Innovative Mindset: Inquisitive nature with a strong interest in exploring new frontiers and embracing new technologies.
Open to All: Candidates with no prior experience are welcomed to apply.
How to apply
Ready to join this role? Click Apply now to submit your resume and share your availability and expected salary with us!
We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds who are passionate about technology and innovation.
All information received will be kept strictly confidential and will be used only for employment-related purposes.

Title: Education Specialist (Full-time/Part-time roles available)
Description:
EdTech Specialist (Trainee)
Company Name : Ez EdTech Solutions Sdn Bhd
Work Location : Mont Kiara, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Position Title : Education Specialist (Trainee)
Primary Job Role : Curriculum development and research, Instructor
Internship/Permanent Job : Full Time / Part Time / Internship
No. of Vacancies : 3

Role Overview:
We are seeking passionate, adaptable Instructors (Full-time or Part-time) to deliver courses in Computer Science, Game Development, UI/UX Design, Math, Physics, and English. Tutors will deliver instruction across varied formats (1-on-1, small groups, in-person, and online) while contributing to curriculum innovation. Ideal candidates are lifelong learners eager to explore subjects beyond their core expertise and collaborate on course development. Non-technical candidates with a strong interest in technology are also encouraged to apply.

Trainees will learn how to run courses in cutting-edge technology and inspire the next generation of tech innovators using our innovative learning platform. You will experience how to guide students ages 8-18 in a fun, dynamic learning environment. You will lead courses in subjects like game development, web design and AI/ML. Our team will provide the curriculum and training –you will bring your passion for tech and education.
With us trainees will be able to meet people involved in the tech community including our partners from Microsoft, Roblox, Internet Brands, OpenEDG, VEX etc. Other than core course instructor and curriculum development work, you will also have the option for rotation and work in:
(i) further events management, marketing and business development work or
(ii) pursue further IT solutions and development work with our software development team.
Core Responsibilities:
i) Teaching & Instruction
Deliver engaging lessons in one or more of our core subjects:
Computer Science | Game Development | Mathematics (at least one from this list)
UI/UX Design | Physics | English (optional)
Deliver programs using our education platform in the following formats: in-person (1-on-1/small groups), online (live virtual classes), and hybrid.
Adapt teaching methods to diverse learning styles and student needs.
ii) Course Development & Innovation
Collaborate with the curriculum team to design/update programs on our learning platform.
Research emerging trends in education/industry to propose new course ideas.
Create and refine learning materials (project guides, assessments, tutorials).
iii) Growth & Collaboration
Learn adjacent subjects (e.g. a CS tutor exploring UI/UX fundamentals) to support cross-disciplinary learning and courses.
Participate in feedback sessions to refine teaching strategies and content.
What We Offer
Opportunity to take a leading role in a long-term, impactful project that will transform an industry.
Collaborative and innovative work environment within a small team, allowing for significant individual contribution.
Competitive salary and benefits package including EPF, SOCSO, EIS
Professional development opportunities and potential for involvement in future projects.
Flexible work hours and the possibility of remote work.

Title: [INTERN] Software Developer
Requirements: Qualifications & Experience: | You possess own transport and willing to travel as and when required based on business requirements. |
Description:
About The Company
Kumo™ (kumoteam.co) is a provider of Clinic Management Software as a Service (SaaS) for the medical, healthcare, and wellness industries. With a strong track record in the Medical Aesthetics, Beauty, and Wellness sectors through the Aoikumo™ (aoikumo.com) brand, as well as in Dental, Veterinary, and Primary Care through our products kumoDent™ (kumodent.com), kumoVet™ (kumovet.com) and kumoDoc™ (kumodoc.com) respectively, Kumo™ has established itself as a leader in the field. By leveraging its successful platforms, Kumo™ aims to offer cutting-edge software solutions to the medical field, ranging from appointment scheduling to billing and after-care. Our products are built to last, with regular updates ensuring they meet both current and future business needs, resulting in significant transformative advantages.
We need people like you to join the team to apply what you love to do so that we can all grow together. A place where it's all about fun, doing what you do best!
 Job Summary
As a Software Developer Intern, you will work closely with the Tech team. You will have the opportunities to work on administrative duties, developing, expanding our brand reach along with using various software development tools.
 Key Responsibilities:
Establishes a positive, productive and professional relationship with team lead in getting deliverables to meet its target with regards to planning, design, development, deployment and support.
Participate in the full software development life cycle including design, code, testing and code review.
Self-initiative learning and understanding of new technologies, methodologies, framework by means of continuous research and development.
Modify existing software modules for enhancement as and when required.
To suggest and apply cloud-based methodologies during development.
Analyze test results, preparation of required software documentations, UAT, SIT required to complete given projects.
Undertake any other related duties.
Assist in ad-hoc duties as and when required.
 Qualifications & Experience:
You are pursuing Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/ Software Development/ Information Technology or equivalent
Possess a strong desire to learn and improve your skills
You possess good command in English and Bahasa Malaysia (both written and spoken). Other languages will be an advantage
Knowledge with software development tools and experienced will be an advantage.
Keen to test your ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment
You possess own transport and willing to travel as and when required based on business requirements.
Why Join Us?
We practice a vibrant & energetic office culture with fun working environment.
We provide opportunities for career advancement within the company.
We host yearly festive dinners/ lunch, team building activities and various fun employee engagement activities (monthly birthday celebrations, Christmas lucky draw, sports, eating sessions etc).
Our office is next to Citta mall and other eateries with reasonably priced food.
Others benefits include wellness, optical, dental allowances, ample basement parking, snacks and fruits in pantry, coffee and tea provided.

Title: Lecturer/ Senior Lecturer in Computer Science (80039)
Description:
JOB SUMMARY:
Sunway University is seeking a Lecturer/ Senior Lecturer in Computer Science within the School of American Education. The incumbent will play a key role in delivering undergraduate and postgraduate courses, as well as conducting impactful research.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Deliver lectures, tutorials, labs, and workshops in Computer Science related subjects.
Develop, update, and review course materials to ensure alignment with industry trends and MQA academic standards.
Conduct research in Computer Science related fields and contribute to scholarly publications, presentations, and conferences.
Stay updated with industry developments, emerging technologies, and best practices to enhance teaching methods and course content.
Evaluate and assess student performance through assignments, projects, and examinations.

Assist in the development of departmental policies, procedures, and academic goals.
REQUIREMENTS/ PERSON SPECIFICATIONS:

Strong knowledge of subject matter and current industry trends.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong organisational and time management skills.
Proven track record of publications be an added advantage.
American University graduates are preferred.
We appreciate the interest of all applicants for this position. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data Scientist (User Growth) - Data Cycling Centre
Requirements: Qualifications | Minimum Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or a related field: advanced degrees preferred. 2. 3-5 years of experience in data science, user growth strategy with a demonstrated track record of success. |
Description:
Responsibilities
About Data Cycling Center (DCC) AI is the new electricity and data is the energy for AI. Our core belief is that unstructured data contains the untapped wisdom of humanity — and by building the best AI-ready data infrastructure, we enable more meaningful, responsible, and creative uses of AI. Data Cycling Center (DCC) is a Data Science team that is responsible for building the mid-platform data layer that powers AI development across all business lines of TikTok, including e-commerce, advertising, livestreaming, and emerging technologies.
Our initiatives include:
Scaled human-in-the-loop (HITL) data processing (including capability, methodology, E2E process, platform), delivering the most cost-effective results at benchmark quality levels that outperform leading tech peers.
Built a highly automated end-to-end data pipeline for AI-generated content (AIGC) that supports strong model performance with minimal resource input.
Develop a comprehensive content understanding and insight generation system, setting new benchmarks for marketing intelligence in the online ads ecosystem.
DCC aims to be the number 1 data service provider in the AI era. Our mission is to build the most effective (lossless and affordable) content understanding capabilities to fully satisfy AI needs of TikTok and to help the industry push the limit. About the role
As the User Growth Data Scientist, you will be instrumental in spearheading our human capital expansion, acquiring high quality users. You'll own the complete acquisition strategy lifecycle-from identifying untapped user segments and researching market benchmarks to designing experiments that validate new acquisition approaches. Working at the intersection of data science and strategic growth, you'll analyze acquisition funnel performance, test innovative recruitment strategies, and translate complex data into clear recommendations that drive scalable user acquisition.
Your insights will directly shape how we attract and onboard our most valuable users. This role requires someone who can think strategically about acquisition challenges while diving deep into the data to find solutions. You'll collaborate closely with product, marketing, and engineering teams to turn your findings into scalable acquisition initiatives that consistently bring in quality participants to meet project demands.
Responsibilities 1. Opportunity Identification: Analyze user data and growth metrics to identify areas for improvement and expansion opportunities. 2. Market Research: Research industry benchmarks, competitor strategies, and best practices to inform growth initiatives.
3. Experimentation: Design, implement, and manage A/B tests to validate growth hypotheses and strategies. 4. Data Analysis: Independently analyze experiment results and user behavior data to extract actionable insights. 5. Strategic Recommendations: Provide data-driven recommendations for growth strategy optimization and iteration.
6. Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with product, marketing, and engineering teams to ensure seamless execution of growth initiatives. 7. Trend Monitoring: Stay current with market trends and industry developments to adapt strategies and maintain competitive advantage. Why join us?
Shape the Future of AI
Work at the core of TikTok’s AI development, where your data powers cutting-edge applications across e-commerce, ads, livestream, and more.
Massive Scale, Real-World Impact
Process petabytes of unstructured data to influence real products used by over a billion users worldwide.
Global Team, Local Leadership
Join a diverse, high-performing team spread across Singapore, New York, San Jose, Shanghai, and more
Build
What Others Benchmark Against Our innovations in HITL systems, AIGC pipelines, and content understanding set the industry standard
not just keep up with it.
From Data to Strategy
We don’t just process data — we turn it into actionable insight that shapes product and business strategy across all TikTok verticals.
Dynamic, Fast-Paced, Fun
Experience the energy of a high-impact team that moves fast, breaks new ground, and never stops learning.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or a related field: advanced degrees preferred. 2. 3-5 years of experience in data science, user growth strategy with a demonstrated track record of success.
3. Highly proficient in Python, SQL 4. Strong analytical skills and experience with A/B testing, user segmentation, and predictive modeling. 5. Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, with a knack for problem-solving and innovative thinking.

Title: Data Scientist - BCG X
Description:
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive. 
We Are BCG X
We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.
Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions. 
As a Data Scientist, you'll be part of our rapidly growing team. You'll have the chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. 
Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative. 
We are looking for talented individuals with a passion for data science, statistics, operations research and transforming organizations into AI led innovative companies. Successful candidates possess the following: 
Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams 
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations 
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner 
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience) 
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data 
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients 
Have strong project management skills 
Master’s Degree or PhD with significant relevant experience providing advanced analytics solutions. The degree should be in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or a related data centric field.
Demonstrated deep technical and data science expertise, acute strategic and analytical skills, ability to lead and persuade, drive and energy, and desire to work in a project-based environment on strategic issues.
Strong record of professional accomplishment and leadership.
Fluency in Python
Ability to travel based on client and business needs.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Get to Know our team
Grab Support is a technology-driven team focused on helping users when they need assistance. The Data Science team within Grab Support is dedicated to developing machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) technologies that make our products smarter. Currently, the team is building advanced conversational AI solutions to bring user experience to the next level.
Get to Know the role
As a Senior Data Scientist specialising in Conversational AI, you will report directly to the Head of Data Science, Integrity & Core Experience, and work onsite at Grab One North Singapore office. You will lead the development of modern chatbot technologies designed to handle diverse customer inquiries across Grab's super-app ecosystem. Your work will empower users with thoughtful and seamless support interactions. You are also committed to learning and experimenting with new methodologies to advance conversational AI capabilities.
The Critical Tasks You will Perform
You will analyse large volumes of unstructured data to understand the business, the product, and user pain points.
You will design, develop, and train advanced machine learning models tailored for conversational AI.
You will develop and refine solutions for tasks such as intent recognition, sentiment analysis, information extraction, and dialogue management.
You will perform rigorous model evaluation and A/B testing, deploying models in split environments to measure their real-world performance.
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate the models and enhance the product experience.
You will stay updated on the latest advancements in the field and experiment with innovative approaches to test their effectiveness.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description
About Grab and Our Workplace
Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.
Job Description
Get to Know our team
Grab Support is a technology-driven team focused on helping users when they need assistance. The Data Science team within Grab Support is dedicated to developing machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) technologies that make our products smarter. Currently, the team is building advanced conversational AI solutions to bring user experience to the next level.
Get to Know the role
As a Senior Data Scientist specialising in Conversational AI, you will report directly to the Head of Data Science, Integrity & Core Experience, and work onsite at Grab One North Singapore office. You will lead the development of modern chatbot technologies designed to handle diverse customer inquiries across Grab's super-app ecosystem. Your work will empower users with thoughtful and seamless support interactions. You are also committed to learning and experimenting with new methodologies to advance conversational AI capabilities.
The Critical Tasks You will Perform
You will analyse large volumes of unstructured data to understand the business, the product, and user pain points.
You will design, develop, and train advanced machine learning models tailored for conversational AI.
You will develop and refine solutions for tasks such as intent recognition, sentiment analysis, information extraction, and dialogue management.
You will perform rigorous model evaluation and A/B testing, deploying models in split environments to measure their real-world performance.
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate the models and enhance the product experience.
You will stay updated on the latest advancements in the field and experiment with innovative approaches to test their effectiveness.
Qualifications
What Essential Skills You will Need
You have a Degree in Computer Science or related fields, with at least 3 years of relevant experience
You are proficient in analysing large datasets to obtain actionable insights.
You have expertise in designing and training machine learning models, with fundamentals in NLP algorithms and mathematics, including familiarities with deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch) and algorithms (CNN/RNN, BERT, seq2seq models).
You are experienced in using LLMs in NLP tasks and other applications. Familiar with application patterns such as RAG.
You have experience developing solutions for tasks like intent recognition, sentiment analysis, information extraction, and dialogue management.
You have experience in model evaluation and A/B testing techniques to assess model performance in real-world scenarios.
You are proficient in statistical programming languages such as Python, with familiarity in RDBMS like PostgreSQL or MySQL.
Additional Information
Life at Grab
We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:
We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours
What We Stand For at Grab
We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

Title: Data Scientist (Public Sector)
Requirements: Gather and refine business requirements from users and translate them into technical solutions. | Requirements |
Description:
Job Description
Collaborate within an agile team to design, build, test, and deploy analytics products under the guidance of the Product Manager.
Gather and refine business requirements from users and translate them into technical solutions.
Perform data audits and assess technical feasibility of proposed solutions.
Develop solutions with appropriate security, performance, and UX considerations using tools on the Enterprise Data Analytics Platform.
Coordinate with technical teams (e.g., data platform, integration, and database teams) through all stages of development and deployment.
Run vulnerability scans and code quality checks; fix any issues found.
Conduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and incorporate user feedback into the product backlog.
Document designs and processes according to QMS standards.
Requirements
Relevant educational credentials in a quantitative discipline (e.g. statistics, computer science, data science/analytics/engineer, or information systems)
