Title: Data Scientist
Requirements: Conduct data analysis to support Product Owner and Business Leaders in business decisions and requirements | Qualifications | Minimum Bachelor in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science, Information Technology or other equivalent qualifications |
Description:
Game changer, armed with data.
You know all about our users, through data analysis. And because you do, you can identify issues and present insights to our Product Owners, spurring them into action. Working with your team, you play a key role in enhancing our business value. After all, you're the one who ignited the spark. And no spark, no fire.
What a Data Scientist does in Titansoft
Conduct data analysis to support Product Owner and Business Leaders in business decisions and requirements
Develop and automate reports for analytical purposes
Collaborate with other Product Development teams to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations
Support key decision makers to improve products and services
What we are looking for in a Data Scientist
Qualifications
Minimum Bachelor in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science, Information Technology or other equivalent qualifications
Experience
Experience working with statistical software (e.g. R, Python, Excel, etc.) Basic statistical principles and practical applications
Experience in measuring cost and production
Experience in scripting with SQL
Skills
A/B and Multivariate testing management
Data visualization (such as Tableau, Excel, etc)
Ability to translate analysis results into business recommendations and insights
Ability to present the insights clearly to technical and non-technical audiences
Strong written, verbal communication and presentations skills
What makes a (Super!) Data Scientist in Titansoft AKA the "great to haves"
Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends, and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics and program evaluation
What everyone gets in Titansoft (psst. We didn't get that Great Place to Work in 2024 for nothing!)
18 days of rest and relaxation for each year (P.S. It gets even better over the years!)
Competitive salaries and bonuses bench-marked against big players in the industry (Yeap, those companies!)
Flexible working hours (Sleep in a little longer after fixing that pesky bug from last night)
Comprehensive insurance coverage Wellness fund (Fexibilty to use it for medical, dental, EAP or even attraction parks!)
Very well-stocked pantry (We've never heard of the term 'Hunger Games', nope)
Communities of Practice and Workshops catered for your growth and learning
Substantial subsidies and programs to keep that creative flow while having fun (Health promotion program, annual overseas company outing, an annual dinner that nobody will ever forget, etc.)
Hardcore work and hardcore fun!
Working at Titansoft will probably be unlike any other careers you have ever had. Discover why you should join us!

Title: Data Scientist (CV/Gen AI)
Company: Manpower Staffing Services (S) Pte Ltd - Head Office
Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Conduct research on computer vision, deep learning and AI problems
Build prototype applications in various AI domains such as computer vision, self-supervised learning, multi-modality learning, etc.
Work closely with a team of scientists and researchers to concept and iterate on software development
Develop and deploy data science prototypes, with a focus on bringing machine learning models into production
Design and implement scalable and high-performance machine learning models, with a focus on troubleshooting performance and accuracy issues
Collaborate with technical and non-technical teams locally and overseas, and present proof of concepts to stakeholders effectively
Build data cleaning and augmentation pipelines for both machine learning and deep learning model-based projects
Automate processes and workflows for efficient delivery of data science products via scripting and open source tools
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and deployment techniques
Requirements:
Degree or above in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or Engineering
At least 2 years of relevant experience from work with hands-on project experience in Computer Vision and Generative AI
Expertise in Python programming and using libraries for data processing, visualization, and model development, including pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, and seaborn
Proficient in API concepts and libraries, and experienced in utilizing them for testing and deployment, leveraging frameworks such as Flask, Django, or FastAPI
Familiar with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, Minio) and SQL for data storage and retrieval
Understand HTML/CSS/Javascript and have experience in front-end JavaScript frameworks such as Angular or React to design web interfaces for data science prototypes
Customer oriented and able to establish link between R&D, innovations, and applications in business
Comfortable to work with local and overseas cross-functional teams

Title: Data Science Analyst - ML and Deep Learning (Data Analytics & AI)
Description:
Company description:

Synapxe is the national HealthTech agency inspiring tomorrow's health. The nexus of HealthTech, we connect people and systems to power a healthier Singapore.

Together with partners, we create intelligent technological solutions to improve the health of millions of people every day, everywhere. Reimagine the future of health together with us at www.synapxe.sg


Job description:

Position Overview
This is a Data Science Analyst role supporting Healthcare Analytics workstreams
We are expanding our strong data science team and are looking for talented AI practitioner with applied experience in the fields of Machine Learning and Deep learning to join us. This role is best suited for candidate that is interested in developing new AI application that has a direct and immense, real-world healthcare impact.
You need to have a deep passion for analyzing and resolving healthcare problems. You display an intellectual curiosity about the business needs as well as the capability to engage with stakeholders to understand business issues.
Role & Responsibilities
Analyze data, Scope out problem definition and hypothesis for analysis for image/signal data (such as EEG, ECG) related use case
Responsible for image analysis, synthesis and other aspects of algorithm development, including visual recognition, object detection, segmentation and signal data pattern recognition etc
Responsible for the exploration of cutting-edge technology in image/signal data related algorithms and ensure the technologies get successfully applied
Design experiments to test data assumptions
Evaluate experiment outcomes to draw actionable conclusions
Deploy data models across different channels and customer platforms
Partner with stakeholders to translate business problems into data science projects
Develop strategies to identify, acquire and use appropriate data sets to develop practical solutions and support decision making
Maintain an advanced knowledge of trends affecting the industry
Synthesize findings into actionable insights
Apply data analysis, data mining and data processing to present data clearly
Provide rationale, business cases and ROI models to support investment
Requirements
PhD or Masters in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology, Physics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent
Preferably minimum 3 years of relevant working experience
Solid research and engineering background and experience in computer vision, deep learning, and image/signal data processing/analysis algorithms
Good experience with Python or R is prerequisite
Good experience with Deep learning framework e.g. Tensorflow, keras, Pytorch is prerequisite
Hands on experience in the development of image classification, object detection, segmentation, signal data pattern recognition or related is preferred
Good experience with SQL and/or NoSQL is preferred
Proven communication skill to explain insights from technical work to non-technical audience through presentation or other means
Ability to work independently
Model deployment experience is preferred
Apply Now
NOTE: It only takes a few minutes to apply for a meaningful career in HealthTech - GO FOR IT!!

Title: Data Scientist, Neurosurgery Division (Contract)
Requirements: Collaborate with neurosurgeons, clinicians, and IT stakeholders to translate domain requirements into technical implementations. |
Description:
We are seeking a motivated and technically capable Data Scientist to join our Neurosurgery Division. This role is ideal for early-career individuals—including fresh graduates—who are eager to grow in applied AI, data science, and MLOps in a healthcare setting.
You will play a critical role in maintaining and enhancing an AI-based risk stratification tool for detecting neurological deterioration. The model is currently deployed via a Streamlit-based web app and integrated into a production-grade AWS/Kubernetes environment. The role involves hands-on support for ongoing validation studies and exploratory AI/ML initiatives within neurosurgery.
 We welcome entry level graduates with a solid technical foundation and strong interest in clinical AI and MLOps.
 Key Responsibilities
Support the production deployment and maintenance of an AI model in AWS and Kubernetes.
Assist with the validation study of the model, ensuring scientific rigor and clinical relevance.
Conduct exploratory data analysis and modelling to extend the current solution and support new AI/ML research directions.
Learn and apply MLOps practices (e.g., monitoring, deployment, CI/CD pipelines).
Collaborate with neurosurgeons, clinicians, and IT stakeholders to translate domain requirements into technical implementations.
Participate in containerization efforts using Docker and orchestration via Kubernetes.
 What We’re Looking For
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Entry graduates are welcome to apply.
Strong willingness to learn and apply cloud technologies (e.g., AWS), MLOps tools, and production systems.
Proficiency in Python for data science (e.g., Pandas, Scikit-learn) is a must.
Exposure or interest in learning:
Docker and Kubernetes for deployment and orchestration.
AWS services (ECS, SageMaker) for cloud-based application hosting and data science experimentation.
Streamlit or other Python-based web frameworks.
Working with RESTful APIs and structured/unstructured clinical data.
Self-starter mindset with the ability to work independently and as part of a multi-disciplinary team.
Passion for applying AI to real-world clinical problems and improving patient outcomes.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:

Proactively bringing together statistical, mathematical, machine-learning and software engineering skills to consider multiple solutions, techniques, and algorithms
Implementing ethically sound models end-to-end and applying software engineering and a product development lens to complex business problems
Working with and leading both direct reports and wider teams in an Agile way within multi-disciplinary data to achieve agreed project and Scrum outcomes
Using your data translation skills to work closely with business stakeholders to define business questions, problems or opportunities that can be supported through advanced analytics
Selecting, building, training, and testing complex machine models, considering model valuation, model risk, governance, and ethics throughout to implement and scale models

Extensive experience in data science, analytics, and machine learning

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us
99 Group is a leading real estate technology company that operates real estate portals across South East Asia, specializing in digital property advertising. Headquartered in Singapore, it is currently operational in Singapore and Indonesia and employs over 500 employees. In Singapore, 99 Group operates 99.co and SRX.com.sg, while in Indonesia, it operates 99.co/id and Rumah123.
Join Us and Lead the Real Estate Revolution!
We are looking for a junior-level data scientist who is equally comfortable writing SQL queries and ML models as they are stepping into a room with stakeholders to solve business problems. This person will be learning the ropes to be a go-to data consultant for internal teams — from product managers to the CEO — helping them make data-driven decisions, build experiments, and uncover strategic opportunities.
What You'll Be Doing:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to deeply understand problems and design data-backed solutions.
Perform ad hoc analysis, report, A/B test evaluation, and causal inference when needed.
Develop, test, and deploy machine learning models in production (e.g., demand forecasting, pricing models, recommendations etc.).
Generate data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights clearly.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define business problems and translate them into data solutions.
Act as a data partner to stakeholders — translating complex questions into analytical plans, and results into actionable recommendations.
Stay updated on latest tools, techniques, applications and best practices in data science and machine learning.
What We're Looking For:
Strong SQL skill and using Python for software engineering, data wrangling and ML-modelling.
Familiar with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow or other similar ML/DL libraries.
Strong understanding of statistical modeling, hypothesis testing.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills — able to translate data insights into business impact.
Are you ready to shape the future of real estate? Join us in this exciting journey of innovation, collaboration, and growth. Together, let's redefine what's possible in the world of real estate.
Make your mark at 99 Group. Apply now!

Title: Data Analytics Executive (6 Months Contract)
Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Trend Identification:
Analyze large datasets to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations across the BreadTalk Group.
Provide data-driven insights to help the leadership team make informed decisions and define strategic directions for the business.
BTGR Data Management:
Take ownership of managing and analyzing BTGR data, focusing on member profiles, demographic analysis, divisional sales, transaction counts, SKU performance, and store performance.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across all data touchpoints.
Strategic Recommendations:
Work closely with the brand and management teams to deliver strategic recommendations based on data analysis.
Assist in determining the right strategic moves for various brands within the BreadTalk Group, based on insights gained from data.
Data Extraction & Reporting:
Extract, consolidate, and analyze data from multiple sources and systems, ensuring data integrity.
Generate comprehensive reports for stakeholders, addressing data discrepancies and ensuring accurate, timely reporting.
Cross-Departmental Collaboration:
Collaborate with various departments (Marketing, Finance, Operations, etc.) to ensure alignment of data insights with business needs.
Assist teams in improving business processes through data-driven decision-making.
Customer Service Analytics:
Analyze customer service data to identify areas for improvement, enhancing service quality and customer satisfaction.
 Job Requirements:
Education: Diploma/Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Experience: 1-2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role, preferably in retail, F&B, or a similar industry.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, Python, R, or similar).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong knowledge of data management and reporting processes.
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
High attention to detail and accuracy in reporting.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Other: Knowledge of customer analytics and sales performance metrics is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist - OCBC
Description:
WHO WE ARE:
As Singapore's longest established bank, we have been dedicated to enabling individuals and businesses to achieve their aspirations since 1932. How? By taking the time to truly understand people. From there, we provide support, services, solutions, and career paths that meet their individual needs and desires.
Today, we're on a journey of transformation. Leveraging technology and creativity to become a future-ready learning organisation. But for all that change, our strategic ambition is consistently clear and bold, which is to be Asia's leading financial services partner for a sustainable future.
We invite you to build the bank of the future. Innovate the way we deliver financial services. Work in friendly, supportive teams. Build lasting value in your community. Help people grow their assets, business, and investments. Take your learning as far as you can. Or simply enjoy a vibrant, future-ready career.
Your Opportunity Starts Here.
This is the broad job description of the job profile. Definitive job description should be reviewed and discussed between you and your manager.
Data Scientist, AI Lab (Manager)
Why Join
Imagine being part of a team that uses data to drive business decisions and create a competitive edge for OCBC. As a Data Scientist, you'll have the opportunity to work with large datasets, develop predictive models, and provide insights that inform strategic decision-making. You'll be part of a team that's passionate about using data to make a difference.
How you succeed
To succeed in this role, you'll need to be able to extract insights from complex data sets, communicate your findings effectively to stakeholders, and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. You'll need to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science and machine learning, and be able to apply these skills to drive business outcomes.
What you do
- Develop and deploy predictive models to drive business decisions
- Analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns
- Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions
- Design and implement data visualizations to communicate insights
- Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science and machine learning
Who you are
- A degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field
- 3+ years of experience in data science or a related field
- Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or SQL
- Experience with machine learning algorithms and data modeling techniques
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills
- A passion for using data to drive business decisions
Who we are
As Singapore's longest established bank, we have been dedicated to enabling individuals and businesses to achieve their aspirations since 1932. How? By taking the time to truly understand people. From there, we provide support, services, solutions, and career paths that meet their individual needs and desires.
Today, we're on a journey of transformation. Leveraging technology and creativity to become a future-ready learning organisation.
But for all that change, our strategic ambition is consistently clear and bold, which is to be Asia's leading financial services partner for a sustainable future.
We invite you to build the bank of the future. Innovate the way we deliver financial services. Work in friendly, supportive teams. Build lasting value in your community. Help people grow their assets, business, and investments. Take your learning as far as you can. Or simply enjoy a vibrant, future-ready career. Your Opportunity Starts Here.
What we offer
Competitive base salary. A suite of holistic, flexible benefits to suit every lifestyle. Community initiatives. Industry-leading learning and professional development opportunities. Equal opportunity. Fair employment. Selection based on ability and fit with our culture and values. Your wellbeing, growth and aspirations are every bit as cared for as the needs of our customers.
What we offer:
Competitive base salary. A suite of holistic, flexible benefits to suit every lifestyle. Community initiatives. Industry-leading learning and professional development opportunities. Your wellbeing, growth and aspirations are every bit as cared for as the needs of our customers.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The Customer Lifecycle Management (CLM) team at StarHub is dedicated to understanding, enhancing, and optimizing the customer journey. From acquisition to retention, the CLM team employs data-driven strategies to provide unparalleled customer experiences. Through a combination of data science, business intelligence, customer insights, NPS, and digital analytics, the CLM team ensures that StarHub's offerings are aligned with customer needs, leading to increased loyalty, satisfaction, and growth.
The Data Scientist plays a crucial role in supporting the CLM team's data-driven initiatives. This position focuses on applying data science techniques to extract valuable insights from customer data, contributing to the team's efforts in enhancing customer experiences and supporting StarHub's business objectives. The Data Scientist will work closely with senior team members to develop and implement machine learning models, conduct statistical analyses, and translate complex data into actionable recommendations. This role is essential in helping the CLM team leverage advanced analytics to optimize customer lifecycle strategies and drive data-informed decision-making across the organization.
Develop and implement machine learning models to predict customer behavior, churn, and lifecycle events. Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify patterns and trends in customer data.
Perform statistical tests and analyses to validate hypotheses and support data-driven decision-making. Interpret results and communicate findings to team members and stakeholders.
Create clear and impactful visualizations to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. Contribute to the development and maintenance of dashboards.
Assist in building and maintaining machine learning pipelines for data preprocessing, model training, and deployment. Collaborate with the data engineering team to ensure efficient data flow.
Apply clustering techniques and other segmentation methods to identify distinct customer groups and their characteristics. Support the development of targeted marketing strategies based on segmentation insights.
Develop predictive models to forecast customer behavior, including purchase propensity, churn risk, and lifetime value. Continuously refine and improve model accuracy.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and product development, to align data science projects with business objectives. Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas for new analytics initiatives.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in data science techniques, tools, and best practices. Attend relevant workshops, webinars, and conferences to enhance skills and knowledge.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Master's degree in a relevant field is preferred.
2-3 years of experience in data science, machine learning, or a related field.
Strong foundation in statistical analysis and machine learning algorithms.
Proficiency in Python or R for data analysis and modeling.
Experience with SQL for data manipulation and querying.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Matplotlib.
Understanding of customer lifecycle management concepts and metrics.
Proficiency in Python or R for data analysis and machine learning.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Knowledge of SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with big data technologies like Hadoop or Spark.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Understanding of data visualization principles and tools.
Behavioural Skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst
As a Data Analyst at D-SIMLAB Technologies, you will play a key role in deriving insights from large datasets to optimize semiconductor manufacturing processes. This role focuses on data extraction, analysis, and actionable insights, while collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy D-SIMLAB’s software products as well as provide professional consultation services to our clients. The ideal candidate is someone who excels in data-driven analysis and is eager to work on high-impact projects in the semiconductor industry.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Extraction and Analysis:
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from semiconductor manufacturing environments to ensure data consistency, completeness, and correctness.
Use statistical methods and data mining techniques to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that impact production performance.
Performance Evaluation:
Analyze the gap between planned and actual production outcomes. Identify root causes for performance deviations and recommend data-driven strategies for process improvement. Develop reports and visualizations to present findings to clients and internal stakeholders.
Data-Driven Insights:
Provide actionable insights based on data analysis to optimize semiconductor manufacturing processes. Work closely with clients to understand their specific needs and translate data findings into operational and strategic improvements.
ETL and Data Modeling:
Build and maintain ETL processes to integrate data from various sources into D-SIMLAB’s data models. Collaborate with simulation modeling teams to ensure accurate and reliable data is fed into models.
Consultation Services:
Act as a trusted advisor to clients by offering data-driven recommendations for enhancing their production efficiency. Present analyses and proposals to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clarity and actionable takeaways.
Data Visualization and Reporting:
Create dashboards and reports using advanced data visualization tools to communicate key insights and trends effectively. Continuously improve reporting mechanisms to provide real-time insights and support ongoing optimization efforts.
Collaboration with Teams:
Work with Software Engineers, Data Scientists, and other cross-functional teams to ensure that data insights align with product goals and customer needs. Contribute to product enhancement initiatives, focusing on the improvement of data-related components and analytics.
Candidate Requirements:
Education:
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
Experience:
Strong analytical skills with a minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in an industrial environment. Semiconductor experience is a plus.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is highly desirable.
Experience with ETL processes and database management.
Analytical Abilities:
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle large datasets and deliver actionable insights to improve operational performance.
Soft Skills:
Ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural, multidisciplinary team.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Willingness to Travel:
Willing to travel for international projects and collaborate closely with clients and internal teams.

Title: Data Scientist
Requirements: Develop and deploy predictive models to forecast key business metrics, such as customer lifetime value, demand forecasting, and resource requirements. Continuously refine and improve models based on performance evaluation and feedback. | Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including software developers, business analysts, and stakeholders, to understand business requirements, define success criteria, and integrate analytical solutions into business processes. | Requirements |
Description:
PRISM+ is the largest Singaporean direct-to-consmer smart home appliances brand. Our mission is to offer cutting-edge products to the masses at affordable prices. We are a rapidly growing, ever-evolving organisation, and we are seeking new teammates to join us on our exciting journey.
Responsibilities:
Analyze large, complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that provide valuable insights into business performance and customer behavior. Utilize statistical methods and machine learning techniques to extract meaningful information from data.
Develop and deploy predictive models to forecast key business metrics, such as customer lifetime value, demand forecasting, and resource requirements. Continuously refine and improve models based on performance evaluation and feedback.
Identify relevant features and variables that influence the outcome of predictive models. Conduct feature engineering to extract and transform raw data into actionable insights. Apply techniques for feature selection and dimensionality reduction to enhance model performance.
Evaluate the performance of predictive models using appropriate metrics and validation techniques. Conduct rigorous testing and validation to ensure the accuracy, reliability, and generalizability of models across different datasets and scenarios.
Communicate findings and insights effectively through data visualization techniques, such as charts, graphs, and dashboards. Translate complex analysis results into clear and actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including software developers, business analysts, and stakeholders, to understand business requirements, define success criteria, and integrate analytical solutions into business processes.
Stay abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and methodologies in data science, machine learning, and related fields. Experiment with new techniques and tools to enhance analytical capabilities and drive innovation within the organization.
Requirements
Proven experience as a Data Scientist, with a strong track record of developing and deploying predictive models in real-world applications.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, with experience in data manipulation and analysis libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn).
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, machine learning algorithms, and data mining techniques.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tableau) and proficiency in communicating complex analysis results to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking, with the ability to translate business questions into data-driven solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist (NUS - Office of Data and Intelligence)
Location: National University Of Singapore, Central Region
Requirements: To join the team at the Office of Data and Intelligence at the National University of Singapore (NUS) with the collection, analysis, visualization of data and presentation of analytical results for regular and ad-hoc reporting purposes to meet multiple information and strategic requirements for the various stakeholders of the university. | Requirements | Successful candidate should have the following qualifications and capabilities: | Bachelor degree in Data Analytics, Applied Statistics or Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, but higher qualifications (Master's or PhD) is preferred. |
Description:
Company description:

The National University of Singapore is the national research university of Singapore. Founded in 1905 as the Straits Settlements and Federated Malay States Government Medical School, NUS is the oldest higher education institution in Singapore


Job description:

Job Description
To join the team at the Office of Data and Intelligence at the National University of Singapore (NUS) with the collection, analysis, visualization of data and presentation of analytical results for regular and ad-hoc reporting purposes to meet multiple information and strategic requirements for the various stakeholders of the university.
The successful candidate will join a team of other data analysts and data scientists to engage in the following activities:
Create detailed reports on data sources, methodology, analytical techniques, analytical results and insights for stakeholders.
Develop visualisations and presentations for dissemination of analytical results and derivation of actionable insight.
Assist other units in the university with enhancing their data culture and capabilities.
Develop data repositories and system to enable key stakeholders to access regular reports.
Requirements
Successful candidate should have the following qualifications and capabilities:
Bachelor degree in Data Analytics, Applied Statistics or Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, but higher qualifications (Master's or PhD) is preferred.
Excellent knowledge of at least one of the following scripting/programming languages: Python, R, Java, C++, C#.Net, SQL.
Proficiency in using Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau or Qlik Sense)
Experience in applying machine learning techniques and designing algorithms that are scalable and production-grade.
Knowledge of database, ETL and data API concepts.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills and critical thinking with the ability to articulate ideas with data.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
Covid-19 Message
At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.
Taking into consideration the health and well-being of our staff and students and to better protect everyone in the campus, applicants are strongly encouraged to have themselves fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.
More Information
Location: Kent Ridge Campus
Organization: National University of Singapore
Department : Office of Data and Intelligence
Employee Referral Eligible:
Job requisition ID : 22419

Title: Data Scientist
Requirements: Design and architect computer vision systems to meet specific requirements and objectives. | Document design specifications, technical requirements, and implementation details for computer vision solutions. |
Description:
Joining Razer will place you on a global mission to revolutionize the way the world games. Razer is a place to do great work, offering you the opportunity to make an impact globally while working across a global team located across 5 continents. Razer is also a great place to work, providing you the unique, gamer-centric #LifeAtRazer experience that will put you in an accelerated growth, both personally and professionally.
Job Responsibilities :
Develop and implement computer vision algorithms for tasks such as object detection, recognition, tracking, segmentation, and image classification.
Design and architect computer vision systems to meet specific requirements and objectives.
Collect, curate, and annotate large datasets of images or videos for training and evaluation of computer vision models.
Train, fine-tune, and optimize computer vision models using machine learning frameworks and deep learning libraries.
Evaluate the performance of computer vision models using appropriate metrics and benchmarks.
Integrate computer vision algorithms and models into larger software systems or products.
Conduct testing and validation to ensure the functionality, reliability, and accuracy of computer vision systems.
Document design specifications, technical requirements, and implementation details for computer vision solutions.
Stay updated on emerging technologies, trends, and advancements in computer vision through research and experimentation.
Consider ethical, legal, and regulatory implications in the development and deployment of computer vision systems
Pre-Requisites :
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience in developing and implementing computer vision algorithms and models.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or C++.
Strong understanding of image and video processing techniques and methodologies.
Familiarity with computer vision libraries such as OpenCV.
Experience with data collection, annotation, and preparation for model training.
Ability to evaluate and optimize model performance using appropriate metrics and benchmarks.
Experience integrating computer vision solutions into software systems or products.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilitie

Title: Scientist - AI/ML/LLM Enhancement of Tools (BII)
Company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Scientist who will support the development and evolution of our genomic platform by integrating cutting edge technologies, including Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), Federated Learning (FL), Synthetic Data Generation, and Large Language Models (LLMs). This role works in close collaboration with the visualization, bioinformatics, and data science teams to optimize how users interact with and derive insights from global pathogen surveillance data.
The candidate will play a key part in identifying opportunities for technological integration, developing prototypes, and translating AI/ML research into practical enhancements across tools, trackers, and reports related to emerging and priority pathogens.
Job Responsibilities:
Develop and implement AI/ML based enhancements for platform tools and trackers, including features for anomaly detection, predictive analytics, and automated data classification.
Assist in the incorporation of LLMs to support natural language interfaces, automated summaries, and smart query functionalities for users.
Support the integration of federated learning and synthetic data techniques to improve privacy preserving analytics and model training.
Collaborate with domain experts to define use cases where AI technologies can augment genomic data visualization, exploration, and reporting.
Prototype and evaluate machine learning models using real world pathogen data, assessing performance, scalability, and interpretability.
Contribute to backend pipelines that power interactive dashboards, ensuring AI features are seamlessly integrated and optimized for real time usage.
Engage with end users to gather feedback on AI driven features and iterate on functionality based on usability insights.
Document model development, deployment workflows, and system behavior for reproducibility and future scaling.
Stay on top of emerging AI/ML technologies and trends in genomics, recommending innovations for future adoption.
Job Requirements:
PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related field with specialization in AI/ML.
Hands on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit learn) and NLP/LLM platforms (e.g., Hugging Face Transformers, OpenAI APIs).
Familiarity with modern AI architectures, including transformers, generative models, and federated learning frameworks.
Demonstrated experience applying AI/ML to biological or public health datasets is highly desirable.
Proficiency in Python and working knowledge of APIs, backend services, and data processing pipelines.
Understanding of bioinformatics data formats and pathogen genome data is a plus.
Ability to translate technical innovations into practical, user facing features with measurable impact.
Strong problem solving skills, independence, and a collaborative approach to interdisciplinary work.
Excellent communication skills for presenting results to technical and non technical audiences.

Title: Associate Analyst/Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Job Responsibilities



Contribute to the Revenue Optimization department in its goal to maximize gaming profit by performing the following:


Product Analytics
Analyze various aspects of the casino operations, including product and area performance, operational and manpower efficiency, dealer performance etc.
Apply advanced analytics, modelling and machine learning to improve gaming floor optimization, demand forecasting, manpower scheduling, risk evaluation etc.
Build solutions and tools to enhance floor optimization and operational efficiency.

Overall
Drive data based decisions through creation of insightful reports and dashboard
Work closely with Operation and Marketing departments to:
1) Monitor the business and highlight trends and opportunities.
2) Translate modelling results into business strategy via data/dashboards with impactful visualization.
3) Design data-driven A/B testing.
4) Evaluate the revenue impact of the floor changes/new products/new initiatives.
Generate new ideas on how to improve processes for our team, or our stakeholders
Work closely with Business Intelligence, data warehouse, IT and smart IR teams to implement analytical solutions
Job Requirements



Education & Certification
Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or other analytical fields preferred.

Experience
Minimum 3 - 5 years of practical experience in data analytics, business analytics or Masters in any analytical field.
Programming skills using analytical tools such as SQL, R, Python, Base SAS, SAS EG, is required.
Proficient in data visualization tools, such as Tableau preferred.

Other Prerequisites
Ability to process massive amounts of data and complete critical projects in a correct, accurate and timely manner.
Strong logical thinking, data analysis and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Passionate about data, customers, and building your career with Marina Bay Sands.
Marina Bay Sands is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, providing equal opportunities as we grow our talent base to match our growth ambitions in Singapore. Our employees are committed to adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures, including the rules of conduct and business ethics of the Company.

Title: Data Scientist - OCBC
Description:
WHO WE ARE:
As Singapore's longest established bank, we have been dedicated to enabling individuals and businesses to achieve their aspirations since 1932. How? By taking the time to truly understand people. From there, we provide support, services, solutions, and career paths that meet their individual needs and desires.
Today, we're on a journey of transformation. Leveraging technology and creativity to become a future-ready learning organisation. But for all that change, our strategic ambition is consistently clear and bold, which is to be Asia's leading financial services partner for a sustainable future.
We invite you to build the bank of the future. Innovate the way we deliver financial services. Work in friendly, supportive teams. Build lasting value in your community. Help people grow their assets, business, and investments. Take your learning as far as you can. Or simply enjoy a vibrant, future-ready career.
Your Opportunity Starts Here.
Overall Role Purpose:
Working within the Group Data Science, you will leverage huge volumes of Structured and Unstructured data to solve real business problems across the OCBC Group.
You will work closely with business to understand their problem statements and transform them into ML and AI challenges when needed.
You will work on AI and Generative AI, assessing, building, and serving AI applications for conversational bots and content generation.

Responsibilities:
Work with business leaders across OCBC Group to identify opportunities for leveraging big data and Data Science to drive value for our customers and business.
Develop and maintain machine learning/deep learning models to achieve the desire business outcomes - such as trading algorithm, targeting models or building Agentic systems to handle complex workflows.
Coordinate with different functional teams to deploy models and smart applications into Production of complex and large pretrained and fine tune models.
Use MLOps processes and tools to monitor and refine Production model performance and accuracy.

Specific Knowledge:
5 years+ of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, ideally with a Master's or PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other quantitative field.
Experience leading a team.
Strong programming experience, with solid understanding of software engineering design patterns and best practices.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Trino and VectorDB (elastic).
Ideally experience in On-premise distributed Framework for serving and training
Experienced in the use of CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Jira, Jenkins, GIT/Bitbucket.
Ideally has track record of deploying Machine Learning solutions into Production at scale for AI and GenAI.

Communication & Soft Skills:
Ability to execute in a fast-paced environment.
Creativity to see possibilities within the data & translate into compelling stories, decisions and actions for non-technical business users.
Strong communication skills and drive to deliver business benefits in the real-world.
Genuine drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Can be individual contributor, can relax the team management aspect.

What we offer:
Competitive base salary. A suite of holistic, flexible benefits to suit every lifestyle. Community initiatives. Industry-leading learning and professional development opportunities. Your wellbeing, growth and aspirations are every bit as cared for as the needs of our customers.

Title: Data Analyst & Engineer
Company: Knight Auto Precision Engineering Pte Ltd
Requirements: Collaborate with business functions to define reporting and visualization requirements | Job and Education Qualifications: |
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
1.Data Analysis & Reporting
Collaborate with business functions to define reporting and visualization requirements    
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using business intelligence tools
Work with business functions (Sales, Design, Operations, Logistics, and Finance) to ensure data accuracy and consistency
Perform root cause analysis of data discrepancies and recommend corrective actions
2.Data Engineering & Integration:
Design and implement data pipelines to extract, transform, and load data from various sources to enable real-time visibility and decision-making
Optimize data models to support efficient reporting and analysis
Integrate data from Microsoft 365, HR systems, and other business applications such as SolidWorks (CAD) and the Manufacturing Execution System (MES)
Automate data cleansing and validation processes to improve overall data quality  
3.Data Governance & Quality
Establish data standards, governance frameworks, and best practices for data management
Identify data quality issues and implement solutions to enhance reliability
Support audits and compliance activities by providing accurate datasets and reports
4.Oracle NetSuite Operations:
Be part of the team to support NetSuite ERP operations, including liaising with external vendors to resolve user-reported issues
Assist in developing and maintaining SuiteQL queries for reporting and analytics
Job and Education Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field
3+ years of experience in data analysis and engineering roles, preferably in manufacturing or finance
Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI) is essential
Strong background in SQL, data modeling and ETL processes
Prior experience in NetSuite Analytics is advantageous
Hands-on experience with Oracle products, especially for financial reporting and visualization
Strong Knowledge of ERP data structures, particularly financial modules
Technical Skills:
Proficient in Power BI, including DAX, Power Query (M), and data model optimization for performance
Strong SQL skills (e.g., T-SQL, SuiteQL) for ERP and financial data analysis
Experience in data wrangling and transformation using Python or R for automation and preprocessing
Familiarity with APIs (REST/SOAP), JSON/XML data structures, and integrating with ERP or SaaS applications
Experience with Databricks and Microsoft Fabric for advanced analytics and scalable data processing
Understanding financial processes and accounting principles is highly desirable  
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to approach challenges from a technical perspective
Resourceful and self-driven, with the ability to independently analyze complex problems, break them down into manageable parts, and implement effective solutions
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, capable of working effectively across functions (finance, design, manufacturing, IT, and supply chain)
Meticulous in ensuring data accuracy, with a continuous drive to improve data-related processes and workflows
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

Title: Information Technology - Data Scientist (Data Science Track)
Description:
Job Description
SIA has multiple positions for junior and senior data scientists to drive our AI, data science and business analytics initiatives.
Key Responsibilities include:
Member of an in-house AI and data science development team that works on AI (including areas in generative AI, autonomous agent, NLP, computer vision and recommender system), mathematical optimization, game theory, and experimental design.
Work closely with business stakeholders to create impactful and intelligent features/services in AI, data science and data analytics. Propose and build scalable ML/DL solutions. Deploy them as API microservices for use by software applications and business users for faster and more effective decision making.
Oversee the technical work of external technology partners and provide them datasets to deliver products/services in AI and data science. Support business users in the assessment/ validation of partner-supplied prediction models and in their deployment to production cloud.
Work closely with application development teams to operationalize and integrate AI/ML capabilities in API microservices.
Note: You could be posted to any subsidiary in SIA Group.
Requirements
BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or related discipline is required. PhD and MS degrees related to machine learning and other AI disciplines are preferred.
Intermediate programming skills in Python. Conversant with algorithm design/analysis, data structure and SQL. Familiarity with functional/object-oriented software development using modern programming languages such as Scala, TypeScript/JavaScript, Java and C# is a plus.
Exposure in the use of workflow/map-reduce and stream processing systems such as Spark and Kafka for big-data processing.
Relevant internship or industry experience as a hands-on data scientist/AI engineer in shallow and/or deep learning (you should be very comfortable with most topics covered in the free undergraduate textbook by Gareth James, “An Introduction to Statistical Learning – with Applications in Python”, 2023). Additional exposure in some of the following areas is a plus:
Use of recent proprietary/open-source LLMs through prompt engineering (such as OpenAI ChatGPT and Bing Chat). Familiarity with LLM application/data frameworks (such as LlamaIndex and LangChain).
Experience of using GPU-accelerated deep learning frameworks (such as PyTorch and TensorFlow).
Familiarity with Bayesian statistics/inference and Bayesian/causal networks for probabilistic reasoning.
Some hands-on experience of AWS, Azure, GCP or other public cloud environment.
Good interpersonal and communication skills for working with both technical staff and non-technical business users.
Experience with Agile/Scrum/Kanban methodologies is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company description:

Changi Airport Group (CAG) is the manager of Singapore Changi Airport, a leading air hub in Asia and one of the world's most awarded airports. As airport manager, CAG performs the key functions of airport operations, air hub development, retail and commercial activities, infrastructure development and airport emergency services. CAG also manages Seletar Airport, and through its subsidiary, Changi Airports International, it takes Changi's presence beyond Singapore's shores through consultancy projects and investments in foreign airports. Come join us today!

Job description:

Enterprise Data Science and Management (EDSM) is seeking an experienced Lead Data Scientist to join our Data Science team. Individuals in this role are expected to be comfortable working as an AI/ML Ops engineer and a quantitative researcher. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in the study of customer buying behavior, and a passion for identifying and answering questions that help us identify and fulfill the latent needs of the customer.
Responsibilitie
Work closely with EDSM team to identify and provide insights for important Customer Intelligence questions
Solve commercial problems with AI to deliver social and economic value
Develop, validate and deliver algorithms, statistical models and analytical insights to achieve business goals
Analyze and interpret the results of marketing/Ops campaigns and/or experiments and recommend enhancements for future campaigns
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analysis, model development, model validation, model implementation and model ops.
Develop go-to-market implementations and connect strategy to execution around data infrastructure, AI operating models and GenAI-enabled transformation.
Create a culture of excellence and lead with confidence, charisma, context, and humility working effectively at all levels
Provide thought-leadership and establish best practices for instrumentation and experimentation and communicate those to EDSM and other Data Science/Analytics teams.
Requirements
M.S. or Ph.D. in a relevant technical field, or 4+ years' experience in a relevant role
Exceptional expertise in AI engineering, machine learning and data science
Strong understanding of marketplace for AI services with ability to develop go-to-market plans with marketing teams
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Practical hands-on experience with a broad range of tools to assist in AI development: Jupyter, LLMs, PyTorch, Tensorfllow, AWS Sagemaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML, etc
Strong track record of leading delivery of AI solutions through incubation, proof-of-concept, to large-scale real-time deployment

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Requirements: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications. | Requirements |
Description:
Job Description: Jnr Data Engineer
As a Jnr Data Engineer you will be working on innovative medium-sized advanced analytics projects onsite in Singapore and virtually with global teams working on offshore projects. The clients range from Singapore Government agencies to innovative start-ups and large offshore clients in Europe and Australia.
AlphaZetta works with the latest cloud and analytics software allowing you to build experience in cutting edge tech. The existing team will provide hands on guidance and support to help you learn.
Work from home (in Singapore) in a flexible working environment
Reports To:
· Project Manager Singapore, AlphaZetta
Key Data Engineer Responsibilities:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Design, develop and maintain data ETL pipelines on cloud platforms to support business analytics and reporting needs.
Assist in data warehouse design and data modeling for source system integration
Troubleshoot and debug issues in production environments.
You will be working on innovative medium-sized advanced analytics 
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Proficiency in analytics tools like Python and SQL.
1 years of work experience with ETL, Data Modelling, and designing, coding, transformation and processing of data sets using Pyspark data build tool and SQL.
Experience in Azure and or AWS cloud services like AWS Lambda, Glue, EC2, S3, Redshift, RDS, Cloudwatch and Step Functions.
Willing and enthusiastic about continuous learning of new technologies and data science & data engineering techniques.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Optional Additional Skills
Experience with Azure Data Factory and dbt (Data Build Tool) will be an added advantage.
Experience with PowerBI also an advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: Data Analyst
As a Data Analyst at D-SIMLAB Technologies, you will play a key role in deriving insights from large datasets to optimize semiconductor manufacturing processes. This role focuses on data extraction, analysis, and actionable insights, while collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy D-SIMLAB’s software products as well as provide professional consultation services to our clients. The ideal candidate is someone who excels in data-driven analysis and is eager to work on high-impact projects in the semiconductor industry.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Extraction and Analysis:
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from semiconductor manufacturing environments to ensure data consistency, completeness, and correctness.
Use statistical methods and data mining techniques to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that impact production performance.
Performance Evaluation:
Analyze the gap between planned and actual production outcomes. Identify root causes for performance deviations and recommend data-driven strategies for process improvement. Develop reports and visualizations to present findings to clients and internal stakeholders.
Data-Driven Insights:
Provide actionable insights based on data analysis to optimize semiconductor manufacturing processes. Work closely with clients to understand their specific needs and translate data findings into operational and strategic improvements.
ETL and Data Modeling:
Build and maintain ETL processes to integrate data from various sources into D-SIMLAB’s data models. Collaborate with simulation modeling teams to ensure accurate and reliable data is fed into models.
Consultation Services:
Act as a trusted advisor to clients by offering data-driven recommendations for enhancing their production efficiency. Present analyses and proposals to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clarity and actionable takeaways.
Data Visualization and Reporting:
Create dashboards and reports using advanced data visualization tools to communicate key insights and trends effectively. Continuously improve reporting mechanisms to provide real-time insights and support ongoing optimization efforts.
Collaboration with Teams:
Work with Software Engineers, Data Scientists, and other cross-functional teams to ensure that data insights align with product goals and customer needs. Contribute to product enhancement initiatives, focusing on the improvement of data-related components and analytics.
Candidate Requirements:
Education:
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
Experience:
Strong analytical skills with a minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in an industrial environment. Semiconductor experience is a plus.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is highly desirable.
Experience with ETL processes and database management.
Analytical Abilities:
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle large datasets and deliver actionable insights to improve operational performance.
Soft Skills:
Ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural, multidisciplinary team.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Willingness to Travel:
Willing to travel for international projects and collaborate closely with clients and internal teams.

Title: Junior Systems & Data Analyst
Company: Tong Tar Transport Service Pte Ltd
Description:
We are looking for a versatile and detail-oriented Junior Systems & Data Analyst to support the digital transformation efforts of our bus transportation services. This role offers hands-on experience with both software and hardware technologies used in the land transport industry. You will be involved in a cross-functional role that bridges operations, IT, and data — providing exposure to real-world transport challenges and how digital tools and analytics improve efficiency and service delivery.
Key Responsibilities:
Systems Analysis & Hardware Support
Support the designing, configuration and testing of transport-related systems to automate processes, streamline operations and improve UX.
Assist in the deployment, configuration, and day-to-day monitoring of in-bus hardware.
Coordinate with hardware vendors or internal technicians to troubleshoot and resolve system and device issues.
Data Analytics & Reporting
Collect and clean operational data (e.g., ridership patterns, punctuality, vehicle allocation).
Design and automate recurring reports to track KPIs, operational efficiency, and performance.
Support management with data needed for strategic planning and compliance.
Present data in a visual and easy-to-understand format using Excel, Power BI, or similar tools.
Training & Documentation
Create user guides, process manuals, and quick reference materials for staff and users (e.g., drivers, riders).
Conduct onboarding and training sessions for staff on systems and standard operating procedures.
Gather feedback from users and support continuous improvement in training and system adoption.
Requirements:
Qualifications:
Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Business Analytics, or related fields.
At least 1 year of work experience involving systems or data analysis is preferred. Candidates without experience are welcome.
Technical Skills:
Basic proficiency in Excel (formulas, pivot tables) and familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of databases and data analysis concepts (SQL knowledge is a bonus).
Interest in transport operations and how digital tools support service delivery.
Soft Skills:
Good communication skills, both written and verbal. Good Mandarin is preferred (to communicate effectively with drivers and ground staff).
Detail-oriented with a logical and analytical mindset.
Willingness to learn and work closely with both frontline and back-end teams.
Able to manage time effectively and handle multiple responsibilities.
What We Offer:
Contribute to meaningful process improvements and organizational insights.
Exposure to real-world transport operations and the role of technology in public mobility.
Opportunities to grow within a forward-looking transport company focused on innovation and service excellence.

Title: Data Analyst & Engineer
Company: Knight Auto Precision Engineering Pte Ltd
Requirements: Collaborate with business functions to define reporting and visualization requirements | Job and Education Qualifications: |
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
1.Data Analysis & Reporting
Collaborate with business functions to define reporting and visualization requirements    
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using business intelligence tools
Work with business functions (Sales, Design, Operations, Logistics, and Finance) to ensure data accuracy and consistency
Perform root cause analysis of data discrepancies and recommend corrective actions
2.Data Engineering & Integration:
Design and implement data pipelines to extract, transform, and load data from various sources to enable real-time visibility and decision-making
Optimize data models to support efficient reporting and analysis
Integrate data from Microsoft 365, HR systems, and other business applications such as SolidWorks (CAD) and the Manufacturing Execution System (MES)
Automate data cleansing and validation processes to improve overall data quality  
3.Data Governance & Quality
Establish data standards, governance frameworks, and best practices for data management
Identify data quality issues and implement solutions to enhance reliability
Support audits and compliance activities by providing accurate datasets and reports
4.Oracle NetSuite Operations:
Be part of the team to support NetSuite ERP operations, including liaising with external vendors to resolve user-reported issues
Assist in developing and maintaining SuiteQL queries for reporting and analytics
Job and Education Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field
3+ years of experience in data analysis and engineering roles, preferably in manufacturing or finance
Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI) is essential
Strong background in SQL, data modeling and ETL processes
Prior experience in NetSuite Analytics is advantageous
Hands-on experience with Oracle products, especially for financial reporting and visualization
Strong Knowledge of ERP data structures, particularly financial modules
Technical Skills:
Proficient in Power BI, including DAX, Power Query (M), and data model optimization for performance
Strong SQL skills (e.g., T-SQL, SuiteQL) for ERP and financial data analysis
Experience in data wrangling and transformation using Python or R for automation and preprocessing
Familiarity with APIs (REST/SOAP), JSON/XML data structures, and integrating with ERP or SaaS applications
Experience with Databricks and Microsoft Fabric for advanced analytics and scalable data processing
Understanding financial processes and accounting principles is highly desirable  
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to approach challenges from a technical perspective
Resourceful and self-driven, with the ability to independently analyze complex problems, break them down into manageable parts, and implement effective solutions
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, capable of working effectively across functions (finance, design, manufacturing, IT, and supply chain)
Meticulous in ensuring data accuracy, with a continuous drive to improve data-related processes and workflows
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

Title: Associate Analyst/Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Job Responsibilities



Contribute to the Revenue Optimization department in its goal to maximize gaming profit by performing the following:


Product Analytics
Analyze various aspects of the casino operations, including product and area performance, operational and manpower efficiency, dealer performance etc.
Apply advanced analytics, modelling and machine learning to improve gaming floor optimization, demand forecasting, manpower scheduling, risk evaluation etc.
Build solutions and tools to enhance floor optimization and operational efficiency.

Overall
Drive data based decisions through creation of insightful reports and dashboard
Work closely with Operation and Marketing departments to:
1) Monitor the business and highlight trends and opportunities.
2) Translate modelling results into business strategy via data/dashboards with impactful visualization.
3) Design data-driven A/B testing.
4) Evaluate the revenue impact of the floor changes/new products/new initiatives.
Generate new ideas on how to improve processes for our team, or our stakeholders
Work closely with Business Intelligence, data warehouse, IT and smart IR teams to implement analytical solutions
Job Requirements



Education & Certification
Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or other analytical fields preferred.

Experience
Minimum 3 - 5 years of practical experience in data analytics, business analytics or Masters in any analytical field.
Programming skills using analytical tools such as SQL, R, Python, Base SAS, SAS EG, is required.
Proficient in data visualization tools, such as Tableau preferred.

Other Prerequisites
Ability to process massive amounts of data and complete critical projects in a correct, accurate and timely manner.
Strong logical thinking, data analysis and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Passionate about data, customers, and building your career with Marina Bay Sands.
Marina Bay Sands is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, providing equal opportunities as we grow our talent base to match our growth ambitions in Singapore. Our employees are committed to adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures, including the rules of conduct and business ethics of the Company.

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Requirements: Support product owners in facilitating discovery sessions and requirements for workshops for business users. | Qualifications |
Description:
About Supply Chain Data Analyst role:
In your role as a Supply Chain Analyst at AE, you will be essential in addressing the data and analytics needs as we progress with our digital transformation.
As an enthusiastic Data Analyst, you'll advocate decisions based on data insights. You'll help internal teams shift from conventional practices to uncovering valuable insights. Data Analysts will assist the organization in transitioning from descriptive analytics to diagnostic and predictive stages by extracting insights and introducing new techniques for decision-making.
Moreover, you will aid in our digital transformation by facilitating discovery and inception sessions with the product owner or manager.
This role offers an excellent opportunity to gain a comprehensive understanding of the supply chain function from industry professionals and to grow within the Analytics space.
The daily responsibilities for this role will be divided between ad-hoc tasks and project-based deliverables. Candidates can expect to engage in ad-hoc analysis as well as being assigned to projects with specific outcomes.
To succeed in this role, candidates should be adaptable and comfortable with continuous learning and delivery. This will enable them to support short-term goals effectively and contribute to long-term initiatives.
Responsibilities
Support product owners in facilitating discovery sessions and requirements for workshops for business users.
Document discovery sessions data flow and process flow, identifying gaps and areas for improvement.
Identify data sources, collect data through manual or automated means, source missing data, and clean, transform, and organize data into a usable format.
Design, develop, and deploy reports and dashboards utilizing data visualization and generate business presentations and formal written reports to communicate the results of data analysis effectively.
Plan and execute master data consolidation and metadata documentation projects with product owners.
Support product owners with project documentation.
Train and support the Internal Data Champion through coaching and mentoring.
Qualifications
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related STEM field.
Minimum of 4 years of proven experience in the domain of business analytics.
Proven experience working with senior business stakeholders.
Proven experience with Power BI & DAX for analytics and data visualization.
Hands-on experience with SQL, Python or PySpark, with the ability to write production-ready code.
A sound understanding of the data modeling concepts and their applications across various use cases.
Experience in Manufacturing or Supply Chain is highly desirable.
Experience with data science techniques and predictive methods for statistical quality and forecasting analysis is highly desirable.
Experience working with cloud platforms, preferably Databricks or Azure.
Familiarity with data governance, master data, and metadata management.
Familiarity with project management tools like Jira & confluence.
Knowledge of SAP S4 and understanding relevant data tables is a significant plus but not mandatory.
Knowledge of Figma and UX principles is a significant plus but not mandatory.
Knowledge of Power Apps, Power Automate, and UiPath is a significant plus but not mandatory.

Learning & Development Opportunity
Opportunity to learn and grow in the Supply Chain Digital Transformation space as AE embarks on its journey.
Coaching and mentoring from Analytics Leaders in the field.
Opportunities to travel and collaborate with cross-border teams on internal initiatives.

Title: Data Analytics Executive (6 Months Contract)
Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Trend Identification:
Analyze large datasets to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations across the BreadTalk Group.
Provide data-driven insights to help the leadership team make informed decisions and define strategic directions for the business.
BTGR Data Management:
Take ownership of managing and analyzing BTGR data, focusing on member profiles, demographic analysis, divisional sales, transaction counts, SKU performance, and store performance.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across all data touchpoints.
Strategic Recommendations:
Work closely with the brand and management teams to deliver strategic recommendations based on data analysis.
Assist in determining the right strategic moves for various brands within the BreadTalk Group, based on insights gained from data.
Data Extraction & Reporting:
Extract, consolidate, and analyze data from multiple sources and systems, ensuring data integrity.
Generate comprehensive reports for stakeholders, addressing data discrepancies and ensuring accurate, timely reporting.
Cross-Departmental Collaboration:
Collaborate with various departments (Marketing, Finance, Operations, etc.) to ensure alignment of data insights with business needs.
Assist teams in improving business processes through data-driven decision-making.
Customer Service Analytics:
Analyze customer service data to identify areas for improvement, enhancing service quality and customer satisfaction.
 Job Requirements:
Education: Diploma/Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
Experience: 1-2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role, preferably in retail, F&B, or a similar industry.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, Python, R, or similar).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong knowledge of data management and reporting processes.
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
High attention to detail and accuracy in reporting.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Other: Knowledge of customer analytics and sales performance metrics is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join the Nursing Department’s analytics team at Ng Teng Fong General Hospital (NTFGH). You will work closely with clinicians, administrators, and healthcare professionals to deliver insights that enhance patient care, optimize operations, and drive strategic initiatives.
The role spans across three core areas: Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, and Operations Optimization.
Key Responsibilities: 
Develop and maintain operational dashboards to support nursing and hospital performance monitoring.
Support data migration and engineering efforts, preparing datasets to enable advanced analytics on next-generation healthcare platforms.
Perform data extraction, transformation, and integration from hospital systems to meet evolving data needs.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover operational patterns, identify gaps, and generate improvement opportunities.
Contribute to solution design for optimizing resource allocation, service utilization, and workflow efficiencies.
Present findings and insights to clinical and management teams to support data-driven decision making.
 Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Operations Research, or a related field.
Proficiency in data querying and scripting (e.g., SQL, Python).
Experience with data visualization tools (preferably Tableau).
Familiarity with data engineering concepts and platforms (knowledge of PySpark and Databricks is an advantage).
Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Prior experience in healthcare analytics or working with electronic medical records is advantageous.
 Preferred Attributes:
Experience in operations research, process improvement, or optimization modeling.
Exposure to large-scale data platforms and cloud-based analytics solutions.
Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
