Title: Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst (AMK / 2 years contract) VA
Location: Ang Mo Kio Town Centre, North-East Region
Requirements: Gathering and understanding business requirements. This involves engaging with various stakeholders, business leaders and department heads to identify their specific data needs and objectives. | Requirements: |
Description:
Description:
Located at Ang Mo Kio
Monday - Friday, 830am - 6pm
2 years contract (Renewable / Convertible)
Up to $7000
Jobscope:
Develop, implement and maintain leading-edge analytics systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks
Leveraging on various data analysis tools and techniques to gather, process and visualize data, enabling business stakeholders to understand trends, identify opportunities for improvement and make data-driven decisions.
Validates data from various sources and ensure readiness for analysis
Transform data into the right data set before qualitative / quantitative analysis of data and generate reports of analysis.
Assist in the execution of project lifecycle.
Gathering and understanding business requirements. This involves engaging with various stakeholders, business leaders and department heads to identify their specific data needs and objectives.
Collecting, cleaning and analyzing data from various sources. This involves ensuring data accuracy, reporting integrity, overall quality and reliable
Developing dashboards, reports and visualizations. This involve creating interactive and visually appealing representations of data that facilitate easy comprehension. These dashboards and reports often highlight key performance indicators (KPIs) and other performance metrics.
Identifying trends and patterns to provide actionable recommendations to improve processes and enhance customer satisfaction. This involve adopting analytical techniques to detect correlations, anomalies and emerging trends that might impact the business.
Assist Digital Business Partner and stakeholders to translate their needs and priorities into digital and technology pipelines and projects. 
Assist Digital Business Partner in developing project plans, goals, schedules, budgets and resource utilization management. Provide assistance in organizing and managing all phases of the IT Initiative project to ensure on-time completion and successful deployment.
Requirements:
Proven analytical skills, including mining, evaluation and visualization
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports and presentations
Proficiency in programming experience with frameworks including ETL, XML and JavaScript, Python, SQL, HTML/CSS
Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages and tools including Excel, SPSS and SAS, Tableau, Power BI and Power Query
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science or Statistics
Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIP) and Microsoft Power BI Certification is preferred.
Strong communication and presentation skills to convey insights clearly and compelling, translating technical findings into language that non-technical stakeholders can easily understand.
Collaboration and stakeholder management skills to identify continuous improvement and value-added opportunities
Technically savvy in learning and leveraging on digital tools such as Generative AI, Data Automation Tools, RPA using UIPath and Microsoft Productivity Tools
**We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates would be notified
Interested applicants may send their resume to apply58@talentvis.com or click APPLY NOW

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide actionable insights. |
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making within the Technology & Telecoms industry. This temporary role involves analysing data, identifying trends, and producing actionable insights to support business objectives.
Client Details
The employer is a well-established organisation operating within the Technology & Telecoms industry. Known for its innovation and commitment to excellence, the company has a strong presence in the market and offers a collaborative and forward-thinking work environment.
Description
Collect, clean, and organise data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Analyse data and identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support business decisions.
Generate detailed reports and visualisations to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide actionable insights.
Maintain and update databases to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
Support the development and implementation of data-driven strategies.
Utilise statistical tools and software to perform in-depth analysis of data sets.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and recommend improvements based on findings.
Profile
A successful Data Analyst should have:
A strong understanding of data analysis methods and statistical tools.
Proficiency in data visualisation software such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL for data manipulation.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to work with large data sets.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide actionable insights.
Effective communication skills to present data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Job Offer
Opportunity to gain experience in the Technology & Telecoms industry.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.
Exposure to innovative projects and cutting-edge technologies.
This temporary position is an excellent opportunity for individuals passionate about data analysis. Apply today to contribute your skills and expertise!
To apply online please click the 'Apply' button. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst
Job Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to extract insights from IoT data, analyze performance trends, and help optimize system efficiency. The ideal candidate should be skilled in data visualization, statistical analysis, and business intelligence tools.
Key Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and analyze IoT data for trends and anomalies.
Develop dashboards and reports for internal teams and customers.
Identify patterns that impact system performance and user experience.
Work with software engineers to improve data accuracy and reporting capabilities.
Provide actionable insights for product and business improvements.
Requirements:
Diploma/Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau).
Experience with time-series data and IoT analytics is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Title: Senior Data Analyst | 24 months Contract
Requirements: Liaise with cross-functional teams to gather and address their specific data requirements. | Key Requirements |
Description:
Data Analytics
Spearhead the design and execution of end-to-end data analytics strategies.
Develop and manage automated data pipelines and ETL workflows.
Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and validation to maintain high data accuracy and integrity.
Utilize advanced statistical and data mining techniques to analyze extensive healthcare datasets.
Build and maintain interactive dashboards with user-friendly visualizations tailored for non-technical stakeholders.
Deliver in-depth analytics to support clinical research and quality improvement projects, especially in areas like chronic disease management (e.g., diabetes, kidney disease, asthma).
Create predictive models and deploy machine learning solutions, including large language models (LLMs).
Collaborate with clinical teams to integrate Patient-Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs) into existing care processes.
Work closely with GTO and AIO teams to improve data visibility and accessibility.
Design and apply LLM-based solutions to streamline and optimize patient care pathways.
Data Quality & Monitoring
Conduct regular validation to ensure the integrity and consistency of datasets.
Detect and interpret key trends, patterns, and insights from healthcare data.
Establish and maintain robust data quality assurance and validation protocols.
Generate and present clear, data-driven reports and visualizations to stakeholders.
Ensure all data visualizations are user-centric and accessible to non-technical users.
Liaise with cross-functional teams to gather and address their specific data requirements.
Data Governance & Protection
Implement stringent data security policies and access controls.
Supervise data standardization and quality management initiatives.
Ensure adherence to data privacy laws such as PDPA and HBRA.
Develop secure protocols for safe data exchange and collaborative access.
Promote ethical AI usage and ensure responsible deployment of LLM technologies.
Key Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics)
Minimum of 2 years’ experience in healthcare analytics or a similar field.
Preferably 2–3 years of experience in a leadership or team lead role.
Strong programming skills in Python, R, and SQL.
Hands-on experience with data visualization platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, or TIBCO Spotfire.
Proficiency with cloud analytics environments, especially Databricks.
Solid foundation in statistical methods, including predictive modeling, A/B testing, and time-series analysis.
Skilled in deploying and fine-tuning AI/ML models, including LLMs, within healthcare contexts.
Experience working with cloud providers, particularly AWS.
Familiarity with container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience using modern web frameworks such as Streamlit, NextJS, and TypeScript.
Proficient in REST API development using frameworks like FastAPI.
Understanding of database design, with hands-on experience using tools like SQLAlchemy.
Capable of working with large and complex datasets.
Proficient in using Git for version control and collaborative coding.
Strong grasp of CI/CD pipelines and DevSecOps best practices.
Knowledge of medical terminology and healthcare IT systems.
Demonstrated ability to manage stakeholders and drive successful project outcomes.
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.
Effective communicator with strong presentation, writing, and interpersonal skills.
Highly detail-oriented, with a commitment to accurate data handling and analysis.
Able to convert business challenges into technical data solutions.
Team-oriented, proactive, and capable of thriving under time constraints.
Comfortable working both independently and collaboratively in dynamic environments.
To apply, please visit www.gmprecruit.com
To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Gia Grace at gia.grace@gmprecruit.com
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: APAC Business Data Analyst
Description:
An APAC Business Data Analyst plays a critical support role in analyzing and interpreting data across business development, operations, logistics, and financial performance from business sites across the APAC region. This position works closely with local teams and HQ stakeholders to deliver actionable insights that improve operational efficiency, financial understanding, and commercial effectiveness. The role involves cleaning and structuring data, developing reports, identifying trends, and contributing to continuous improvement in business processes and reporting.
 Key Responsibilities:
1.      Sales, Operational & Logistics Data Analysis
·       Analyse APAC site-level data across sales, operations, and logistics to support performance monitoring
·       Review In-Do-Out process metrics to identify delays, resource gaps, or performance variances by sites
·       Track and report on key indicators such as throughput, turnaround time, and transport efficiency
·       Coordinate with site to validate data and support improvement initiatives through data-driven insights
 2.      Finance Performance Support
·       Review and analyze P&L-related data to highlight key cost, margin, and performance trends
·       Assist in preparing monthly performance summaries for internal review
·       Support budget planning and profitability analysis by site or business line
 3.      Data Preparation & Reporting
·       Collect, clean, and consolidate data from multiple sources (e.g. ERP, Zoho, site trackers) for reporting purposes
·       Develop or update recurring dashboards and reports in tools such as Excel or PowerBI
·       Ensure data consistency and accuracy in all reports by following defined metrics and logic
 4.      Stakeholder Collaboration
·       Work closely with APAC site teams and internal department (Business Development, Operations, Finance) to understand data needs
·       Support ad-hoc analysis requests and help translate data into actionable business insights
·       Maintain documentation for reporting templates and support alignment across sites
·       Any other duties as assigned by superior/senior management
Requirement:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Finance, Supply Chain, or a related field
2–5 years of relevant experience in data analysis, preferably within logistics, sales operations, or finance
Experience working with large datasets and translating business needs into actionable insights
Familiarity with regional APAC operations or multi-site reporting is a strong advantage
Nice to Have:
Exposure to budgeting, forecasting, or profitability modeling
Experience in a regional role or cross-country data consolidation
Basic understanding of supply chain or warehouse operations is a plus

Title: Data Science Analyst - ML and Deep Learning (Data Analytics & AI)
Description:
Company description:

Synapxe is the national HealthTech agency inspiring tomorrow's health. The nexus of HealthTech, we connect people and systems to power a healthier Singapore.

Together with partners, we create intelligent technological solutions to improve the health of millions of people every day, everywhere. Reimagine the future of health together with us at www.synapxe.sg


Job description:

Position Overview
This is a Data Science Analyst role supporting Healthcare Analytics workstreams
We are expanding our strong data science team and are looking for talented AI practitioner with applied experience in the fields of Machine Learning and Deep learning to join us. This role is best suited for candidate that is interested in developing new AI application that has a direct and immense, real-world healthcare impact.
You need to have a deep passion for analyzing and resolving healthcare problems. You display an intellectual curiosity about the business needs as well as the capability to engage with stakeholders to understand business issues.
Role & Responsibilities
Analyze data, Scope out problem definition and hypothesis for analysis for image/signal data (such as EEG, ECG) related use case
Responsible for image analysis, synthesis and other aspects of algorithm development, including visual recognition, object detection, segmentation and signal data pattern recognition etc
Responsible for the exploration of cutting-edge technology in image/signal data related algorithms and ensure the technologies get successfully applied
Design experiments to test data assumptions
Evaluate experiment outcomes to draw actionable conclusions
Deploy data models across different channels and customer platforms
Partner with stakeholders to translate business problems into data science projects
Develop strategies to identify, acquire and use appropriate data sets to develop practical solutions and support decision making
Maintain an advanced knowledge of trends affecting the industry
Synthesize findings into actionable insights
Apply data analysis, data mining and data processing to present data clearly
Provide rationale, business cases and ROI models to support investment
Requirements
PhD or Masters in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology, Physics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent
Preferably minimum 3 years of relevant working experience
Solid research and engineering background and experience in computer vision, deep learning, and image/signal data processing/analysis algorithms
Good experience with Python or R is prerequisite
Good experience with Deep learning framework e.g. Tensorflow, keras, Pytorch is prerequisite
Hands on experience in the development of image classification, object detection, segmentation, signal data pattern recognition or related is preferred
Good experience with SQL and/or NoSQL is preferred
Proven communication skill to explain insights from technical work to non-technical audience through presentation or other means
Ability to work independently
Model deployment experience is preferred
Apply Now
NOTE: It only takes a few minutes to apply for a meaningful career in HealthTech - GO FOR IT!!

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Our Risk Assurance Practice provides an invaluable safeguard in today’s complex operating environment with insights and independent assurance. We work with clients to deliver business control to help them to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business from people to performance, systems to strategy, business plans to business resilience. We help clients manage, mitigate and control risks from potential cybersecurity breaches to possible breaks in the supply chain. We assess and prepare businesses by looking into their technology, finance, data analytics, regulatory requirements, data security and privacy, internal audit, and the third parties our clients rely on, to help clients deliver quality results and meet their strategic objectives. |
Description:
At PwC, we help clients build trust and reinvent so they can turn complexity into competitive advantage. We’re a tech-forward, people-empowered network with more than 370,000 people in 149 countries. Across audit and assurance, tax and legal, deals and consulting we help clients build, accelerate and sustain momentum. Find out more at www.pwc.com .
Our Risk Assurance Practice provides an invaluable safeguard in today’s complex operating environment with insights and independent assurance. We work with clients to deliver business control to help them to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business from people to performance, systems to strategy, business plans to business resilience. We help clients manage, mitigate and control risks from potential cybersecurity breaches to possible breaks in the supply chain. We assess and prepare businesses by looking into their technology, finance, data analytics, regulatory requirements, data security and privacy, internal audit, and the third parties our clients rely on, to help clients deliver quality results and meet their strategic objectives.
How will you value-add?
Model the objects in the organisation's core SQL database
Maintain the data dictionary
Document and monitor the connections to the source databases
Ensure data quality in the data mart through the development and maintenance of exception reports
Automate information retrieval from external sources
Develop business intelligence dashboards using PowerBI and Google Lookers
Perform ETL using Alteryx, Python, or R
About you
Bachelor's degree in computer science, data science, or a related field
1-2 years of experience with SQL
Experience with data modelling and data dictionary management
Experience with ETL tools such as Alteryx, Python, or R
Experience with business intelligence tools such as PowerBI and Google Lookers
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Business Intelligence, Regional Operations
Requirements: Understand functional and technical requirements to build reports that deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders | Requirements: |
Description:
The Operation teams at Shopee covers the operational end-to-end process, from when the buyer searches for a product listed on the Shopee platform, to the moment the buyer receives the products. The team analyses and monitors operational KPIs across the region and conducts root cause analysis when operation performance fluctuates. The Operations team comprises Customer Service, Payment, Listings, Warehouse, Logistics, Seller Operations and Fraud.
About the Team:
Shopee’s Regional Operations constantly solving problems and introducing innovative solutions to improve platform usability and enhance end user experience for our buyers, sellers, and partners.
Our teams sit at the core of our business and collaborate with various departments to manage end-to-end e-commerce processes, and design scalable solutions to create impact across multiple markets. To do so, we deep dive into the fundamentals of each aspect and drive strategic initiatives to sharpen our policy, processes and features for greater product and operational excellence.
Job Description:
Our Business Intelligence Data Analysts go beyond performance monitoring and report - they play a crucial role in conducting in-depth data-powered analysis and research that drive key business decisions across Regional Operations.  
We’re looking for a hands-on, motivated individual who enjoys complex problem-solving and deriving data-backed solutions to help drive high-impact business changes.  
Work closely with large datasets to build data visualisation and dashboards that inform strategic planning and sound business decisions
Understand functional and technical requirements to build reports that deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders
Build and maintain data infrastructure (data pipelines, aggregated data sets, reports, dashboards) to facilitate development of key metrics to measure efficiency/impact/outcomes of day-to-day operations
Conduct research and synthesise findings into plans, processes, and playbooks that are clear and lead to actionable insights
Work closely with internal stakeholders from cross-functional and product teams across multiple markets to build, test, and implement new processes and systems
Drive adoption of the team’s initiatives through strong collaboration and alignment of organisational needs with various stakeholders
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Science with 0-3 years experience
Proficiency in SQL/Python
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Hadoop, Hive SQL, Spark), ETL tools, data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker) and statistical analysis (e.g. hypothesis testing, regression, data modeling techniques) preferred
Ability to analyse and synthesise data from both quantitative and qualitative sources
Ability to draw insights from data to to design practical and scalable solutions
Ability to explain technical concepts in a clear and succinct manner to various stakeholders
Ability to thrive in a dynamic and collaborative environment

Title: Trading Commercial Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities for this position may include but are not limited to:
Monitor and evaluate market fundamentals, pricing structures, global trade flows, and competitor production profiles and other industry information to generate insights that support trading strategies.
Lead and facilitate discussions on fundamentals with a broader team of traders and other analysts, providing timely key market data and relevant analysis to help the Trading team to formulate view of market directions and inform new trade ideas on physical and financial trading.
Collaborate with Commercial Analysts and Traders across Houston, Singapore, and London to support global arbitrage, supply/demand modelling, and commercial opportunity identification.
Develop and apply models/tools to monitor and forecast key market drivers such as infrastructure, supply/demand, and industry production to support trading strategies.
Identify and recommend trading opportunities using deterministic analytical models and dynamic analytical models, as well as apply quantitative risk management methodologies to guide trading teams in informed decision-making.
Pilot and leverage advanced digital tools—including machine learning and predictive analytics—to enhance trading performance and uncover new market opportunities.
Conduct performance look-backs on trading outcomes and assess the accuracy of market calls and price forecasts.
Build and maintain a network of industry contacts to enhance market intelligence, generate insights and conduct economic analysis for future opportunities.
Champion process improvements by partnering with internal teams to optimize digital tools and pursue analytical process improvement opportunities to reduce manual effort.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 3 years of experience in energy trading, market data analytics, or related roles.
Solid understanding of commodity markets, including crude, natural gas, renewables, and/or refined products.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, and PowerPoint; experience with Python for data analysis and visualization is preferred.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present market insights clearly and concisely to influence and achieve optimum decisions.
A collaborative team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment and ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
A digital-first mindset with a passion for innovation, ability to utilize decision analysis tools and processes to evaluate multiple commercial options and drive continuous improvement.
 To learn more and to submit application, visit https://careers.chevron.com/ no later than July 09, 2025.
By submitting an application/uploading your resume or CV, you acknowledge and agree that you are providing personal information about you to Chevron, it subsidiaries and affiliates, to consider whether you are an appropriate candidate for a position and that such information may be shared with Chevron affiliates, subsidiaries, or vendors and may be transferred to locations outside the country of collection.
All information supplied will be treated as strictly confidential for the purpose of selection and recruitment. Only short-listed candidates will be notified, for candidates not selected, we would like to thank you in advance for your interest in a Chevron career.

Title: 6 Months Data Analyst (Validation)
Description:
The Data Validation Analyst plays a key role in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of customer experience feedback data. This role supports strategic decision-making by validating survey responses and customer interaction data across multiple insurance touchpoints, helping improve service quality and customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities:
Review and validate customer experience data from surveys, call centre logs, emails, and digital, and social media platforms.
Identify, document, and resolve data discrepancies and anomalies.
Collaborate with customer research and analytics teams to ensure data integrity for sentiment analysis and trend reporting.
Support the development of dashboards and reports that reflect accurate customer sentiment and satisfaction metrics.
Requirements:
Education – Diploma or Degree holders, preferably in business, finance
Experience – prefer to have 1+ years in data validation, data analysis, or quality assurance within the insurance or financial services industry.
Data driven and results oriented
High level of attention to details and able to work independently
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) preferred

Data Quality / Data Lakehouse Management

Understand business needs and analyse data to uncover patterns and insights.

Title: Data Analyst, Casino Finance
Requirements: Understand business data requirements and ensuring that solutions meet operational and business needs. | Design complex dashboards, reports, and visualization accordingly to business requirements. | Job Requirements |
Description:
LOVE WHAT YOU DO? THERE IS A PLACE FOR YOU HERE!
Be part of our diverse and inclusive team.
Job Responsibilities
Assist the Casino Finance team (i.e.: Cage, Count & Casino Accounting to manage data in the most efficient and effective way to benefit the organization and business needs which include but not limited to:
Understand business data requirements and ensuring that solutions meet operational and business needs.
Design complex dashboards, reports, and visualization accordingly to business requirements.
Analyze data from various system, statistics, service and/or products to identify opportunities for process and performance improvement such as manpower efficiency and risk evaluation etc
Prepare analysis reports for Casino Finance’s Management team to understand and to enable decision making based on trends and/or patterns.
Assist in developing solutions and tools to automate processes and enhance operational efficiency
Perform other duties or audit tasks as assigned
Job Requirements
Education & Certification
Degree in Business Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or other analytical fields preferred. Marketing graduates with flair for numbers and interest in customer and marketing analytics are welcomed to apply.
Experience
1 to 2 years of practical experience in business analytics, customer analytics or marketing analytics preferred.
Other Prerequisites
Strong logical thinking, data analysis and problem-solving skills.
Proficient in data visualization tools, such as Tableau and SQL are preferred.
Experience in building complex queries and data visualizations.
Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Be meticulous, and able to handle multiple tasks efficiently and in an organized way
Ability to work independently and as part of a team - works well in a collaborative environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Passionate about data, customers, and building your career with Marina Bay Sands.
Marina Bay Sands is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, providing equal opportunities as we grow our talent base to match our growth ambitions in Singapore. Our employees are committed to adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures, including the rules of conduct and business ethics of the Company.

Title: Finance Analyst (Perm/MNC)
Description:
Responsibilities 
Manage and ensure the timely monthly closing process, forecasting, budgeting and strategic planning process for the Organisation's selected Business Units. 
Provide leadership in financial analysis and commercial support to the Organisation's selected Business Units, focusing on financial performance, investments, cost controls, financial targets, and key KPIs (eg. profit & loss, balance sheet, and headcount indicators). 
Prepare and support the development of monthly and ad hoc management reports, budgets, and presentation decks for the Organisation and its selected Business Units.
Ensure compliance with the Organisation's policies and procedures.
Support the development and implementation of best financial practices.
Support any other ad hoc projects or urgent tasks arising from business or divisional needs.
Requirements
Degree holder from Accountancy/Finance studies.
At least 3 years FP&A work experience in MNC environment.
Strong knowledge of accounting principles and practices.
Excellent proficiency in SAP (FICO), Power BI and MS Office applications.
Able to work under pressure and tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment, and matrix organisation.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Good commercial acumen
Self-driven and ability to work independently

Title: Data Administrator (Data Analyst Support)
Description:
The Group
Powered by the vision of connecting businesses worldwide to transact with ease, Henatenn is an Integrated Omni-channel Commerce and Supply Chain Solutions Enabler that Harnesses Evolving Technological Innovations.
The group comprises three distinct affiliates that offer a comprehensive range of solutions for the beauty and fragrances industry to include:
Neferti: Channel distribution partner
DTB: Market expansion solutioning
Novela: Premium retailer
Customer-centricity and Warmth are deeply ingrained in the Henatenn DNA. Relationships with partners and customers are highly valued, with many lasting over a decade – one of the key reasons why the company has enjoyed sustainable growth through the years.
Internally, it translates to being an equal opportunity and nurturing organisation. Henatenn invests in its employees, giving them room to be creative, grow and excel, which has resulted in a high-performance team that stands united and collaborative. Everyone is empowered to overcome challenges and celebrating success together has become a part of its culture.
With an established unique supply chain and distribution system that solidified over the years through continual innovation and customer interaction, the group has seen revenues exceed SGD 200 million annually.
In the last decade, the group has successfully planted its footprint outside its Singapore headquarters, Henatenn is on-track to achieving its dream of global omni-presence.
Data Administrator (Data Analyst Support)
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Data Administrator to support our Data Analyst team. This role requires excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to communicate proficiently in Mandarin and English. The ideal candidate will assist in managing data records, supporting reporting processes, and performing general administrative tasks.
Key Responsibilities
Assist the Data Analyst team in organizing, collating, and maintaining data records.
Perform accurate data entry, data cleaning, and basic data validation tasks.
Support the preparation of reports, data summaries, and presentations using Microsoft Excel (basic formulas, sorting, filtering) on stocks turnover (DIO)
Coordinate team schedules, meetings, and communication with internal and external parties in Mandarin and English due to business focus markets.
Manage administrative documentation and maintain filing systems for data-related projects.
Proactively learn and adapt to new tools, systems, and data management processes.
Other Ad-Hoc duties
Requirements
Experience in data collating and data entry
Language Proficiency: Fluent in Mandarin and English, due to business focus in key markets.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (basic formulas, data organization).
Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and organizational skills.
Good communication and interpersonal abilities.
Positive, willing-to-learn attitude with the ability to quickly pick up new skills.
Ability to multi-task and support a fast-paced, data-driven team.
Experience in data collating and data entry
Preferred: Diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Nice to Have
Experience with BC (Business Central) systems.
What We Offer
A collaborative and growth-driven work culture.
Opportunities to work directly with business leaders across multiple industries.
Exposure to digital transformation projects and process automation.

Title: Product Data Analyst, Shop Chatbot & AI Chat
Description:
The Product Management team at Shopee is the key focal point between the business, engineering and design teams. The team is responsible for implementing strategy, road maps and features, while adhering to business goals. It covers all functions including but not limited to Financial Services, Supply Chain, Search, Recommendation, Advertising, Order, Promotion, User, Anti-Fraud, Seller Service. Join us to own a product that is impacting millions of lives in Southeast Asia and Taiwan.
Job Description:
Collect, clean, and analyze chatbot interaction and user behavior data to identify key trends and business issues
Design and maintain dashboards and reports to support product, operations, and engineering teams
Monitor key performance metrics (e.g., intent recognition rate, response time, user satisfaction) and provide actionable insights
Collaborate with data scientists, product managers, and engineers to support business decisions and product improvements
Contribute to model evaluation and A/B test analysis, generating insights for continuous system optimization
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or above in any discipline; majors in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related fields are preferred
Proficient in SQL and comfortable working with large datasets
Familiarity with Python, R, or other data analysis tools is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) is an advantage
Strong analytical thinking, communication skills, and team spirit
Passion or interest in chatbot products, AI technologies, or natural language processing is a plus

Title: Data Engineering and Analytics Intern (Aug 2025 to Dec 2025)
Description:
Roles and Responsibilities
·Assist Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Data Analysts in building and managing data products, including the SISTIC Data Warehouse/Data Lake, as well as data analysis and visualisation
·Contribute to data-pipeline development by assisting with testing, documentation and maintenance
·Identify and troubleshoot issues in existing data pipelines to support continuous improvement
·Work on smaller components of end-to-end pipelines, gaining hands-on exposure to ingestion, cleaning, transformation and loading processes
·Write clean, well-documented code following established best practices
·Identify patterns or insights in sales and patron data and create reports, visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Excel, Google Sheets, and BI dashboards (Apache Superset)
·Support ad-hoc data requests from different departments
Skills and Experience Required
·Currently pursuing a degree or diploma in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, Computer Science, etc.) or have equivalent project experience
·Proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation and pipeline development and maintenance
·Demonstrated interest in core data-engineering concepts, including ETL processes and data-storage solutions (data warehouses and data lakes); familiarity with Google Cloud Platform is a plus; Basic understanding of database principles is a plus
·Demonstrated interest in data analysis and related concepts such as data cleaning, visualization and business insights
·Basic Excel (functions such as VLookUp, Countif, etc.) and PowerPoint skills

Title: College Intern - Data Analytics in Supply Chain
Description:
Assist in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help inform business decisions.
Key responsibilities include cleaning and organizing data, creating reports, performing statistical analysis, and supporting data visualization efforts.
You will collaborate with team members to identify trends and patterns and contribute to improving data-driven processes.
This is an excellent opportunity for hands-on experience in data analytics.

Individuals who do well in this role at HP, usually possess:
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related discipline.
Ideal candidates should have a basic understanding of data analysis techniques, proficiency in Excel or similar tools, and a strong willingness to learn.
Collaborative spirit with a growth & innovative mindset. 
Strong communication, presentation & interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills. 
Experience using data visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI.
Able to commit for a 5-6 months full-time internship, starting in January 2026.

Title: AssocIate Data Science Analyst - Programme Evaluation (MOH Planning)
Requirements: Requirements | Graduate/Postgraduate degree in a quantitative discipline: Health Services Research, Economics, Health Economics, Statistics/Biostatistics/Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Public Health, Public Policy, or related qualifications, or relevant work experience |
Description:
Company description:

Synapxe is the national HealthTech agency inspiring tomorrow's health. The nexus of HealthTech, we connect people and systems to power a healthier Singapore.

Together with partners, we create intelligent technological solutions to improve the health of millions of people every day, everywhere. Reimagine the future of health together with us at www.synapxe.sg


Job description:

Position Overview
The role is part of a Programme Evaluation team who drives programme evaluation efforts across MOH-Family. The incumbent will be using statistical techniques to evaluate programmes/policies or conduct developmental analytics to improve implementation, and derive insights from administrative databases, surveys, and public information to support policy decisions. The role will need to work with data and displays willingness to learn. The role will need to adopt an analytical approach to solving problems and displays confidence when communicating ideas. This role will need to lead important projects and collaborates with policy stakeholders to understand the context and refine the analyses.
Role & Responsibilities
Drive programme evaluation efforts across MOH-Family
Build programme monitoring and evaluation capabilities among MOH officers
Plan resources that are needed to conduct various programme evaluations
Centralise programme evaluation functions across all MOH divisions
Plan, undertake, and communicate evaluations of MOH-family programmes and policies
Work with policy divisions and stakeholders to design and evaluate health programmes using the most suitable methods (qualitative/quantitative studies, experimental/quasi-experimental designs)
Conduct pre-, during-, and post-implementation monitoring and evaluation of major healthcare programmes for process, outcome, and economic evaluations, and impact assessment
Interpret and communicate findings in light of policy decisions/context
Develop action plans to drive process improvement, refine programme delivery, and provide evidence for decision-making to achieve the programme's intended outcomes
Work with stakeholders and use evaluation results to drive process improvement and decision-making
Develop and implement the MOH-Family Programme Evaluation Framework
Develop and implement a systematic structure of Programme Evaluation framework which can be consistently applied to various health programmes and other expenditure types
Provide training for MOH divisions to conduct programme evaluations
Requirements
Graduate/Postgraduate degree in a quantitative discipline: Health Services Research, Economics, Health Economics, Statistics/Biostatistics/Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Public Health, Public Policy, or related qualifications, or relevant work experience
2+ years relevant working experience is a plus, especially in conducting evaluations and/or analysis in healthcare, government, or IT sectors
Possess a wide range of analytical skills and evaluation methods. Familiarity with both qualitative and quantitative study designs will be an advantage
Good stakeholder engagement, communication, and presentation skills
Apply Now
NOTE: It only takes a few minutes to apply for a meaningful career in HealthTech - GO FOR IT!!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Company: HTC Global Services MSC Sdn Bhd
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain machine learning models, APIs, and automation scripts using Python and shell scripting (Linux).
Support deployment and integration of AI pipelines in hybrid environments (cloud and on-premises), primarily using AWS.
Containerize and deploy ML models using Docker and Kubernetes/OpenShift.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate AI prototypes into production-ready applications.
Contribute to CI/CD pipelines for model deployment, monitoring, and updates.
Apply basic data and network security principles in ML system integration.
Assist in integrating ML services with existing microservice architectures using RESTful APIs.
Participate in performance tuning, bug fixes, and version control best practices.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
4+ years of hands-on experience in Machine Learning engineering or AI model integration.
Proficiency in Python for scripting and ML development.
Strong experience with Linux shell scripting and command-line tools.
Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, OpenShift, Kubernetes).
Familiarity with cloud platforms, especially AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, IAM).
Understanding of CI/CD practices and tools like Jenkins or GitHub Actions.
Exposure to observability tools like Grafana or OpenTelemetry is a plus.
Working knowledge of Generative AI, prompt engineering, or RAG pipelines is preferred.
Good to Have:
Knowledge of MLOps workflows (e.g., MLflow, DVC).
Familiarity with microservices architecture and API development using Flask or FastAPI.
Experience with data security compliance or monitoring/logging tools such as Splunk

Title: Machine Learning / AI Engineer
Description:
Company description:

Changi Airport Group (CAG) is the manager of Singapore Changi Airport, a leading air hub in Asia and one of the world's most awarded airports. As airport manager, CAG performs the key functions of airport operations, air hub development, retail and commercial activities, infrastructure development and airport emergency services. CAG also manages Seletar Airport, and through its subsidiary, Changi Airports International, it takes Changi's presence beyond Singapore's shores through consultancy projects and investments in foreign airports. Come join us today!

Job description:

About the Role
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning / AI Engineer to design, develop, and fine-tune AI models for a range of advanced applications, including video analytics, object recognition and detection, fraud detection, and multimodal generative AI leveraging large language models (LLMs). You will work at the intersection of deep learning, computer vision, and natural language processing, driving innovation and ensuring our models deliver high accuracy and efficiency for real-world deployments.
Key Responsibilities
Model Selection & Optimization: Identify, experiment with, and fine-tune state-of-the-art machine learning models for tasks such as video analytics, object recognition/detection, fraud detection, and multimodal generative AI.
Deep Learning & LLMs: Work with transformer architectures, foundation models, and generative AI to develop and enhance multimodal AI solutions.
Computer Vision: Develop and optimize models for real-time object detection, tracking, and recognition in video streams, ensuring performance in diverse conditions.
Fraud Detection and other anomaly detection: Design and implement machine learning models for anomaly detection and fraud prevention using advanced statistical and AI techniques.
Data Engineering & Processing: Preprocess large datasets, design efficient pipelines for real-time and batch processing, and integrate multimodal data sources (images, text, audio, video).
Deployment & Scalability: Deploy models in production using cloud-based or edge computing solutions, ensuring performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.
Research & Innovation: Stay updated on the latest AI research, evaluate emerging models, and propose enhancements to improve performance and robustness.
Collaboration & Integration: Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and domain experts to integrate AI models into end-user applications.
Requirements
Technical Skills:
Strong experience in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX.
Proficiency in computer vision techniques, including object detection (YOLO, Faster R-CNN), video analytics, and multimodal learning.
Hands-on experience with LLMs, transformers (GPT, BERT, T5, CLIP, etc.), and multimodal AI for text, image, and video synthesis.
Experience in fraud detection and/or anomaly detection using machine learning, pattern recognition, and risk modeling.
Experience in AWS SageMaker for model training and deployment preferred.
Familiarity with MLOps and deployment on cloud platforms (AWS and/or GCP preferred) or edge devices.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking abilities.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, research-driven environment and adapt to evolving challenges.
Excellent communication skills for presenting findings and collaborating across teams.
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced Degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
5 to 7 years of relevant experience.
Experience working with autonomous systems, robotics, or edge AI is a plus.

Title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer
Company: HTC Global Services MSC Sdn Bhd
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the end-to-end design and deployment of AI/ML solutions in cloud-native and hybrid environments (AWS, OpenShift).
Architect and integrate Generative AI (e.g., LLMs, RAG pipelines) and Agentic AI components into enterprise systems.
Oversee development of automation scripts (Python, Shell) for workflow orchestration, deployment, and monitoring.
Define and enforce best practices for MLOps, CI/CD pipelines, model versioning, testing, and release.
Collaborate with security and infra teams to implement network security protocols and ensure compliance.
Integrate ML systems with microservices-based architectures using REST APIs, message queues, and event-driven patterns.
Drive performance optimization, observability, and monitoring using tools like Grafana, Splunk, OpenTelemetry, Langfuse, etc.
Provide technical leadership and mentoring to junior engineers and data scientists.
Translate business problems into AI solutions and communicate technical approaches to stakeholders.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
7+ years of experience in Machine Learning engineering, with a strong track record of production deployment.
Proficient in Python for ML and automation; strong Bash/Linux scripting skills.
Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift.
Deep familiarity with AWS cloud services (EC2, S3, Lambda, IAM, Secrets Manager, etc.).
Proven experience deploying LLMs, transformers, and implementing RAG pipelines and prompt engineering.
Strong grasp of CI/CD, container security, and cloud integration strategies.
Familiarity with observability frameworks (Langfuse, Grafana, Elastic Stack, OpenTelemetry).
Exposure to workflow orchestrators (e.g., Ctrl-M) and monitoring tools (e.g., Splunk, Geneos).
Strong communication skills and ability to influence cross-functional teams.
Nice to Have:
Experience with LangChain, Hugging Face, MLflow, DVC, or other GenAI and MLOps frameworks.
Prior experience integrating AI with edge devices or in multi-agent system design.
Exposure to regulated environments (e.g., banking, healthcare) and data privacy compliance.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Requirements: Requirements | Solid understanding of MLOps practices, testing strategies, and production ML requirements. | Preferred Qualifications |
Description:
We are seeking a hands-on Machine Learning Engineer with deep experience in the AWS ecosystem to join our Data & AI team. You will be responsible for building, deploying, and scaling ML systems, working across the full model lifecycle—from experimentation and data processing to deployment, monitoring, and optimization.
The ideal candidate is an engineer who blends ML expertise with strong DevOps and software engineering practices, enabling automation, reproducibility, and continuous delivery of AI/ML solutions in a production environment.
ML Pipeline Development
Design, build, and maintain scalable end-to-end ML pipelines using AWS services such as SageMaker, Glue, Lambda, Step Functions, S3, and EventBridge.
Model Lifecycle Management
Automate model training, hyperparameter tuning, deployment, and monitoring for production workloads using SageMaker Pipelines or custom workflows.
Model Development & Testing
Work with data scientists to operationalize models and implement automated unit, integration, and regression testing frameworks to validate performance and robustness before deployment.
Feature Engineering & Data Pipelines
Develop reusable and scalable feature pipelines in collaboration with data engineers, integrating with feature stores and real-time/batch data sources such as Kinesis, Redshift, and Glue.
Model Deployment & Monitoring
Deploy models for real-time and batch inference using SageMaker endpoints, Batch Transform, and monitor for latency, drift, and performance degradation using tools such as CloudWatch and Prometheus.
Continuous Integration & Testing
Integrate automated tests and validation checks into CICD pipelines using CodePipeline, GitHub Actions, or other orchestration tools to ensure quality and repeatability in model updates.
Configuration Management
Manage version control of models, datasets, infrastructure, and code using tools like Git, SageMaker Model Registry, and infrastructure-as-code frameworks such as CDK, Terraform, or CloudFormation.
Performance Optimization
Optimize model inference speed, resource usage, and deployment cost through profiling, batching, autoscaling, and fine-tuning.
Collaboration & Productionization
Work closely with data scientists to convert notebooks, prototypes, and POCs into robust, maintainable, and scalable production applications.
Documentation & Governance
Ensure thorough documentation, traceability, and adherence to AI governance, data privacy, and ML ethics standards throughout the development lifecycle.
Requirements
At least 5 years of experience as an ML Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or equivalent.
Strong proficiency in Python and ML frameworks such as Scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.
Proven experience with AWS ML services, including SageMaker, Glue, Lambda, Step Functions, S3, and CloudWatch.
Familiarity with CI/CD and test automation tools (e.g., PyTest, Unittest, GitHub Actions, CodePipeline).
Experience with infrastructure-as-code, versioning, and model registries.
Solid understanding of MLOps practices, testing strategies, and production ML requirements.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Engineering, or related field.
Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with Generative AI, LLM deployment, or RAG pipelines using AWS Bedrock, LangChain, or open-source LLMs.
Experience with vector databases (e.g., FAISS, OpenSearch), feature stores, and model explainability tools.
AWS certification (e.g., ML – Specialty, Solutions Architect, or DevOps Engineer) is a plus

Title: Data Science Analyst - ML and Deep Learning (Data Analytics & AI)
Description:
Company description:

Synapxe is the national HealthTech agency inspiring tomorrow's health. The nexus of HealthTech, we connect people and systems to power a healthier Singapore.

Together with partners, we create intelligent technological solutions to improve the health of millions of people every day, everywhere. Reimagine the future of health together with us at www.synapxe.sg


Job description:

Position Overview
This is a Data Science Analyst role supporting Healthcare Analytics workstreams
We are expanding our strong data science team and are looking for talented AI practitioner with applied experience in the fields of Machine Learning and Deep learning to join us. This role is best suited for candidate that is interested in developing new AI application that has a direct and immense, real-world healthcare impact.
You need to have a deep passion for analyzing and resolving healthcare problems. You display an intellectual curiosity about the business needs as well as the capability to engage with stakeholders to understand business issues.
Role & Responsibilities
Analyze data, Scope out problem definition and hypothesis for analysis for image/signal data (such as EEG, ECG) related use case
Responsible for image analysis, synthesis and other aspects of algorithm development, including visual recognition, object detection, segmentation and signal data pattern recognition etc
Responsible for the exploration of cutting-edge technology in image/signal data related algorithms and ensure the technologies get successfully applied
Design experiments to test data assumptions
Evaluate experiment outcomes to draw actionable conclusions
Deploy data models across different channels and customer platforms
Partner with stakeholders to translate business problems into data science projects
Develop strategies to identify, acquire and use appropriate data sets to develop practical solutions and support decision making
Maintain an advanced knowledge of trends affecting the industry
Synthesize findings into actionable insights
Apply data analysis, data mining and data processing to present data clearly
Provide rationale, business cases and ROI models to support investment
Requirements
PhD or Masters in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology, Physics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent
Preferably minimum 3 years of relevant working experience
Solid research and engineering background and experience in computer vision, deep learning, and image/signal data processing/analysis algorithms
Good experience with Python or R is prerequisite
Good experience with Deep learning framework e.g. Tensorflow, keras, Pytorch is prerequisite
Hands on experience in the development of image classification, object detection, segmentation, signal data pattern recognition or related is preferred
Good experience with SQL and/or NoSQL is preferred
Proven communication skill to explain insights from technical work to non-technical audience through presentation or other means
Ability to work independently
Model deployment experience is preferred
Apply Now
NOTE: It only takes a few minutes to apply for a meaningful career in HealthTech - GO FOR IT!!

Title: Lead Machine Learning Integration Engineer
Description:
About The Role 
Bounteous is a premier end-to-end digital transformation consultancy dedicated to partnering with ambitious brands to create digital solutions for today’s complex challenges and tomorrow’s opportunities. With uncompromising standards for technical and domain expertise, we deliver innovative and strategic solutions in Strategy, Analytics, Digital Engineering, Cloud, Data & AI, Experience Design, and Marketing.
One of key Financial Services clients is looking for a Lead Machine Learning Integration Engineer for a position based in Singapore.
Job Description
We seek individuals with highly developed conceptual, strategic, and analytical skills, capable of striking a balance between visionary thinking and practical solutions. The ability to comprehend, inspire, and mobilize others is crucial. A business-oriented mindset coupled with effective storytelling will drive your success. We are looking for self-starters ready to take on responsibilities with enthusiasm.
This Lead ML / Integration Engineer role focuses on building and integrating Generative AI and Agentic AI solutions into enterprise environments. You will work closely with data scientists, architects, and DevOps teams to design, implement, and optimize AI pipelines and infrastructure. 
Key Responsibilities:
Design and implement scalable ML pipelines for Generative and Agentic AI applications.
Integrate AI models into production environments using containerized platforms such as OpenShift and Kubernetes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand AI workflows and translate them into robust engineering solutions.
Develop and maintain automation scripts using Linux shell scripting, Python, or other relevant tools.
Ensure seamless deployment and integration of AI services in cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Implement and maintain network security protocols to safeguard AI systems and data pipelines.
Monitor and optimize system performance, reliability, and scalability.
Support CI/CD processes and infrastructure for AI model deployment and updates.
 Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
7+ years of experience in Machine Learning engineering or AI system integration.
Hands-on experience with OpenShift, Docker, Kubernetes.
Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP) is a must-have.
Exposure to data and network security and compliance in AI systems.
Understanding of Generative AI and Agentic AI concepts.
Experience with LLM prompt engineering, or RAG pipelines.
Knowledge of API integration and microservices architecture.
Proficiency in Python used both for ML and automation tasks
Good knowledge of Bash and Unix/Linux command-line toolkit is a must-have.
Knowledge of Workflow Orchestrator, such as Ctrl-M
Knowledge of Logging and Monitoring tools, such as Splunk and Geneos.
Experience with Observability framework, such as Langfuse, Elastic Stack, Grafana, OpenTelemetry.
What's on Offer
Bounteous brings together 5000+ employees spanning North America, APAC, and EMEA, and partnerships with leading technology providers. Through advanced digital engineering, technology solutions, and data-driven digital experiences, we create exceptional and efficient business impact and help our clients win.
Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. Bounteous does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, or any other status protected under state, or local law.

Title: [SG] AI Engineer
Description:
About AI team:
The AI team at Doctor Anywhere (DA) has the responsibility to deliver the value of AI products to the users and patients across the SEA region. The team’s core mission is to innovate through AI that will simplify how health care service is offered to the patients as well as improving the patient journey experience. This team works closely with product managers, software engineers, designers, and relevant business functions to develop a deep understanding of how the products can be developed and delivered.
This role reports directly to the Staff AI Engineer.
 About the role:
We’re seeking an enthusiastic and self-motivated AI Engineer to build a scalable AI/ML system that will impact millions of Doctor Anywhere’s users and patients. You enjoy working in a cross-functional environment, collaborating with product managers, software engineers, designers, data analytics, data engineers, and business stakeholders. What you’ll do in this role:
Design, develop and maintain scalable and resilient AI/ML products, e.g. recommendations system & personalization, chatbot, search, forecasting, etc. You are responsible for end-to-end machine learning product life cycle, i.e. EDA, experimentation, model development, productionisation, evaluation, automation with CI/CD pipeline, and A/B testing.
Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our machine learning products that serve millions of DA users and businesses.
Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide range of challenging health care problems using different analytical, statistical, and machine learning algorithms.
Identify and measure success of machine learning product efforts through goal setting, and monitoring of key metrics to understand trends.
Identify, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the solutions, and drive initiatives through your insights and recommendations.
Develop & conduct best practices in the AI team.
Partner with product, engineering, analytics, business, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute AI initiatives.
Responsible for maintaining the health of uptime SLA of the service.
Requirements:
A Bachelor or Master in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Engineering, etc).
Experience of 1 - 3 years in AI, Machine Learning, Data Science role.
Very good hands-on experience in Python.
Solid knowledge of Machine Learning fundamental i.e. knowledge of models variant and use cases, end-to-end ML lifecycle process, model development, model selection, hyperparameter optimisation, feature engineering, evaluation, etc.
Good hands-on experience in Machine Learning algorithms & libraries like Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, Scikit, Pandas.
Hands-on experience in one or more of the following topics: NLP, recommendation systems, predictive analytics, computer vision, search. 
Good hands-on experience in git, building CI/CD pipelines.
Experience on how to operate docker images in microservice architecture.
Experience in cloud platform GCP or AWS.
Have a growth mindset, self-driven, high motivation & curiosity to learn.
Experience delivering and driving action based on data-driven insights.
Have analytical skills and proven experience working with complex & large data. 
Self-driven & team player, good communication skills.
Have experience in GenAI/LLM.

Nice To Have:
Experience in MLOps platform e.g. MLflow, or Kubeflow.
The ability to communicate results clearly and a focus on driving impact.
Track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, and delivering results.
Hands-on experience in SQL.
About Doctor Anywhere:
Doctor Anywhere (DA) is on a mission to be the largest tech-enabled, omnichannel healthcare provider in Southeast Asia. First launched in Singapore in 2017, DA aims to bridge gaps in the healthcare ecosystem through developing innovative solutions and technologies. In 2021, DA raised SGD$88 million in Series C fundraising (August 2021) and acquired Doctor Raksa, the biggest telemedicine platform in Thailand which further strengthened our foundation for telehealth and healthcare offerings. Today, DA is present in Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam, Indonesia and India, serving more than 2.5 million (and growing) users across the region.
At DA, we believe in the value of innovation and collaboration. Grounded in our motto of “Keep Going, Keep Growing”, our team strives towards excellence every day, and values diversity in perspectives brought by every member. Together, we bring quality healthcare to your doorstep!
 Not for you? We have other opportunities that may interest you or someone you know. Feel free to visit us at our careers page - https://doctoranywhere.com/job-listing/ for more information.

Title: Data Scientist (CV/Gen AI)
Company: Manpower Staffing Services (S) Pte Ltd - Head Office
Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Conduct research on computer vision, deep learning and AI problems
Build prototype applications in various AI domains such as computer vision, self-supervised learning, multi-modality learning, etc.
Work closely with a team of scientists and researchers to concept and iterate on software development
Develop and deploy data science prototypes, with a focus on bringing machine learning models into production
Design and implement scalable and high-performance machine learning models, with a focus on troubleshooting performance and accuracy issues
Collaborate with technical and non-technical teams locally and overseas, and present proof of concepts to stakeholders effectively
Build data cleaning and augmentation pipelines for both machine learning and deep learning model-based projects
Automate processes and workflows for efficient delivery of data science products via scripting and open source tools
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and deployment techniques
Requirements:
Degree or above in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or Engineering
At least 2 years of relevant experience from work with hands-on project experience in Computer Vision and Generative AI
Expertise in Python programming and using libraries for data processing, visualization, and model development, including pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, and seaborn
Proficient in API concepts and libraries, and experienced in utilizing them for testing and deployment, leveraging frameworks such as Flask, Django, or FastAPI
Familiar with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, Minio) and SQL for data storage and retrieval
Understand HTML/CSS/Javascript and have experience in front-end JavaScript frameworks such as Angular or React to design web interfaces for data science prototypes
Customer oriented and able to establish link between R&D, innovations, and applications in business
Comfortable to work with local and overseas cross-functional teams

Title: Applied Machine Learning/AI Software Engineer
Requirements: Qualifications, Skills & Experience | o   Demonstrated experience in requirement analysis, can transform business problems into ML solutions very |
Description:
About Sembcorp
Sembcorp is a leading energy and urban solutions provider headquartered in Singapore. Led by its purpose to drive energy transition, Sembcorp delivers sustainable energy solutions and urban developments by leveraging its sector expertise and global track record. 

Key Roles & Responsibilities
Innovate and Deploy: Bridge the gap between machine learning (ML) / AI model development and real-world software applications, possessing both ML expertise and full-stack development skills, to work from ideation all the way to deployment.
Optimise and Scale: Leverage on existing latest ML frameworks and AI models, to create optimized, maintainable and scalable code that can be deployed as/or into a product.
Collaborate: Work closely with business stakeholders, software and data engineers, product leads/managers to understand complex business challenges and deliver AI-powered solutions
Quality code production: Write high-quality, well-tested code following best practices and coding standards
 Qualifications, Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of non-internship professional software development experience.
Practical experience in at least one of the following domains: time series forecasting, anomaly detection, search and recommendation systems, feedback control, interpretable machine learning or computer vision.
Applied Machine Learning (ML) Skills:
o   Proficiency in frameworks like PyTorch or Tensorflow
o   Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
o   Experience with LLMs and emerging area of prompt-engineering.
o   Experience deploying ML workloads on Microsoft Azure, Huawei or similar cloud platforms.
o   Good to have experience with agents framework such as Langchain, vector DBs.
o   Familiarity with Azure ML, MLflow, or similar MLOps platforms.
Software Engineering + Cloud Skills:
o   Proficiency in Python; experience with NodeJS is a strong plus.
o   Familiarity with frontend integration workflows (Angular/React, REST APIs). Frontend coding experience with
Angular/React Framework is a plus.
o   Understanding of containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes/AKS).
Soft Skills:
o   Demonstrated experience in requirement analysis, can transform business problems into ML solutions very
well, can communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders clearly
o   Strong communication skills with an ability to explain concepts in simple terms to technical and non-technical
audiences
Our Culture at Sembcorp
At Sembcorp, our culture is shaped by a strong set of shared behaviours that guide the way we work and uphold our commitment to driving the energy transition.  
We foster an institution-first mindset, where the success of Sembcorp takes precedence over individual interests. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do, as we work seamlessly across markets, businesses, and functions to achieve our goals together. Accountability is a core principle, ensuring that we take ownership of our commitments and deliver on them with integrity and excellence. These values define who we are and create a workplace where our people can thrive while making a meaningful impact on driving energy transition. 
Join us in making a real impact!

Title: Scientist - AI/ML/LLM Enhancement of Tools (BII)
Company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Scientist who will support the development and evolution of our genomic platform by integrating cutting edge technologies, including Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), Federated Learning (FL), Synthetic Data Generation, and Large Language Models (LLMs). This role works in close collaboration with the visualization, bioinformatics, and data science teams to optimize how users interact with and derive insights from global pathogen surveillance data.
The candidate will play a key part in identifying opportunities for technological integration, developing prototypes, and translating AI/ML research into practical enhancements across tools, trackers, and reports related to emerging and priority pathogens.
Job Responsibilities:
Develop and implement AI/ML based enhancements for platform tools and trackers, including features for anomaly detection, predictive analytics, and automated data classification.
Assist in the incorporation of LLMs to support natural language interfaces, automated summaries, and smart query functionalities for users.
Support the integration of federated learning and synthetic data techniques to improve privacy preserving analytics and model training.
Collaborate with domain experts to define use cases where AI technologies can augment genomic data visualization, exploration, and reporting.
Prototype and evaluate machine learning models using real world pathogen data, assessing performance, scalability, and interpretability.
Contribute to backend pipelines that power interactive dashboards, ensuring AI features are seamlessly integrated and optimized for real time usage.
Engage with end users to gather feedback on AI driven features and iterate on functionality based on usability insights.
Document model development, deployment workflows, and system behavior for reproducibility and future scaling.
Stay on top of emerging AI/ML technologies and trends in genomics, recommending innovations for future adoption.
Job Requirements:
PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related field with specialization in AI/ML.
Hands on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit learn) and NLP/LLM platforms (e.g., Hugging Face Transformers, OpenAI APIs).
Familiarity with modern AI architectures, including transformers, generative models, and federated learning frameworks.
Demonstrated experience applying AI/ML to biological or public health datasets is highly desirable.
Proficiency in Python and working knowledge of APIs, backend services, and data processing pipelines.
Understanding of bioinformatics data formats and pathogen genome data is a plus.
Ability to translate technical innovations into practical, user facing features with measurable impact.
Strong problem solving skills, independence, and a collaborative approach to interdisciplinary work.
Excellent communication skills for presenting results to technical and non technical audiences.

Title: Data Scientist
Requirements: Conduct data analysis to support Product Owner and Business Leaders in business decisions and requirements | Qualifications | Minimum Bachelor in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science, Information Technology or other equivalent qualifications |
Description:
Game changer, armed with data.
You know all about our users, through data analysis. And because you do, you can identify issues and present insights to our Product Owners, spurring them into action. Working with your team, you play a key role in enhancing our business value. After all, you're the one who ignited the spark. And no spark, no fire.
What a Data Scientist does in Titansoft
Conduct data analysis to support Product Owner and Business Leaders in business decisions and requirements
Develop and automate reports for analytical purposes
Collaborate with other Product Development teams to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations
Support key decision makers to improve products and services
What we are looking for in a Data Scientist
Qualifications
Minimum Bachelor in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science, Information Technology or other equivalent qualifications
Experience
Experience working with statistical software (e.g. R, Python, Excel, etc.) Basic statistical principles and practical applications
Experience in measuring cost and production
Experience in scripting with SQL
Skills
A/B and Multivariate testing management
Data visualization (such as Tableau, Excel, etc)
Ability to translate analysis results into business recommendations and insights
Ability to present the insights clearly to technical and non-technical audiences
Strong written, verbal communication and presentations skills
What makes a (Super!) Data Scientist in Titansoft AKA the "great to haves"
Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends, and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics and program evaluation
What everyone gets in Titansoft (psst. We didn't get that Great Place to Work in 2024 for nothing!)
18 days of rest and relaxation for each year (P.S. It gets even better over the years!)
Competitive salaries and bonuses bench-marked against big players in the industry (Yeap, those companies!)
Flexible working hours (Sleep in a little longer after fixing that pesky bug from last night)
Comprehensive insurance coverage Wellness fund (Fexibilty to use it for medical, dental, EAP or even attraction parks!)
Very well-stocked pantry (We've never heard of the term 'Hunger Games', nope)
Communities of Practice and Workshops catered for your growth and learning
Substantial subsidies and programs to keep that creative flow while having fun (Health promotion program, annual overseas company outing, an annual dinner that nobody will ever forget, etc.)
Hardcore work and hardcore fun!
Working at Titansoft will probably be unlike any other careers you have ever had. Discover why you should join us!
