Title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist (NUS - Office of Data and Intelligence)
Location: National University Of Singapore, Central Region
Requirements: To join the team at the Office of Data and Intelligence at the National University of Singapore (NUS) with the collection, analysis, visualization of data and presentation of analytical results for regular and ad-hoc reporting purposes to meet multiple information and strategic requirements for the various stakeholders of the university. | Requirements | Successful candidate should have the following qualifications and capabilities: | Bachelor degree in Data Analytics, Applied Statistics or Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, but higher qualifications (Master's or PhD) is preferred. |
Description:
Company description:

The National University of Singapore is the national research university of Singapore. Founded in 1905 as the Straits Settlements and Federated Malay States Government Medical School, NUS is the oldest higher education institution in Singapore


Job description:

Job Description
To join the team at the Office of Data and Intelligence at the National University of Singapore (NUS) with the collection, analysis, visualization of data and presentation of analytical results for regular and ad-hoc reporting purposes to meet multiple information and strategic requirements for the various stakeholders of the university.
The successful candidate will join a team of other data analysts and data scientists to engage in the following activities:
Create detailed reports on data sources, methodology, analytical techniques, analytical results and insights for stakeholders.
Develop visualisations and presentations for dissemination of analytical results and derivation of actionable insight.
Assist other units in the university with enhancing their data culture and capabilities.
Develop data repositories and system to enable key stakeholders to access regular reports.
Requirements
Successful candidate should have the following qualifications and capabilities:
Bachelor degree in Data Analytics, Applied Statistics or Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, but higher qualifications (Master's or PhD) is preferred.
Excellent knowledge of at least one of the following scripting/programming languages: Python, R, Java, C++, C#.Net, SQL.
Proficiency in using Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau or Qlik Sense)
Experience in applying machine learning techniques and designing algorithms that are scalable and production-grade.
Knowledge of database, ETL and data API concepts.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills and critical thinking with the ability to articulate ideas with data.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
Covid-19 Message
At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.
Taking into consideration the health and well-being of our staff and students and to better protect everyone in the campus, applicants are strongly encouraged to have themselves fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.
More Information

Organization: National University of Singapore
Department : Office of Data and Intelligence
Employee Referral Eligible:

Title: Information Technology - Data Scientist (Data Science Track)
Description:
Job Description
SIA has multiple positions for junior and senior data scientists to drive our AI, data science and business analytics initiatives.
Key Responsibilities include:
Member of an in-house AI and data science development team that works on AI (including areas in generative AI, autonomous agent, NLP, computer vision and recommender system), mathematical optimization, game theory, and experimental design.
Work closely with business stakeholders to create impactful and intelligent features/services in AI, data science and data analytics. Propose and build scalable ML/DL solutions. Deploy them as API microservices for use by software applications and business users for faster and more effective decision making.
Oversee the technical work of external technology partners and provide them datasets to deliver products/services in AI and data science. Support business users in the assessment/ validation of partner-supplied prediction models and in their deployment to production cloud.
Work closely with application development teams to operationalize and integrate AI/ML capabilities in API microservices.
Note: You could be posted to any subsidiary in SIA Group.
Requirements
BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or related discipline is required. PhD and MS degrees related to machine learning and other AI disciplines are preferred.
Intermediate programming skills in Python. Conversant with algorithm design/analysis, data structure and SQL. Familiarity with functional/object-oriented software development using modern programming languages such as Scala, TypeScript/JavaScript, Java and C# is a plus.
Exposure in the use of workflow/map-reduce and stream processing systems such as Spark and Kafka for big-data processing.
Relevant internship or industry experience as a hands-on data scientist/AI engineer in shallow and/or deep learning (you should be very comfortable with most topics covered in the free undergraduate textbook by Gareth James, “An Introduction to Statistical Learning – with Applications in Python”, 2023). Additional exposure in some of the following areas is a plus:
Use of recent proprietary/open-source LLMs through prompt engineering (such as OpenAI ChatGPT and Bing Chat). Familiarity with LLM application/data frameworks (such as LlamaIndex and LangChain).
Experience of using GPU-accelerated deep learning frameworks (such as PyTorch and TensorFlow).
Familiarity with Bayesian statistics/inference and Bayesian/causal networks for probabilistic reasoning.
Some hands-on experience of AWS, Azure, GCP or other public cloud environment.
Good interpersonal and communication skills for working with both technical staff and non-technical business users.
Experience with Agile/Scrum/Kanban methodologies is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us
99 Group is a leading real estate technology company that operates real estate portals across South East Asia, specializing in digital property advertising. Headquartered in Singapore, it is currently operational in Singapore and Indonesia and employs over 500 employees. In Singapore, 99 Group operates 99.co and SRX.com.sg, while in Indonesia, it operates 99.co/id and Rumah123.
Join Us and Lead the Real Estate Revolution!
We are looking for a junior-level data scientist who is equally comfortable writing SQL queries and ML models as they are stepping into a room with stakeholders to solve business problems. This person will be learning the ropes to be a go-to data consultant for internal teams — from product managers to the CEO — helping them make data-driven decisions, build experiments, and uncover strategic opportunities.
What You'll Be Doing:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to deeply understand problems and design data-backed solutions.
Perform ad hoc analysis, report, A/B test evaluation, and causal inference when needed.
Develop, test, and deploy machine learning models in production (e.g., demand forecasting, pricing models, recommendations etc.).
Generate data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights clearly.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define business problems and translate them into data solutions.
Act as a data partner to stakeholders — translating complex questions into analytical plans, and results into actionable recommendations.
Stay updated on latest tools, techniques, applications and best practices in data science and machine learning.
What We're Looking For:
Strong SQL skill and using Python for software engineering, data wrangling and ML-modelling.
Familiar with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow or other similar ML/DL libraries.
Strong understanding of statistical modeling, hypothesis testing.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills — able to translate data insights into business impact.
Are you ready to shape the future of real estate? Join us in this exciting journey of innovation, collaboration, and growth. Together, let's redefine what's possible in the world of real estate.
Make your mark at 99 Group. Apply now!

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Requirements: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications. | Requirements |
Description:
Job Description: Jnr Data Engineer
As a Jnr Data Engineer you will be working on innovative medium-sized advanced analytics projects onsite in Singapore and virtually with global teams working on offshore projects. The clients range from Singapore Government agencies to innovative start-ups and large offshore clients in Europe and Australia.
AlphaZetta works with the latest cloud and analytics software allowing you to build experience in cutting edge tech. The existing team will provide hands on guidance and support to help you learn.
Work from home (in Singapore) in a flexible working environment
Reports To:
· Project Manager Singapore, AlphaZetta
Key Data Engineer Responsibilities:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Design, develop and maintain data ETL pipelines on cloud platforms to support business analytics and reporting needs.
Assist in data warehouse design and data modeling for source system integration
Troubleshoot and debug issues in production environments.
You will be working on innovative medium-sized advanced analytics 
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Proficiency in analytics tools like Python and SQL.
1 years of work experience with ETL, Data Modelling, and designing, coding, transformation and processing of data sets using Pyspark data build tool and SQL.
Experience in Azure and or AWS cloud services like AWS Lambda, Glue, EC2, S3, Redshift, RDS, Cloudwatch and Step Functions.
Willing and enthusiastic about continuous learning of new technologies and data science & data engineering techniques.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Optional Additional Skills
Experience with Azure Data Factory and dbt (Data Build Tool) will be an added advantage.
Experience with PowerBI also an advantage.

Title: Data Scientist, Neurosurgery Division (Contract)
Requirements: Collaborate with neurosurgeons, clinicians, and IT stakeholders to translate domain requirements into technical implementations. |
Description:
We are seeking a motivated and technically capable Data Scientist to join our Neurosurgery Division. This role is ideal for early-career individuals—including fresh graduates—who are eager to grow in applied AI, data science, and MLOps in a healthcare setting.
You will play a critical role in maintaining and enhancing an AI-based risk stratification tool for detecting neurological deterioration. The model is currently deployed via a Streamlit-based web app and integrated into a production-grade AWS/Kubernetes environment. The role involves hands-on support for ongoing validation studies and exploratory AI/ML initiatives within neurosurgery.
 We welcome entry level graduates with a solid technical foundation and strong interest in clinical AI and MLOps.
 Key Responsibilities
Support the production deployment and maintenance of an AI model in AWS and Kubernetes.
Assist with the validation study of the model, ensuring scientific rigor and clinical relevance.
Conduct exploratory data analysis and modelling to extend the current solution and support new AI/ML research directions.
Learn and apply MLOps practices (e.g., monitoring, deployment, CI/CD pipelines).
Collaborate with neurosurgeons, clinicians, and IT stakeholders to translate domain requirements into technical implementations.
Participate in containerization efforts using Docker and orchestration via Kubernetes.
 What We’re Looking For
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Entry graduates are welcome to apply.
Strong willingness to learn and apply cloud technologies (e.g., AWS), MLOps tools, and production systems.
Proficiency in Python for data science (e.g., Pandas, Scikit-learn) is a must.
Exposure or interest in learning:
Docker and Kubernetes for deployment and orchestration.
AWS services (ECS, SageMaker) for cloud-based application hosting and data science experimentation.
Streamlit or other Python-based web frameworks.
Working with RESTful APIs and structured/unstructured clinical data.
Self-starter mindset with the ability to work independently and as part of a multi-disciplinary team.
Passion for applying AI to real-world clinical problems and improving patient outcomes.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re working with a rapidly growing tech company to hire a Data Scientist to improve how data is managed and leveraged across the business.
What You’ll Do
Lead projects that enhance how teams collect, organize, and use data
Build scalable systems to make internal data processes more efficient
Translate business needs into practical data or automation solutions
Take ownership of data initiatives from planning through continuous improvement
What We’re Looking For
Experience handling large datasets and working with modern analytics tools
Strong attention to detail and clear communication skills
Comfortable writing scripts and querying data
Bonus if you’ve had exposure to machine learning or predictive models
Reach out to Ayla at ayla@nodeflair.com for a confidential discussion.

Title: Data Scientist
Requirements: Job Requirements: | By responding to Yokogawa’s advertisement, consent is considered given to Yokogawa to collect the required personal data for the purpose of recruitment with expectation that Yokogawa will protect personal data with security safeguards that are reasonable and appropriate to the sensitivity of the personal data, to protect it from unauthorized access, use or disclosure and complies with applicable regulatory requirements with respect to the retention of personal data. |
Description:
Job Responsibilities:
• Conduct research on computer vision, deep learning and AI problems 
• Build prototype applications in AI domains such as computer vision, self-supervised learning, multi-modality learning etc 
• Work closely with a team of scientists and researchers to concept and iterate on software development 
• Develop and deploy data science prototypes, with a focus on bringing machine learning models into production 
• Design and implement scalable and high-performance machine learning models, with a focus on troubleshooting performance and accuracy issues 
• Collaborate with technical and non-technical teams locally and overseas, and present proof of concepts to stakeholders effectively
• Build data cleaning and augmentation pipelines for both machine learning and deep learning model-based projects 
• Automate processes and workflows for efficient delivery of data science products via scripting and open-source tools 
• Familiarity with code management and version control systems such as GIT 
• Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and deployment techniques through independent research and open source tools and libraries 
Job Requirements: 
• Degree/Masters/PhD in Engineering or Science with min 3 years of relevant experience with atleast 1 year in Computer Vision Projects
• Experience in real-world data science projects, internships, hackathons, and personal projects 
• Prior experience in Computer Vision related projects is mandatory
• Expertise in Python programming and using libraries for data processing, visualization, and model development, including pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, and seaborn 
• Proficient in API concepts and libraries, and experienced in utilizing them for testing and deployment, leveraging frameworks such as Flask, Django, or FastAPI 
• Familiar with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, Minio) and SQL for data storage and retrieval 
• Understand HTML/CSS/Javascript and have experience in front-end JavaScript frameworks such as Angular or React to design web interfaces for data science prototypes and deploy them. 
• Engineering background experienced in Sensing, Controls, Automation, Optimization & Manufacturing Processes is a plus
• Data Engineering & Analytics 
 By responding to Yokogawa’s advertisement, consent is considered given to Yokogawa to collect the required personal data for the purpose of recruitment with expectation that Yokogawa will protect personal data with security safeguards that are reasonable and appropriate to the sensitivity of the personal data, to protect it from unauthorized access, use or disclosure and complies with applicable regulatory requirements with respect to the retention of personal data.

We will actively recruit, develop, and promote people from a variety of backgrounds who differ in terms of experience, knowledge, thinking styles, perspective, cultural background, and socioeconomic status.  We will not discriminate based on race, skin color, age, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, belief, political opinion, nationality, ethnicity, place of origin, disability, family relations or any other circumstances.  Yokogawa values differences and enables everyone to belong, contribute, succeed, and demonstrate their full potential.

Title: Senior / Analyst, Data Science, Office of DGCMIO (Research)
Company: Singapore Health Services Pte Ltd (SingHealth HQ)
Description:
You will play a critical role in making high-quality, research-ready data available to support translational and AI research through data engineering initiatives such as data cleaning, structuring, and standardisation. You will assist in mapping clinical datasets to standardised frameworks such as the OMOP Common Data Model, implementing Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques for unstructured data processing, and contributing to the de-identification and secure linkage of clinical and operational datasets for multimodal and cross-cohort studies.
You will work with principal engineers to develop and refine de-identification frameworks, assist in securing data linkage, and the automate analytical workflows to support multimodal and cross-cohort research studies. You will use strong analytical skills and collaborate with researchers, data scientists, and IT teams to enhance data usability for AI-driven healthcare research.
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or Health Sciences-related disciplines, with 3-6 years of relevant working experience in data engineering, informatics, or biomedical sciences
Knowledge in SQL, Python, R, data visualisation
Experience with LLM fine tuning and/or RAG is an advantage
Experience in healthcare data engineering, working with EHR/clinical systems and familiarity with clinical terminologies is an advantage
Knowledge in principles of data provisioning and linkages for interdisciplinary intra- and inter-institutional research
Team-driven with strong communication, problem solving and analytical skills
Detail-oriented with a proactive approach to data challenges

Title: Data Scientist (Optimization/OR)
Description:
Major Foreign-Based Manufacturing Organisation in Singapore
Key Data Role in Singapore
Employee-Centric Environment
Our client is one of the world prominent organisation in manufacturing industry with yearly revenue in billion USD. Now, it is now looking to hire an experienced Data Scientist (Optimization/OR) for its regional Data headquarter in Singapore.

Requirements:
PhD or Master’s degree holder in the relevant field with minimum of 2 years of experience in PHD research or work experience with Decision Science, Operation Research, Math Programming and optimization.
Individual with Bachelor’s degree and at least 5-year of relevant experience (ie in the areas of Decision Science, Operation Research, Math Programming and optimization) will be considered.
Domain knowledge in research & development, supply chain, operation planning and/or manufacturing.
Hands-on modelling/coding experience using relevant tools/libraries for Math formulation and/or Optimization
Proficiency in programming language (e.g. Python, Java, R) and database programming (e.g. SQL)
Self-motivated, proactive, independent learner, and willing to share knowledge with broader data analytics team to build learning R&D culture.
Prior work experience in supporting and liaising with peers and supporting business stakeholders in North Asia market especially China.
You MUST BE based in Singapore currently and has relevant work experience in Singapore.
NOTE: Please do attach your latest resume in your submission. We will not be able to process your application without your resume attachment. Please rest assured that your interest will be treated with strictest confidentiality.

Company information

Company UEN:  201733938H
 

Privacy Statement

Data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Personal data provided will be used strictly in accordance with the relevant data protection law and Hudson's personal information and privacy policy =  https://www.hudson.sg/privacy-policy/

Title: College Intern - Data Science
Description:
What a College Intern - Data Science does at HP:
Analyze Customer Feedback and Telemetry Data: Dive into customer feedback and printer telemetry data, with a focus on “WIFI connectivity”, to identify pain points, improve user experience, and drive product performance enhancements.
Perform Competitive Analysis: Data mine and analyse the data to generate actionable insights by comparing product performance, customer satisfaction, and unique features against competitors.
Enable Predictive Analytics: Leverage printer telemetry data to build predictive models that anticipate customer needs and improve product reliability.
Create Visual Dashboards: Design interactive dashboards to monitor trends, highlight key performance metrics, and showcase competitive differentiators.
Individuals who do well in this role at HP, usually possess:
Bachelor/Masters degree in Computer Science/ Data Science.
Able to commit to a 4-6 months full time internship.
Excellent data analysis skill.
Creative thinking.
Proficient Office (Excel/Word/PowerPoint) skill.
Experience in Power BI, Database/SQL, Python (Plus), JMP.
Sustainable impact is HP’s commitment to create positive, lasting change for the planet, its people, and our communities. This serves as a guiding principle for delivering on our corporate vision – to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.
HP is a Human Capital Partner – we commit to human capital development and adopting progressive workplace practices in Singapore.

Title: Manager - Data Analytics & Science (Healthcare) (Perm / Jurong) (672812)
Company: PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd (Formerly Kelly Services Singapore Pte Ltd)
Requirements: Ensure timely generation of regular reports based on established reporting requirements. | Requirements |
Description:
You will be responsible for the following:
Leveraging knowledge and skill with a variety of analytic tools to design, create, maintain powerful visualizations and models that illuminate opportunities to support strategic planning and initiatives, improve organizational performance, project future demand, and advance progress towards population health outcome and impact.
Contribute to the design of end-to-end strategy, approach and methodology for population health data insights, analytics, and evaluation.
Build routine reports and operational monitoring dashboards for essential population health metrics.
Engage and work with the relevant stakeholders level to gather data and provide data to gain both micro and macro insights to aid in strategic planning.
Identify new dataset which are essential in supporting population health program monitoring and evaluation and incorporate as part of the data management strategy and roadmap.
Perform data analysis and trending observations for possible areas for attention when required.
Ensure timely generation of regular reports based on established reporting requirements.
Any other responsibilities as assigned by your supervisor.
 Requirements
Degree from an established university in a related field such as statistics, data science, business analytics, analytics, applied mathematics. Master’s degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Management or Public Health will be an added advantage.
At least 5 years of relevant experience in planning and data analytics environment.
Proficient in working with data in SQL and Excel and creating dashboard using Tableau.
Experience and knowledge of statistical modeling technique.
Proficient in 1 or more of the software such as R, OBIEE, Python, H2O Flow, Flexsim etc.
Proficient in use of Microsoft Office Applications for word processing and presentation.
Interested candidates who wish to apply for the advertised position, please click on “Apply”. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Data Science Director
Description:
Are you the lead data scientist who wants to shape governance and trust at scale for a fast-growing e-commerce platform in Southeast Asia?
Join a leading tech company driving innovation across the Southeast Asian digital commerce landscape. Be part of a mission-critical team ensuring buyer safety, trust, and a high-quality marketplace experience.
What You’ll Do:
• Lead a high-performing data science team focused on governance and experience, fostering a collaborative and insight-driven culture to address regional e-commerce challenges.
• Build data frameworks and move analytics from reactive reporting to proactive insights, influencing marketplace policies and improving buyer journeys across Southeast Asia.
• Collaborate with operations, product, and data engineering teams to enhance data accessibility, improve dashboards, and support strategic decision-making with actionable insights.
• Turn complex data into clear, data-driven strategies that help operations teams strengthen governance processes and drive user satisfaction.
• Grow and mentor a team of data scientists and analysts, ensuring alignment with business goals and building strong cross-functional relationships within the region.
What You’ll Bring:
• At least five years of leadership experience in data science or analytics, preferably within a high-growth tech or e-commerce environment.
• Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R, with experience in large-scale data analysis, A/B testing, and applying machine learning models to real-world problems.
• A master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field such as statistics, computer science, or economics; PhD or MBA is a plus.
• A strong analytical mindset and structured problem-solving approach, with the ability to translate business needs into data solutions.
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively across teams within a diverse, fast-paced Southeast Asian context.
We are an inclusive organisation and actively promote equality of opportunity for all with the right mix of talent, skills, and potential. We welcome all applications from a wide range of candidates. Selection for roles will be based on individual merit alone.

Title: Machine Learning / AI Engineer
Description:
Company description:

Changi Airport Group (CAG) is the manager of Singapore Changi Airport, a leading air hub in Asia and one of the world's most awarded airports. As airport manager, CAG performs the key functions of airport operations, air hub development, retail and commercial activities, infrastructure development and airport emergency services. CAG also manages Seletar Airport, and through its subsidiary, Changi Airports International, it takes Changi's presence beyond Singapore's shores through consultancy projects and investments in foreign airports. Come join us today!

Job description:

About the Role
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning / AI Engineer to design, develop, and fine-tune AI models for a range of advanced applications, including video analytics, object recognition and detection, fraud detection, and multimodal generative AI leveraging large language models (LLMs). You will work at the intersection of deep learning, computer vision, and natural language processing, driving innovation and ensuring our models deliver high accuracy and efficiency for real-world deployments.
Key Responsibilities
Model Selection & Optimization: Identify, experiment with, and fine-tune state-of-the-art machine learning models for tasks such as video analytics, object recognition/detection, fraud detection, and multimodal generative AI.
Deep Learning & LLMs: Work with transformer architectures, foundation models, and generative AI to develop and enhance multimodal AI solutions.
Computer Vision: Develop and optimize models for real-time object detection, tracking, and recognition in video streams, ensuring performance in diverse conditions.
Fraud Detection and other anomaly detection: Design and implement machine learning models for anomaly detection and fraud prevention using advanced statistical and AI techniques.
Data Engineering & Processing: Preprocess large datasets, design efficient pipelines for real-time and batch processing, and integrate multimodal data sources (images, text, audio, video).
Deployment & Scalability: Deploy models in production using cloud-based or edge computing solutions, ensuring performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.
Research & Innovation: Stay updated on the latest AI research, evaluate emerging models, and propose enhancements to improve performance and robustness.
Collaboration & Integration: Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and domain experts to integrate AI models into end-user applications.
Requirements
Technical Skills:
Strong experience in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX.
Proficiency in computer vision techniques, including object detection (YOLO, Faster R-CNN), video analytics, and multimodal learning.
Hands-on experience with LLMs, transformers (GPT, BERT, T5, CLIP, etc.), and multimodal AI for text, image, and video synthesis.
Experience in fraud detection and/or anomaly detection using machine learning, pattern recognition, and risk modeling.
Experience in AWS SageMaker for model training and deployment preferred.
Familiarity with MLOps and deployment on cloud platforms (AWS and/or GCP preferred) or edge devices.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking abilities.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, research-driven environment and adapt to evolving challenges.
Excellent communication skills for presenting findings and collaborating across teams.
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced Degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
5 to 7 years of relevant experience.
Experience working with autonomous systems, robotics, or edge AI is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist/Senior Data Scientist (Business Analytics and Optimization)'
Description:
LOVE WHAT YOU DO? THERE IS A PLACE FOR YOU HERE!
Be part of our diverse and inclusive team.
Job Responsibilities
The team is tasked with developing creative approaches to data sourcing, deriving new variables and factoring in qualitative insights to deliver high-impact business solutions.
Conduct exploratory data analysis and hypothesis testing to uncover hidden patterns and trends in customer behavior.
Lead the development of advanced data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
Leverage customer data and analytics to acquire, develop, and retain high-value customers more profitably and effectively
Develop a robust behavioral and needs-based segmentation to create more relevant, actionable, and personalized campaigns, offers, and engagements 
Closely monitor product and area performance, operational and manpower efficiency
Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and engagement strategies.
Utilize big data technologies and cloud platforms to manage and analyze large datasets, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data science solutions into business processes and decision-making frameworks.
Job Requirements
Education & Certification
Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics or a related field is preferred.
Experience
At least 2 years of hands-on experience in analytics and machine learning or AI.
Proven experience in deploying machine learning models in production environments and monitoring their performance will be an added advantage.
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL, with experience in using libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Experience in big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Other Prerequisites
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work with complex datasets to derive actionable insights.
Marina Bay Sands is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, providing equal opportunities as we grow our talent base to match our growth ambitions in Singapore. Our employees are committed to adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures, including the rules of conduct and business ethics of the Company.

Job Description
Role Responsibilities:
Provide professional technical support to the developed software program and other activities arising from operational requirements.
Work closely with helpdesk frontliners to identify, troubleshoot and provide solutions for issues reported.
Work with the team to ensure that the system meets operational expectations, quality standards and within schedule.
To accommodate customer’s operational needs, there will sometimes be work outside of regular business hours, such as nights or weekends.
Assist the team with documentation and reporting requirements as required by the project.

Preferably 1-2 years of hands-on working experience in environments with Linux/RHEL, SQL, Cloud/AWS carrying out operations activities.
Strong communication skills, able to transmit information in a clear and unambiguous way.
Problem-solving skills with out of the box thinking.
A team-player who can take initiative.
Have the skills and resilience to handle situations and deliver results on time.
Ability to work independently with minimum supervision.

Title: Junior Field Application Engineer (Robotics)
Description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a proactive and hands-on Junior Field Application Engineer to join our Humanoid Robot Deployment team. In this role, you will play a vital part in the deployment, testing, and on-site support of our advanced robotic systems. While a strong foundation in software is essential, the primary focus will be on evaluating robot performance in real-world scenarios, identifying and resolving technical issues, and ensuring smooth system integration and operation.
This is an ideal opportunity for a technically inclined problem-solver who enjoys bridging the gap between cutting-edge development and practical application in the robotics field.
Key Responsibilities:
• Robot Deployment & Field Support
Deploy, configure, and maintain humanoid robots in both test environments and live field locations.
• Troubleshooting & Debugging
Identify and resolve software, hardware, and communication issues through hands-on diagnosis, log analysis, and software patching.
• Performance Monitoring & Data Collection
Utilize diagnostic tools to monitor robot behavior, collect operational data, and provide actionable insights to the development team.
• Scripting & Tooling Support
Write and maintain Python scripts and lightweight tools to streamline robot configuration, testing, and diagnostics.
• Field Feedback & Reporting
Deliver clear, structured feedback and documentation based on field observations to help enhance product design and reliability.
• Cross-functional Collaboration
Collaborate with software engineers, hardware teams, and robotics experts to validate functionality and system integration.
• Training & Internal Support (Optional)
Provide basic operational training and troubleshooting guidance to internal users or customers, if needed.
Requirements:
Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Automation, Mechatronics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Able to communicate effectively in Mandarin for collaboration with Chinese development teams.
Fresh graduates are welcome – no prior work experience required.
Strong working knowledge of Linux systems and command-line utilities.
Proficient in Python scripting; exposure to C++ is a plus, particularly for debugging purposes.
Basic understanding of computer networking and hardware-software interaction.
Familiar with version control systems such as Git or GitHub.
Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills; able to diagnose complex issues with minimal supervision.
Self-motivated team player with strong communication and task management abilities.
Willingness to travel to deployment sites (local or regional, as applicable).
Bonus (Nice to Have):
Hands-on experience in robotics projects (academic, personal, or internships).
Familiarity with diagnostic/logging tools or remote monitoring systems.
Exposure to remote access tools, data logging, or web interfaces for robot management.

Title: Research Engineer (AI Model Evaluation), IHPC
Company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
Requirements: The Centre for Advanced Technologies in Online Safety (CATOS; https://www.catos.sg) was established in 2023 to host Singapore's Online Trust and Safety (OTS) Programme, a national research programme that leads the advancement of whole-of-nation technology capabilities to monitor and tackle online harms. The Systems Engineering Pillar of CATOS focuses on translational research and development, including evaluating, testing and integrating research output into needle-moving applications. One of the major outcomes will be a technological platform with an integrated suite of deep tech OTS engines, which analyses various internet sites and platforms for fast-trending harmful online content, such as non-factual claims, deepfakes, and hateful and toxic content. Different combinations of OTS engines can then be integrated and adapted to address the specific requirements of various stakeholders. | Collaborate with senior team members, stakeholders and cross-functional teams to incorporate requirements that arise from the evolving landscape. | JOB REQUIREMENT: |
Description:
The Centre for Advanced Technologies in Online Safety (CATOS; https://www.catos.sg) was established in 2023 to host Singapore's Online Trust and Safety (OTS) Programme, a national research programme that leads the advancement of whole-of-nation technology capabilities to monitor and tackle online harms. The Systems Engineering Pillar of CATOS focuses on translational research and development, including evaluating, testing and integrating research output into needle-moving applications. One of the major outcomes will be a technological platform with an integrated suite of deep tech OTS engines, which analyses various internet sites and platforms for fast-trending harmful online content, such as non-factual claims, deepfakes, and hateful and toxic content. Different combinations of OTS engines can then be integrated and adapted to address the specific requirements of various stakeholders. 
This role will be responsible for systematically evaluating AI models and datasets to understand the strengths and weaknesses of existing tools in this field and identify ways to adapt promising tools to their intended applications. The work will create valuable knowledge to inform end-users and technology researchers, helping to ensure that the technologies from CATOS and its partners are of desirable performance and robustness for the intended use cases and applications.

The candidate will assume the following roles and responsibilities:
As a Research Engineer, contribute to the evaluation of emerging technologies and data underneath the technologies.
Collaborate with senior team members, stakeholders and cross-functional teams to incorporate requirements that arise from the evolving landscape.
Contribute to key CATOS events that are aimed at engaging the research, industry, government agencies, NGOs and the general public
JOB REQUIREMENT:
A Bachelor / Master degree in Computer Science / Information Technology / Computer Engineering / Information Systems / Data Engineering / Computational Social Science or equivalent.
Demonstratable experience in using machine learning / deep learning frameworks and models.
Proficient with programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, C/C++, MATLAB) and tools. (e.g., Jupyter Notebook, VS Code)
Ability to quickly develop and iterate on prototypes.
Experience in using (Multi-Modal) Large Language Models is valued.
Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment.
Candidates with no experience may apply.
Our research and engineering work is highly interdisciplinary, agile, and pragmatic in nature.  
We expect everyone to take ownership of their role, responsibilities, and tasks.
We encourage everyone to speak up when they have feedback or ideas for improvement.
We provide honest feedback to one another, which can be tough at times, but it fosters rapid learning.
We care about each other's professional growth and well-being.
When applying, please share at least two representative research projects or publications that you have developed independently or contributed to significantly.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Research Assistant (Computer Engineering/Computer Science/Electronics...
Requirements: Job Requirements: | Possess relevant working experience and qualifications |
Description:
Young and research-intensive, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) is ranked among the world’s top universities. NTU’s College of Computing and Data Science (CCDS) is a leading college that is known for its excellent curriculum, outstanding and impactful research, and world-renowned faculty. Today, we are ranked #2 for AI and Computer Science by US News Best Global Universities; and #8 for Data Science and AI by QS World University Ranking.
A hot bed of cutting-edge technology and groundbreaking research, the College aims to groom the next generation of leaders, thinkers, and innovators to thrive in the digital age. Located in the heart of Asia, NTU’s College of Computing and Data Science is an ‘exciting place to learn and grow. We welcome you to join our community of faculty, students and alumni who are shaping the future of AI, Data Science and Computing.
Our project is to develop a unified framework to conduct physical adversarial attacks and defences with a novel unified autonomous vehicle scene representation. Our project consists of theoretical fundamental, adversarial attack/defence algorithms, and robustness-oriented understanding methods to enhance the robustness of AV perception models in the physical world.
The College of Computing & Data Science (CCDS) invites applications for the position of Research Assistant.
  Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for research into the different work packages
Responsible for the development of solutions to different work packages
Evaluate the different solutions available
Timely reporting of research finding
Run large data simulation
Procurement of needed hardware
Procurement of software

Possess relevant working experience and qualifications
Strong drive for research and innovation

Possess interpersonal skills with the ability to work with different groups of stakeholders.
Competent in written and oral communication skills

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Job Description: Software Engineer
As a Software Engineer at D-SIMLAB Technologies, you will gain exposure to both technical and soft skills development while working on innovative software solutions for world-leading semiconductor manufacturers. This role extends beyond software development, involving close collaboration with clients and providing professional consultation services to support their operational needs.
Key Responsibilities:
Software Product Deployment and Delivery:
Collaborate with a team of Software Engineers and Data Scientists to ensure smooth deployment and delivery of D-SIMLAB’s software products at semiconductor manufacturing sites. Work with global clients to address their technical needs and deliver high-quality solutions.
Product Enhancement:
Contribute to the continuous improvement of D-SIMLAB’s software, focusing on areas such as data visualization and algorithm optimization to improve product quality and user experience. Actively participate in product development cycles, from conceptualization to implementation.
Key Software Component Development:
Take ownership of the development and maintenance of critical software components, ensuring scalability, performance, and reliability in diverse manufacturing environments.
Client Consultation:
Provide technical expertise and consultation to customers, helping them implement and optimize D-SIMLAB’s software solutions in their manufacturing processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and problem-solving to enhance client satisfaction.
Collaboration and Innovation:
Work in a multicultural and multidisciplinary team, contributing to innovative ideas and technical solutions. Stay updated on the latest technology trends and actively seek ways to improve the efficiency and performance of the software.
Candidate Requirements:
Education:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
Diploma holders with relevant experience are encouraged to apply.
Work Experience:
Minimum 3 years working experience in a related role.
Technical Skills:
Strong skills in C#, .NET, SQL.
Familiarity with software development life cycles, agile methodologies, and version control systems.
Experience with algorithms, data structures, and software architecture design.
Experience with visualization frameworks and tools is an advantage.
Soft Skills:
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and teams from different technical and cultural backgrounds.
Adaptability and Willingness to Travel:
Willingness to travel internationally and work on challenging projects at semiconductor manufacturing sites. Ability to adapt quickly to new environments and work under pressure to meet project deadlines.
Career Growth:
Interest in personal and professional growth by enhancing both technical and soft skills. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
 Please ensure your profile on the portal is updated with your job experience and education as these fields are being used for the purpose of filtering and shortlisting.

Title: Software Engineer
Requirements: We are seeking a skilled and motivated Software Engineer with strong expertise in C# and .NET technologies to join our development team. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications that are scalable, secure, and high-performing. The role also involves direct communication with end users to gather requirements, provide support, and ensure software meets business needs. | Communicate with end users to understand requirements, gather feedback, and provide support. | Required Qualifications: | Ability to communicate effectively with end users to gather requirements and provide support. |
Description:
Job Summary:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Software Engineer with strong expertise in C# and .NET technologies to join our development team. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications that are scalable, secure, and high-performing. The role also involves direct communication with end users to gather requirements, provide support, and ensure software meets business needs.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, test, and deploy applications using C# and .NET (Core or Framework).
Work on backend logic, APIs, and integration with third-party services.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices and design patterns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including UI/UX designers and product managers.
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback.
Troubleshoot and resolve bugs, performance bottlenecks, and production issues.
Communicate with end users to understand requirements, gather feedback, and provide support.
Contribute to technical documentation and maintain project-related documentation.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of hands-on experience with C# and .NET (Core or Framework).
Experience in building RESTful APIs and microservices.
Strong understanding of OOP and design patterns.
Experience with Entity Framework , LINQ, and SQL Server or other relational databases.
Proficient in using tools such as Visual Studio, Git, Postman, and Azure DevOps.
Experience with unit testing and test-driven development (TDD).
Ability to communicate effectively with end users to gather requirements and provide support.
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and manage tasks with minimal supervision.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies.
Customer-oriented mindset with the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Preferred Skills (Nice to Have):
Knowledge of front-end frameworks like Angular, React, or Blazor.
Experience with Azure or other cloud platforms.
Familiarity with containerization tools like Docker.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.

Description:

heb.org.sg

Race Course Road, Farrer Park MRT Station (NE8), Singapore
Address
250 Race Course Rd, B1-02, Singapore 218703
Map
Allowance / Remuneration
$400 - 2,000 monthly
Company Profile
Hindu Endowments Board (HEB) is a statutory body set up under the Hindu Endowments Act in 1968. The Minister for Culture, Community and Youth appoints prominent figures from the public and private sectors of the Indian community as Board members. HEB’s primary function is to operate four Hindu endowments placed under its administration. These endowments include the Sri Mariamman Temple, Sri Srinivasa Perumal Temple, Sri Sivan Temple and Sri Vairavimada Kaliamman Temple. In addition to managing temples, HEB is involved in numerous initiatives that benefit the community. HEB’s broad based community service includes the administration of HEB-Ashram, a halfway house of IPC status to rehabilitate substance abusers. ‘Gift from the Heart’ a programme that provides disadvantaged families with free monthly food rations is offered through HEB-Ashram. In 2011, HEB started the HEB-Sivadas Education Fund – a financial assistance initiative that offers two different support schemes – one targeting pre-schoolers and the other meant for tertiary students (includes those attending polytechnics and ITEs). The scheme provides bursaries and grants to ensure that Hindu children are not deprived of a good education. Another education assistance scheme, the Rama Arunachalam and AR Mangayarkarasi Achi Fund, was set up to assist dyslexic children. Other major missions of HEB are the cultivation of values and morals in children through its Project Bhakti programme, and the promotion of health and wellness in the community. Such activities have elevated HEB to an active social organisation that cares for and caters to the secular as well as religious needs of Hindus. HEB actively supports interfaith activities and is a member of the Inter-Religious Organisation, Singapore. While HEB’s mission is to meet the spiritual and welfare needs of the Hindu community, its vision is to foster greater understanding and harmony amongst religions.
Job Description
Scope of Work. The specific areas that need to be addressed are:
Test Planning & Documentation: Developing and maintaining test plans, scenarios, and cases; recording test results; documenting defects.
Test Execution: Performing manual functional and system integrated testing for key systems like Online Booking (Mass events), Facility Management Systems, and conducting UI/UX validation across browsers. This includes testing integrations with Email, QR Code, SMS/WhatsApp, Printing, Payment Gateway, and A2000.
Defects Logging and Tracking: Logging and tracking defects in JIRA/Excel, assigning severity, following up on fixes, and monitoring defect ageing.
Collaboration & Communication: Working with the IT team and vendors, raising concerns, contributing to testing process improvements, and providing daily/weekly status reports.
Critical skills identified for this role that are foundational for software testing support: basic testing knowledge, analytical/problem-solving abilities, eagerness to learn, attention to detail, proficiency in Microsoft Office suites, clear written and verbal communication, teamwork, and Object-Oriented Programming knowledge. Desirable skills include familiarity with test management tools, understanding of software platforms, bug reporting/tracking knowledge, vendor/stakeholder communication, and understanding of Test methodology.
Application Instructions
Please apply for this position by submitting your text CV using InternSG.
Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Apply for this position

Title: Software Engineer
Requirements: Analyzing user requirements and translating them into technical specifications | Skills & Qualifications: |
Description:
Your Compass in the Health & Fitness Journey
Total Shape is a community dedicated to making the pursuit of a healthier lifestyle both achievable and straightforward. At Total Shape, we pride ourselves on delivering comprehensive information tailored to your health and fitness journey. Our mission is to help you make informed decisions that expedite your path to your health and fitness goals.
Since 2003, our dedicated team has worked hard to create an exhaustive library of thorough and reliable information. Our team of 60+ team of writers, special contributors, fact checkers and medical reviewers are health and fitness experts, including registered dietitians, nutritionists, board accredited medical doctors, certified personal trainers, qualified coaches, and professional athletes who write, fact check, review and constantly update our collection of 2,000+ articles.
The Role
Job Description
We’re offering a competitive salary of $15,000 to $18,500 a month for our next Software Engineer!
Total Shape is looking for that awesome someone to design, develop, test and deploy software solutions that meet the needs of our business and customers. You will be working with the latest technologies and collaborating with cross-functional groups to deliver quality products and services. 
Benefits:
  • Health Insurance
  • Performance bonus
  • Paid leave
  • Flexible work arrangements with possibility of work-from-home – good for single parents, women, minorities, etc.
Your responsibilities will include: 
Analyzing user requirements and translating them into technical specifications
Developing, testing and deploying software applications and systems in a variety of programming languages and frameworks
Implementing best practices and standards in software engineering, code quality, performance, security, and documentation
Troubleshooting and resolving software issues and defects
Conducting code reviews and providing feedback to enhance code quality and maintenance
Researching and evaluating new technologies and tools for software development processes and best practices
Mentoring and coaching junior software engineers and sharing knowledge and expertise.
Ideal Profile
Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field
5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer or Software Developer
Proficient in one or more programming languages, such as Java, C#, Python, or JavaScript
Experience with web development technologies, such as HTML, CSS, React, Angular, or Node.js
Experience with cloud platforms and services, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
Experience with database systems and technologies, such as SQL, NoSQL, or MongoDB
Experience with software development tools and methodologies, such as Git, Agile, or DevOps
Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
What's on Offer?
Work within a company with a solid track record of success
Leadership Role
Opportunity to make a positive impact

Title: Technology Educator (Full Time Teacher, Only SG & PRs)
Description:
Are you looking for a teaching job that blends technology and education? Do you want to build a teaching career where you inspire young minds and help them develop future-ready skills?
At Computhink Kids SG, we specialize in coding education for children aged 7–16, guiding them from beginner programming to advanced levels through our structured 10-level curriculum. As a full-time teacher, you’ll help students develop logical thinking and creativity while preparing them for future opportunities in tech.
If you're passionate about education, inspiring young minds and want to start your career in teaching, apply now!
 Role Description – Full-Time Teaching Position
Note: This position is open to Singaporeans & Singapore Permanent Residents only. 
Take the next step in your teaching career and bring coding to life for the next generation.
We are hiring full-time teachers who are passionate about educating the young and want to make a difference. Whether you’ve coded in school, worked on personal projects, or are just starting your journey into teaching, we’ll provide training to help you succeed.
 What We’re Looking For
✅ Diploma or Degree holders from any field – IT background is a plus, but not required.
✅ Passion for teaching and education – no prior experience needed, just a willingness to learn!
✅ Strong communication skills and the ability to manage small, interactive classrooms.
✅ Interest in working with children and fostering their creativity, problem-solving, and logical thinking skills.
✅ Ex-MOE Teachers with no programming background are encouraged to apply
 Your Responsibilities as a Technology Educator
✅ Teach & Inspire – Conduct engaging teaching sessions using beginner-friendly platforms like Scratch, Minecraft progressing to Python and JavaScript.
✅ Curriculum-Based Teaching – Follow our structured education program to ensure students meet key learning milestones.
✅ Plan & Personalize Lessons – Adapt teaching methods to suit different learning styles.
✅ Support Extracurricular Learning – Participate in coding competitions, student showcases, and holiday camps.
 Why Join Computhink?
Structured Training Program – We train you in teaching methods and coding so you can grow in your role.
Career Growth in Education – Clear pathway to Senior Educator and Lead Educator roles.
Competitive Salary & Perks – Performance incentives and weekend allowances.
Work-Life Balance – Enjoy a 5-day workweek with breaks during major holidays.
 What You’ll Need to Succeed in this Teaching Position
 Strong technical aptitude – even if you’re not an IT expert, we’ll train you.
A diploma or degree in any field (Education, IT, Science or Computer Science is a bonus).
A genuine interest in education jobs and MOE careers, with a passion for mentoring students.

Title: Robotic Software Development Engineer (Process Robotisation), ARTC
Company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
Description:
Job Description
Candidate applying for this position shall assist in research and development AI-based robotics solution particularly in the domain of robotic manipulation that deliver impactful research and industrial deployment outcomes.
Roles and Responsibilities
-Collaborate within a cross-functional team of technical experts to develop and optimize state-of-the-art robotic algorithms.
-Continuously testing, improving or debug existing software modules.
-Develop machine learning based algorithms for toolpath planning strategy.
-Leverage 3D simulation tools for performance analysis of robotic algorithm validation.
-UI/UX design.
-Collaborate with other team members to integrate software solution into robotic platform.
-Assist in executing research programs and projects, ensuring timely delivery of milestones.
Job Requirements
-Degree in Robotics, Computer Science, Mechatronics Engineering or equivalent.
-Preferably 2 years work experience in development and deployment of robotic algorithm for industry applications.
-Proficient in programming languages such as in C, C++, Python, JavaScript, and Git.
-Proficient in robot programming using Robot Operating System (ROS) and Linux environment.
-Experience with AI/ML frameworks and computer vision tools (such as TensorFlow, Pytorch, OpenCV, PCL) added advantage.
-Experience with 3D simulation tools (such as Gazebo, Issac SIM).
-Hands-on experience with industrial robots and automation hardware.
-Proficient in industrial & collaborative robot programming. PLC programming is added advantage.
-Knowledge of robot manipulation and kinematics.
-Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
-Result-orientated, independent and a self-driven team player

We are seeking a talented and motivated Software Engineer to join our team at SoundEye Pte. Ltd. As part of our innovative organisation, you will play a vital role in designing, developing, and maintaining our cutting-edge IoT and AI-driven solutions for healthcare and smart environments.

Collaborative work environment with career growth and learning opportunities.

Comfortable using online tools and learning new ones

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Requirements: Work with stakeholders to define and clarify functional requirements and scope to deliver robust cost-effective solutions. |
Description:
About the Opportunity
This role in our technology squad is embedded in a high-caliber, cross-functional team that develops and executes our exciting technology strategy to deliver better outcomes for our businesses and customers.
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be working with an agile and innovative team and build on your technical expertise with a myriad of technologies, projects and platforms to deliver our business priorities and conquer technical challenges.
What You'll be Doing
Support the delivery of projects in all aspects of Software Development Life Cycle including system analysis, design, development, quality assurance, UAT, maintenance and ongoing support.
Develop pragmatic and fit for purpose solutions of high technical quality.
Work with stakeholders to define and clarify functional requirements and scope to deliver robust cost-effective solutions.
Maintain software design, engineering processes and quality standards.
Identifying and addressing bottlenecks in the application or broader infrastructure.
Assist with ad-hoc duties assigned by Manager.
What We Are Looking for
Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or related fields.
At least 4 years' experience in full stack C#, PHP development & Flutter
Knowledge of .NET Core and Symphony framework or equivalent. Knowledge of front-end technologies including Vue.JS, CSS3, JavaScript, and HTML5.
Understanding of object-oriented programming.Proficient with code versioning tools including Git
Familiarity with MySQL/MS SQL databases and Stored Procedure.
Highly collaborative team player, detail-oriented and passionate about technology
Ability to thrive in fast-paced, exciting environment
We regret to inform that only shortlisted applicants will be notified for an interview.
To learn more about our Organization, please visit https://www.alliancehealthcare.com.sg

Title: Research Engineer, Intelligent Product Verification (IPV), ARTC
Company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
Requirements: -Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and deliver high-quality integrated solutions. | Job Requirements: |
Description:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Research Engineer to join our team focused on developing cutting-edge AI models for vision inspection. This role involves leveraging state-of-the-art computer vision and machine learning techniques to solve complex manufacturing inspection challenges.

Responsibilities:
-Design, develop, and optimize AI models for image-based vision inspection tasks.
-Implement and fine-tune state-of-the-art models such as YOLO, Yolact, DeepLabV3, Vision Transformers, and others.
-Develop and maintain Python-based pipelines for data preprocessing, model training, and evaluation.
-Research and implement innovative algorithms to improve model accuracy and efficiency.
-Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and deliver high-quality integrated solutions.
-Document research findings, experimental results, and software implementations.
-Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI and computer vision technologies.

Job Requirements:
-Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
-Strong proficiency in Python programming.
-Expertise in deep learning frameworks like PyTorch (mandatory) and TensorFlow (preferred).
-Hands-on experience with computer vision models, including YOLO, Yolact, DeepLabV3, Vision Transformers, etc.
-Familiarity with image processing techniques and libraries such as OpenCV.
-Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
-Strong communication and excellent writing skills
-Have a strong work ethic, and able to work on own initiative.
-Team player, communicate efficiently, be flexible and details oriented.

Title: Research Engineer / Snr Research Engineer (Full-Stack Engineer), IHPC
Company: Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
Requirements: The Centre for Advanced Technologies in Online Safety (CATOS; https://www.catos.sg) was established in 2023 to host Singapore's Online Trust and Safety (OTS) Programme, a national research programme that leads the advancement of whole-of-nation technology capabilities to monitor and tackle online harms. The Systems Engineering Pillar of CATOS focuses on translational research and development, including evaluating, testing and integrating research output into needle-moving applications. One of the major outcomes will be a technological platform with an integrated suite of deep tech OTS engines, which analyses various internet sites and platforms for fast-trending harmful online content, such as non-factual claims, deepfakes, and hateful and toxic content. Different combinations of OTS engines can then be integrated and adapted to address the specific requirements of various stakeholders. | JOB REQUIREMENT: |
Description:
The Centre for Advanced Technologies in Online Safety (CATOS; https://www.catos.sg) was established in 2023 to host Singapore's Online Trust and Safety (OTS) Programme, a national research programme that leads the advancement of whole-of-nation technology capabilities to monitor and tackle online harms. The Systems Engineering Pillar of CATOS focuses on translational research and development, including evaluating, testing and integrating research output into needle-moving applications. One of the major outcomes will be a technological platform with an integrated suite of deep tech OTS engines, which analyses various internet sites and platforms for fast-trending harmful online content, such as non-factual claims, deepfakes, and hateful and toxic content. Different combinations of OTS engines can then be integrated and adapted to address the specific requirements of various stakeholders.
  This role will be responsible for translating research outcomes (e.g., CATOS technologies and OTS engines) into meaningful applications to address the specific needs of various user groups, including public and private agencies, as well as the general public.
  The candidate will assume the following roles and responsibilities: 
Code, develop, and test front-end and back-end components for web applications.
Work with software developers to enhance core platforms and solutions.
Develop documentation for the implemented solution.
Follow Agile project management framework.
Work and communicate well with other team members.
JOB REQUIREMENT:
Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
At least 3 years of relevant work experience.
Demonstrable and relevant commercial and/or enterprise software project management experience and skills.
Programming skills in Python are essential.
Experience with the Linux platform is essential.
Experience with web servers (e.g., Apache), browser-based applications, and databases such as MySQL.
Able to create complex and interactive UI using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript that function across multiple platforms and environments.
Experience with web libraries and frameworks such as Flutter, ReactJS, Bootstrap, Jquery, and CSS pre-processing frameworks like Sass or Less.
Solid understanding of HTTP protocols, AJAX, and RESTful services.
Solid understanding of networking concepts, including TCP/IP and HTTP protocols.
Hands-on experience with cloud environments, preferably Digital Ocean, AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Good knowledge on CI/CD pipelines. (e.g. Bitbucket, GitLab)
Proactive team player with strong communication skills.
Strong understanding and experience with Agile methodologies and processes.
Good communication and interpersonal skills for working in a multicultural work environment.
Strong understanding of algorithms. (i.e., The Art of Programming by Donald Knuth)
Proficient in clean coding principles. (i.e., Clean Code by Robert Martin)
If you have accomplished any of the following, please include them in your cover letter:  
You have won a programming competition.
You have independently built a software project. (any programming language)
You enjoy solving challenging programming problems. Please describe one problem you’ve solved (max 1 page)
You have been trained under Agile Software Development framework.
Our research and engineering work is highly interdisciplinary, agile, and pragmatic. The candidate will collaborate closely with a team that embraces agile software development.
We expect everyone to take ownership of their role, responsibilities, and tasks.
We encourage everyone to speak up when they have feedback or ideas for improvement.
We provide honest feedback to one another, which can be tough at times, but it fosters rapid learning.
We care about each other’s professional growth and well-being.
When applying, please share with us one project you have built fully on your own or a challenging technical problem you have solved (max 1 page).
  Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Data Scientist - Mining & Energy Sector
Description:
The role of Data Scientist in the energy and natural resources industry will involve analysing complex datasets to deliver actionable insights and drive business decisions. This position requires a strong analytical mindset and a passion for leveraging data to solve industry-specific challenges.
Client Details
This organisation is a prominent player in the energy and natural resources industry, known for its commitment to innovation and operational excellence. With a sizeable workforce and a focus on sustainable practices, the company operates across multiple locations, delivering impactful solutions in its field.
Description
Key Responsibilities:
Data Strategy Development: Design and execute a comprehensive data strategy in alignment with organizational goals and growth plans.
Data Modeling: Develop, implement, and optimize data models for both structured and unstructured data sources.
Machine Learning & Deep Learning: Build, train, validate, and deploy ML/DL models to solve complex business problems and automate decision-making.
Data Mining & Statistical Analysis: Leverage advanced analytics, data mining, and statistical techniques to uncover trends and generate strategic insights.
Pattern Recognition & Predictive Modeling: Design systems that identify patterns and forecast outcomes to enhance operational efficiency and mitigate risks.
Statistical Innovation: Develop novel statistical models and algorithms to support specialized analytics and complex business questions.
Data Governance: Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security by defining and maintaining governance standards and best practices.
Insight Implementation: Collaborate with stakeholders to translate insights into practical, scalable solutions that drive measurable business impact.
Profile
A successful Data Scientist should have:
A degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience in data modeling, machine learning, and advanced analytics.
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Solid understanding of big data platforms and cloud-based analytics (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear business value.
Experience working with cross-functional teams and delivering end-to-end data science solutions.
Experience working with data on mining, energies or industrial sector
Job Offer
Opportunities to work on challenging projects in a thriving industry.
A supportive and collaborative company culture that values professional growth.
Access to continuous learning and development programmes.
If you are ready to take the next step in your career as a Data Scientist, we encourage you to apply and explore this exciting opportunity in the energy and natural resources sector.
To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Hashegi Hanjaya on +62 21 2958 8856.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Peluang Karir
Sebagai Machine Learning Engineer, Anda akan memainkan peran kunci dalam mengembangkan solusi berbasis AI dan machine learning yang membawa dampak besar bagi bisnis kami. Kandidat terbaik akan memiliki pemahaman teknis yang kuat, kemampuan pemecahan masalah yang hebat, dan antusiasme untuk mengembangkan produk canggih yang mengubah masa depan.
Tanggung Jawab Utama
Identifikasi, analisis, membersihkan, dan kurasi data untuk fine-tuning
Melakukan LLM fine-tuning dan adaptasi sesuai kebutuhan
Bereksperimen dengan hyperparameter untuk mencapai performa model optimal
Merancang, membangun, dan mengoptimalkan model machine learning agar sesuai dengan kebutuhan
Mengevaluasi dan memvalidasi kinerja model machine learning, mengidentifikasi area perbaikan, dan menerapkan penyempurnaan yang diperlukan
Berkolaborasi dengan tim produk dan software engineer untuk mengintegrasikan model ke dalam produk dan solusi
Membantu membangun infrastruktur dan arsitektur machine learning yang kokoh dan dapat diskalakan (GPU, VRAM, tools lainnya)
Mendokumentasikan proses fine-tuning dari eksperimen, metode, performa, dan pemilihan arsitektural
Keterampilan dan Kualifikasi yang Dibutuhkan
Gelar sarjana atau master di bidang Ilmu Komputer, Machine Learning, Matematika, Statistika, AI, atau bidang terkait
Minimal 2 tahun pengalaman sebagai Machine Learning/NLP Engineer atau peran serupa
1 tahun pengalaman dalam LLM fine-tuning
Kemampuan bahasa pemrograman Python dan data manipulation libraries (Pandas, Numpy)
LLM fine-tuning libraries (transformers, datasets, peft (LoRA/QLoR), dan trl (SFTTrainer)
Deep learning frameworks (PyTorch/TensorFlow)
Kemampuan pemecahan masalah yang baik dan kemampuan berpikir analitis
Komunikasi verbal dan tertulis yang sangat baik
Antusiasme untuk belajar dan menerapkan teknologi machine learning terbaru
Manfaat Menarik
Gaji kompetitif
Kesempatan untuk terlibat dalam proyek-proyek inovatif 
Lingkungan kerja yang kolaboratif dan mendukung, mendorong pertumbuhan profesional
Tentang PT Bajau Escorindo
PT Bajau Escorindo adalah perusahaan teknologi terkemuka di Indonesia yang berkomitmen untuk mengembangkan solusi inovatif berbasis AI dan machine learning yang mendorong kemajuan digital. Dengan pertumbuhan yang pesat dan tim yang penuh semangat, kami mencari talenta terbaik untuk bergabung dengan kami dalam perjalanan transformasi teknologi kami.
