Title: Software Engineer
Requirements: Design, develop, and implement software applications that meet business requirements |
Description:
About the role

As a Software Engineer at Laksana Bus and Coach, you will play a crucial role in developing and enhancing the company's technology solutions. Joining our dynamic team in Semarang, Jawa Tengah, you will work on a full-time basis to create innovative software that powers our operations and drives our business forward.
What you'll be doing
Design, develop, and implement software applications that meet business requirements
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project goals and translate them into technical solutions
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code using industry-standard practices
Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging to ensure software quality
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in software engineering
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our software development processes
What we're looking for
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a software engineer or developer
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as C# and Kotlin
Familiarity with Kotlin/Jetpack Compose Multiplatform is an advantage
Experience with database management systems and RESTful API development
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Good communication and collaboration skills
About us

Laksana Bus and Coach is a leading provider of transportation solutions in Indonesia. With a strong focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, we have been shaping the industry for over 45 years. Our mission is to create sustainable and efficient transportation systems that connect communities and drive economic growth. Join us on this exciting journey!
Apply now to become our next Software Engineer and be a part of the Laksana Bus and Coach team.

Title: Endpoint security engineer
Description:
Endpoint Security Engineer to be assigned in Integra
As Endpoint Security Engineer, you will assist in monitoring, maintaining, and improving the security of customer's endpoint devices—including laptops, desktops, and mobile devices. Working closely with senior team members, you’ll gain valuable experience in endpoint protection tools, threat detection, and security best practices.
  Key Responsibilities
Assist in managing and supporting endpoint protection tools (e.g., antivirus, EDR/XDR, DLP).
Monitor endpoint security alerts and escalate incidents as needed.
Coordinate with other security systems and teams to ensure effective threat response
Prepare daily and monthly incident and monitoring reports
 Requirements
A degree or diploma in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Technology – it is a must
Experience 2 years.
Basic understanding of endpoint protection tools and cybersecurity principles.
Familiarity with operating systems (Windows, macOS, and/or Linux).
Strong interest in cybersecurity and eagerness to grow in the field.
Basic scripting knowledge (PowerShell, Python, or Bash) is a plus.
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work well in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Ready to work under shift and work in banking area

Title: Quality Assurance Developer
Requirements: Qualifications: | Strategic Testing: Contribute to designing meticulous testing strategies, scenarios, and plans, aligning them precisely with business and technical requirements. Your knack for creating innovative testing scenarios will be invaluable. | Effective Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and stakeholders, to grasp requirements thoroughly and communicate testing outcomes effectively, both orally and in writing. |
Description:
Qualifications: 
More than 2 year experience as SQA on web and mobile applications 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
A deep understanding of software testing concepts, methodologies, and tools, including but not limited to K6, Selenium, Cypress, NewRelic, Katalon, Cucumber, Firebase Testlab, and SonarQube. 
Proficiency in programming languages such as Go, Python, Vue.Js, TypeScript, Kotlin, Flutter, Swift iOS, NodeJs, SQL and NoSQL. Your ability to read and comprehend code is vital for effective testing. 
Proficient in using Cypress Automation JS, familiar with Page Object Model, Mochawasome Report.
Familiarity with Katalon automation is a plus. 
Familiar with using Postman Test API. 
Familiar with Mobile Testing manually/automation. 
Strong verbal and written communication skills are crucial, enabling you to articulate testing outcomes clearly and collaborate seamlessly with the team. 
A keen eye for detail is essential, ensuring meticulous testing and precise bug reporting. Your ability to identify intricate testing scenarios creatively sets you apart. 
Proficiency in automation testing using common tools for backend, frontend web, and mobile platforms (Android & iOS) is necessary. 
Previous experience in software testing or software development, especially with tools like Testrail / Testcollab and within Agile and Scrum frameworks, is a significant advantage. 
Proven ability to thrive under pressure, delivering high-quality results within tight deadlines. 
Can join as soon as possible
Your key responsibilities include: 
Comprehensive Testing: Expertly conduct both functional and non-functional testing, employing advanced tools like K6, Selenium, Cypress, NewRelic, Katalon, Cucumber, Firebase Testlab, and SonarQube to guarantee the software's robustness.
Strategic Testing: Contribute to designing meticulous testing strategies, scenarios, and plans, aligning them precisely with business and technical requirements. Your knack for creating innovative testing scenarios will be invaluable. 
Defect Documentation: Clearly document any defects or issues discovered during testing and meticulously report them to our development team, ensuring swift resolution and a seamless development cycle. 
Continuous Monitoring: Maintain a vigilant eye on software quality throughout the development lifecycle, swiftly identifying and addressing potential issues to maintain the highest standards. 
Automation Expertise: Collaborate in developing automated testing scripts, streamlining retesting and regression testing processes for increased efficiency and accuracy. 
Effective Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and stakeholders, to grasp requirements thoroughly and communicate testing outcomes effectively, both orally and in writing. 
Product Documentation: Create comprehensive and precise product documentation, ensuring that every aspect of our software's functionality is well-documented for future reference.
Having knowledge of Odoo or experience in testing Odoo-based systems will be considered a strong plus.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
    Job Description
Software Engineer will work in a cross-functional project team to ensure a multitude of systems across products, business, and operations integrate efficiently.
You’ll be responsible for designing, building, improving, or maintaining Traveloka services related to new products, business models, business growth, market expansion and process optimization. In addition, you will be Identifying pain points in internal business processes and developing effective, reliable and scalable solutions to work within the expected complexity of the processes.
You’ll be expected to deliver the best in class architecture, solution and code. The successful candidate will encounter challenges related to information systems, business process and technology.
    Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent from a reputable university with good academic results is preferred.
Having minimum 1-2 years of experience in software engineering (Java), application development or system development + experience in RDBMS and NoSQL databases.
Strong object-oriented analysis and design skills.
Experience in version control (Git/SVN/Mercurial) and familiarity with development collaboration tools (GitHub/Phabricator/BitBucket).
Experience in CI/CD like Jenkins/Travis CI/TeamCity and related technologies is a plus.
Experience in AWS/GCP/Azure and other technologies like Ansible, Containers, Kubernetes etc is a plus.
Passion in software engineering, application development, or systems development.
Good business acumen, excellent problem skills and broad understanding of software and system design.
Comfortable working up and down the technology stack.
Curiosity to explore creative solutions and try new things to solve challenging problems to pull it all together into a user accepted solution.
Participation in multiple end-to-end implementations of system integration, data migration, internal business applications, or configuring vendor-provided solutions.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and influence skills and personal maturity.
  If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Title: Project Manager (ERP & Digital Transformation)
Requirements: Lead requirements gathering, validation, and change control. | Job Requirement |
Description:
Aice is on a mission to accelerate our digital transformation journey, and we’re looking for a hands-on ERP Project Manager to lead the way. In this role, you’ll be at the heart of our system modernization—driving critical projects like ERP, DMS, WMS, and more.
If you're passionate about tech-driven change and thrive in dynamic environments, this is your chance to make real impact in a growing FMCG company.
Role Purpose
Manage ERP and related systems projects as part of the company's digital transformation, coordinating business, vendors, and IT teams to ensure on-time, on-budget, high-quality delivery.
Key Responsibilities
Define project scope, schedule, and budget; track progress and control risks.
Manage multiple projects (ERP, DMS, WMS, Asset systems, etc.).
Coordinate vendors; monitor contract execution and quality of deliverables.
Lead requirements gathering, validation, and change control.
Drive UAT, acceptance, and go-live planning.
Ensure compliance with corporate security standards and local regulations.
Support user training and change management.
Job Requirement
Bachelor's degree or above; major in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration preferred.
5+ years in IT project management; 3+ years in ERP or enterprise systems.
Experience in FMCG, supply chain, or manufacturing is a plus.
Experience in outsourcing and vendor management.
Knowledge of ERP modules and integration flows.
Familiar with project management methodologies (Agile/Waterfall).
Strong budget and schedule control skills.
Proficient in MS Project, Jira, or similar tools.
Fluent in English (proficient in Chinese is a plus).
Excellent communication and coordination skills.
Result-oriented, able to work under pressure.
Strong problem-solving and risk management skills.
Open to placement in Pantai Indah Kapuk and available for business travel.

Title: Software Engineer (Java)
Description:
✅ Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. (Able to join quickly).
5–8 years of hands-on experience as a Software Engineer in the tech industry.
Prior experience in the financial services, banking, or fintech industry is a strong advantage.
Strong expertise in Java (Java 21).
Proficient in backend frameworks such as Spring Boot, JPA/Hibernate.
Experienced in developing and consuming RESTful APIs, working with JSON, and integrating microservices using Kafka, RabbitMQ, or gRPC.
Skilled in working with both relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
Comfortable using Git and collaborating through platforms like GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket.
Familiar with CI/CD pipelines and deploying to staging/production environments.
🛠️ Responsibilities:
Design, develop, test, and maintain robust backend systems using Java 21, adhering to modern software engineering best practices.
Build efficient, scalable, and maintainable software architecture.
Collaborate closely with frontend developers, QA engineers, DevOps, and business stakeholders to ensure seamless system integration and functionality.
Participate in architecture discussions and technical decision-making processes.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines and modern automation workflows.
Ensure system stability, security, and high performance under demanding conditions.
Take initiative in identifying and solving problems with strong attention to detail.

Title: Data Analyst Manager
Description:
Duties, Functions and Responsibilities 
Responsible for collation, preparation and analysis of students completion data
To coordinate with analytics team on data relating to completion
Point person to check the data being used by the operations
Ensure consistency, reliability, and timely reporting of data for decision-making.
Requirement
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or data science roles.
At least 1 years of proven experience in a leadership or managerial capacity overseeing data teams or analytics projects.
Technical Skill
Proficiency in SQL for data querying.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or similar.
Strong working knowledge of Excel or Google Sheets for data modeling and analysis.
Familiarity with statistical methods and predictive modeling; Python or R experience is a plus.
Understanding of data warehouse structures and ETL processes.
Soft Skills
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
Strong communication and storytelling abilities to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Leadership skills with the ability to manage and mentor a team effectively.
Project management capabilities, including the ability to prioritize, multitask, and deliver on deadlines.
Familiarity with data governance, compliance, and data privacy principles.
Ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
Fluent in English (written and spoken); proficiency in other languages is a plus.
